She still runs this business, but she now sells her snacks at the school in which she works and at home because she still needs to receive her degree, and she is only paid 200.00 PEN a month for her services as a teacher. With the first loan of 300.00 PEN, which were repaid in 4 monthly installments, she purchased cakes and candy in order to sell them. With this loan of 400.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 monthy installments, she will use 200.00 PEN to make Peruvian barbecued chicken, 100.00 PEN to purchase sweets, and the remaining 100.00 PEN to purchase jewelry. Flor dreams of establishing a school in a marginalized area and of providing social help.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy and jewelry

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La señora Florentina L. B. pertenece al banco comunal San L., tiene 48 años y vive en la calle Los Ángeles  54 del caserío de  Motil distrito de Agallpampa provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta el tercer año de primaria y no siguió estudiando porque en Motil no había más grados de instrucción en la escuela.
 Se casó con el señor Víctor Pesantes con quien tienen 4 hijos, dependen de ella 2 hijos.
Florentina vende ropa interior en Motil y en Trujillo. Compra su mercadería en el Mayorista de Trujillo y vuelve a vender en Motil. Manifiesta también que en algunos caseríos realizan el trueque, consistente en cambiar animales por ropa. Su negocio lo realiza en forma ambulatoria. 
Con su primer préstamo que fue de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas, incrementó su negocio.
Con este crédito de 1500 soles que serán cancelados en 6 cuotas, piensa invertir en su negocio comprando enaguas porque se vende mucho en la zona de la sierra.
Florentina sueña con poner un centro comercial.
texts.en:
Ms. Florentina L. B. is a member of the San L. microfinance institute. She is 48 years old and lives on Los Ángeles 54 Street in the hamlet of Motil, in the Agallpampa province of Otuzco in the department of La Libertad Perú. She studied up to the third grade in elementary school but did not continue with her education because they did not have higher grades in the schools of Motil. She married Víctor Pesantes, with whom she has 4 children, two of whom are her dependants. Florentina sells undergarments in Motil and Trujillo. She purchases her merchandise at the wholesale market in Trujillo and then sells it in Motil. She states that she also barters in certain hamlets by exchanging animals for clothing. She works as a street vendor. With her first loan of 300.00 PEN, which was repaid in 4 monthly installments, she expanded her business. With this loan of 1,500.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 monthly installments, she plans on investing in her business by purchasing underskirts because they are in high demand in the sierra zone. Florentina dreams of opening up a shopping center.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wholesale women’s undergarments

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 44 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos.  Día a día trabaja cuidando sus campos de cultivo, lo viene haciendo durante 30 años consecutivos, siembra productos nativos de su región y también alfalfa, con la cual alimenta a los cuyes que cría, esta actividad le permite esperar pacientemente y sin preocupaciones económicas el tiempo de la cosecha, donde verá el fruto de su trabajo.  Su diaria jornada desde muy temprano por la mañana consiste: ir a cortar el pasto para sus cuyes, almacenarlo, para que no esté mojado, y lo que hizo secar del día anterior, se lo da a comer a sus cuyes, luego regresa para dedicarse a sus hijos. Julia se esfuerza por sus hijos y también porque ella disfruta diariamente de realizar estas labores. Solicita este préstamo con el que podrá comprar  más cuyes machos, como reproductores de su granja, y también sacos de abono, con el que podrá seguir cultivando alfalfa en otra extensión de terreno que tiene.
texts.en:
Julia is 44 years old and lives with her husband and three children. She works day to day, tending the agricultural fields, where she is worked for the last 30 years. She plants native goods from her region, as well as alfalfa, with which she feeds her guinea pigs. This activity allows her to patiently wait, without economic worries, for the harvest, when she will see the fruits of her labor. Her daily journey which begins very early in the morning consists of : she cuts hay for her guinea pigs, stores it so that it cannot get wet, and collects dry hay from the day before to giver to her guinea pigs; she then returns home to take care of her children. Julia is strong for her children and also because she enjoys her daily work. She is requesting a loan with which she will purchase more male guinea pigs, as reproducers for her herd, as well as sacks of fertilizer, with which she can continue to cultivate alfalfa in another area of land she has.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase male guinea pigs for breeding, and fertilizer for alfafa cultivation

loans.name: Elisa Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia sueña en grande, vela por el porvenir educativo y personal de su hija, única persona con quien vive, pues ha proyectado abrir cabinas de Internet en su casa (por ahora sólo cuenta con 2 PC's en casa, el negocio: tipeos) para lo que necesitaría implementar su casa en cuanto a seguridad, así como ver por la venta de licores que expende en su bodega. Ella siempre ve todos los medios posibles en pro de sacar adelante a su hija.

Es por ello que requiere de un préstamo de 1600 soles, los que financiarían su pequeño proyecto de negocio, y vida a la vez, por lo que significaría para ella y su hija.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia drams big. She sees for the educational and personal wellbeing of her daughter, who is the only person with whom she lives, since she has planned to open cyber-cafe booths in her home (for now she only has 2 PCs in her home, with which she does typing for a business). She will need to implement better security in her home to set up that business, as well as the sale of liquors she sells in her general store. She is always looking for every way possible to get her daughter ahead. This is why she is requesting a loan of 1600 Soles, with which she'll finance her small business project, and life at the same time for herself and her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Luis Lopez Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply of goods for her liquor store and to purchse more computers to set up a cyber-cafe service, and the respective ambience needed

loans.name: Irene Maria

texts.es:
La señora Irene María Gutiérrez E. D. Ucañán pertenece al Banco Comunal JERID en Acción II, tiene 49 años y vive en la calle Manuel Arévalo 180 del pueblo joven Aurora Díaz  distrito D. Salaverry provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Irene estudió enfermería Técnica, no continuó sus estudios porque se casó, pero se divorció por falta D. comprensión, actualmente está casada con Martín Ucañán con quien tiene un hijo D. 10 años.
Irene empezó su negocio como artesana haciendo peluches, implementó su negocio con la venta D. ropa y abarrotes actualmente es socia con su cuñada Elvira en la tienda D. abarrotes que ella atienD.. Su negocio se ubica en su casa.
 Recuerda que con el primer préstamo D. 300 soles devueltos en 4 meses compró material para sus peluches.
Con este crédito D. 1000 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas piensa comprar gaseosas, medias y otros materiales para la tienda.
Irene sueña con tener una gran boutique.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irene María Gutiérrez E. of Ucañán belongs to the JERID Community Bank on Acción II. She is 49 years old and lives on Manuel Arévalo 180 Street in Joven Aurora Díaz in the Salaverry district, Trujillo in La Libertad, Perú. Irene studied to be a hospital technician. She didn’t continue her studies because she got married, but she got divorced because of a lack of tolerance. At present, she is married to Martín Ucañán, with whom she has a ten-year-old son. Irene began her business as a craftswoman, making stuffed animals. She stocked her business with clothes and groceries. At this time, she is a member with her sister-in-law Elvira in the grocery store that she takes care of. Her business is located in her house. With her first loan of 300 soles, which was repaid in 4 months, she bought material for her stuffed animals. With this loan of 1000 soles, which she will repay in 6 installments, she plans to buy sodas, stockings, and other materials for the store. Irene dreams of having a big boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different products for her grocery store

loans.name: Lorena Ramona

texts.es:
Doña Lorena Ramona D., tiene 59 años de edad su estado civil es casada  tiene 4 hijos, ninguno de sus hijos depende ella; su compañero de vida trabaja conduciendo un taxi, ella distribuye mercadería general ropa y calzado  uno de sus propósitos es mantener la actividad en un 100% atendiendo así las necesidades  de sus clientes de esta forma podrá obtener sus ingreso propio que hasta los momentos a sido el que a suministro del  el sustentó de su familia  mas  la pequeña contribución que el esposo aporta.

En cuanto a su actividad económica siendo esta la venta de ropa variada, calzado nacional el cual compra en Managua, y comercializa en mercados locales y clientes fijos tiene aproximadamente 6 años de ejercer, el cual da inicio como una alternativa al desempleo a la fecha ha sido un medio importante dentro de los ingresos para la familia debido a las diferentes situaciones económicas en las que se ha encontrado, El destino del financiamiento  fue para hacer las compras para el capital de trabajo como es La compra de ropa, calzado y cosméticos para poder mejorar su negocio teniendo una variedad de productos. Teniendo la necesidad de incrementar su inventario y quizás mas adelante instalar un negocio fijo, en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Doña Lorena Ramona D. is 59 years old, married and has 4 children, all of whom are independent. Her life companion works as a taxi driver. She is a distributor of clothes and shoes. Doña Lorena’s intention is to maintain 100% of her business activity serving her customers’ needs in such a way that she will make enough money to supplement the small amount that her partner earns.

For about 6 years, Doña Lorena has been engaged in the business of buying a variety of clothes and shoes in Managua and selling them in local markets. She started this work as an alternative to unemployment, and the income it has generated has been important to the family in difficult economic times. She plans to use the working capital to purchase clothes, shoes and cosmetics to increase the variety of products that she sells. She needs to increase her inventory and maybe later she will set up a stationary business in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia C. M., tiene 56 años  pertenece al Banco Comunal  Mujeres del Milenium  y vive en la Mz 14 lote 6 Víctor Raúl Parte Alta del distrito del Porvenir provincia de Trujillo departamento de la Libertad Perú.
Tiene instrucción superior incompleta y estudió 2 años básicos de costura.
Se casó con Enrique Francisco Córdoba, con el que tuvo dos hijos, que actualmente ya trabajan.
Julia cosía y no se atrevía a hacer otra cosa, pero ahora vende briquetas, leña, cose ropa y vende golosina y comida.
Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas, no invirtió su préstamo porque tenía miedo no poder reponer, a partir del segundo préstamo ya empezó a trabajar.
Con este crédito de  1000 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará briquetas (carbón de piedar), telas para confeccionar y otros insumos y leña porque después se pone muy escaso.
Sueña con ampliar su negocio y dar trabajo al que no tiene. Pero su gran pasión es la Educación inicial.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia C. M. is 56 years old and belongs to the Women of the Millenium Community Bank. She lives in Mz 14, lot 6, Victor Raúl Parte Alta in the Porvenir district of Trujillo, La Libertad, Perú. She didn’t complete her higher education and studied the basics of sewing for two years. She married Enrique Francisco Córdoba, with whom she has 2 children, who are currently working. Julia used to sew and wouldn’t have dared to do anything else, but now she sells briquette, firewood, sews clothes, and sells sweets and food. She repaid she first loan of 300 soles in 4 installments. She didn’t invest the loan because she was afraid that she wouldn’t be able to repay it. Starting with her second loan, she began to work. With this loan of 1000 soles, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy briquettes, fabrics, and other supplies and firewood because later it will be scarce. She dreams of expanding her business and giving employment to someone without a job. Her great passion, however, is early education.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric at wholesale.  To buy briquettes and firewood.

loans.name: Karla Vanesa

texts.es:
La señora de nombre Karla Vanesa D. Sánchez quien tiene la edad de 27 años, el estado civil en que se encuentra es de acompañada tiene 4 hijos de nombre Yusbania Lizbeth Hernández que tiene 12 años y cursa el 1 año de secundaria, Sara Abigail Suazo que tiene 9 años y cursa el cuarto grado de primaria, Danilo José D. que cursa el sexto grado y Lázaro Josué D. quien tiene 2 años y no estudia, su conyugue trabaja con ella, las aspiraciones que ella tiene es poder lograr tener su propio tramo donde pueda vender sus productos sin tener que estar ofreciendo sus productos de forma ambulante. Otra de sus aspiraciones es poder brindarle a sus hijos estudios para que en un futuro se puedan defender como profesionales.

El tipo de negocio que tiene es la venta de bolsas plásticas y el negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado la terminal de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de trabajar en este negocio es de 9 años la forma en como ella inicia fue desde niña ya que su mama tenia este negocio y las encamino con este negocio pero después su mama se enfermo y dejo de trabajar  por lo que ante tal situación decidió experimentar por sus propios medios y no dejar caer el negocio por lo que tomo la decisión de continuarlo con los mismos clientes que tenia su mama, sumándose los clientes que ella había obtenido y piensa que algún podría obtener su propio tramo con un buen inventario de mercadería, la forma en como ella piensa usar el fondo es comprando mas variedades de bolsas de todos los tamaños, esta será  la opción que ella tendrá para poder ofertar a sus clientes la variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Karla Vanesa D. Sánchez is 27 years old and has four children between the ages of 2 and 12. Their names are Yusbania Lizbeth Hernández, Sara Abigail Suazo, Danilo José D., and Lázaro Josué D.. Except for the youngest, they are all in school. She and her partner work together. One of her aspirations is to have her own stall where she can offer her products instead of selling her products as a street vendor. Another hope of hers is to be able to offer her children a good education so that in the future they can be self-supporting professionals. Karla’s business, which she has had for 9 years, is selling plastic bags in the market at the terminal. She took over the business that her mother had established when Karla was a little girl. When her mother became ill and could no longer work, Karla did not want to let the business fall so she decided to experiment with the situation. She continued selling to her mother’s customers and she also was able to add new clients. She thinks that some day she will be able to get her own vending stall with a good inventory. The way she plans to use her loan is to buy a greater variety of bags of all sizes to offer to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Elena Marisol

texts.es:
Elena Marisol L. M. de la edad de 30 años, su estado civil es de casada  con 1 hijo, de seis meses de edad, su compañero de vida es comerciante, una de los sueñosella  desea ayudar a los gastos de la familia, de esta manera apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, y como microempresaria tiene la visión de negocio, teniendo como objetivo contribuir a realizar mejoras a su vivienda y poder brindarle un poco mas de condiciones ahora a su hijo, teniendo como sueño que en un futuro sus hijos tengan un lugar adecuado para vivir, con el esfuerzo que realizan. 

La actividad económica de doña Elena es la comercialización de mercadería en general, teniendo tiene 5 años  de ejercerla. Doña Elena empezó ofreciendo cosméticos de casa en casa a través de catalogo, para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes cada uno de los productos que ella ofrecía y mas tarde decidió invertir en ropa de dama y caballeros, pero no por catalogo sino por cuenta propia y por encargo, el cual detalla en sus planes de inversión que esta destinada  a la compra de ropa de dama, caballeros niños y otros para poder obtener de esta forma sus metas a realizar.
texts.en:
Elena Marisol L. M. is 30 years old. She is married and she has a 6-month old son. Her life partner is a business man. One of her dreams is to help cover the family expenses, and in this manner, help her husband with household costs. As a small business owner she has a business outlook, having an objective to remodel her home and to be able to provide better living conditions to her son. She dreams that in the future her children will have an adequate place to live as a product of their hard work.

Elena's occupations is the sales of general merchandise, having passed the past 5 years in the business. Elena started out selling cosmetics door to door by catalogue, to provide her clients with every one of the products. Later on she decided to invest in ladies and gentlemen's clothing but not through a catalogue, but by her own accord. Her investment plans are to purchase more clothing for ladies, gentlemen, and children, all as a way to meet her goals.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Lialiana Yajayda

texts.es:
Con 2 hijas menores, 1 de ellas en el colegio, y con su esposo (chofer) vive la señora Yajayda. Hace un mes decidió poner una tienda y, enhorabuena para su familia, le ha ido muy bien, sin embargo, sus comensales le exigen cada vez más productos y se le suelen acabar algunos rápidamente. Ella luce maravillada con sus hijas, sólo busca lo mejor para ellas, por lo que decidió poner la tienda en primer lugar (antes se dedicaba a trabajos eventuales, de muy poco e inestable rédito).

Para tan noble, maternal labor necesita de 500 soles como préstamo, lo que le posibilitaría la compra al por mayor de sus productos, incrementando sus ganancias y beneficios para sus menores hijas, a quienes adora.
texts.en:
Señora Yajayda lives with two young daughters, one of whom is in high school, and with her husband (a driver). It has been one month since she decided to open a store and, in a good time for her family, it has gone very well. Her clients demand more goods every time they come, and they have begun to return more quickly. She is shining with astonishment with her daughters, she only wants the best for them, and for them she decided to open the store in the first place (as before she worked at casual jobs, which paid very little and were very unstable.) This noble, maternal work needs 500 soles as a loan, which would make it possible for her to buy more of her products, increasing her profits, and benefiting her young daughters whom she adores.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To have more in her store and to buy toys to sell for Christmas

loans.name: Leidy Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Leidy Nancy Z. A. tiene 36 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del Mañana, también participa en el Vaso de leche y en el Comedor Popular de su comunidad, vive en la calle Manuel Gonzales Prada sin número en el distrito de de Agallpampa en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria pero ya no contó con más apoyo de su familia y no pudo continuar estudiando.
Se casó con Honorio Olguín Gamboa Castro y tiene dos hijos que son estudiantes.
Anteriormente tenía un mini mercado y el restaurant, pero no podía atender los dos negocios al mismo tiempo, entonces optó por quedarse con el restaurant, donde vende comida y todo tipo de bebidas, se ubica en la calle César Vallejo sin número en la esquina de la plaza de armas.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas compró arroz y azúcar para consumo del restaurant.
Con este crédito de 1000 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará gaseosa y cerveza para el restaurant.
Leidy sueña con viajar al extranjero con toda su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leidy Nancy Z. A. is 36 years old and belongs to the Women of Tomorrow Community Bank. She also participates in the Vaso de Leche (Glass of Milk) program and in the Comedor Popular (Soup Kitchen) in her community. She lives on Manuel Gonzales Prada Street in the Agallpampa district in Otuzco in La Libertad, Perú. She studied until the fifth year of secondary school but couldn’t count on the support of her parents, so couldn’t continue her education. She married Honorio Olguín Gamboa Casto and has two children who are studying. Earlier, she had a small store and a restaurant, but she couldn’t take care of two businesses at the same time. Then she decided to remain with the restaurant, where she sells food and all types of drinks. It is located on César Vallejo Street on the corner of Plaza de Armas. With her first loan of 300 soles, which was repaid in 4 installments, she bought rice and sugar for consumption in her restaurant. With this loan of 1000 soles, which will be repaid in 6 installments, she will buy soda and beer for the restaurant. Leidy dreams of travelling abroad with her whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies at wholesale

loans.name: Miguel Jeronimo

texts.es:
El nombre de este señor  es de Miguel Gerónimo T. R. el tiene la edad de 41 años, su estado civil es de soltero, tiene 1 hijo con la edad de 6 años recientemente cursa el 4 grado de primaria, su compañera de vida es ama de casa, los propósitos que don Miguel tiene es de poder proporciónale mejoras a su vivienda debido a que siempre que llueve pasa por incomodidades  en su vivienda, otros de sus deseos es poder mantener siempre el ritmo que tiene su venta ya que esta representa una de las principales fuentes de ingresos, otros de sus deseos es poder ayudar a su hijo en sus estudios universitarios ya que el expresa que no desea que su hijo  en un futuro no pueda defenderse por sus propios medios.

Don Miguel tiene la actividad económica de mercadería en general como lo es: venta de ropa, zapatos y  ropa para caballeros, el tiempo que Don Miguel  tiene  de tener este negocio es de 10 años y explica que la forma como empezó fue que su esposa ofrecía la mercadería  y le ayudaba, de así el empezó a poner mas interés por el negocio y  fue como  dio inicio a  la idea de empezar su propio negocio, el financiamiento lo necesita para capital de trabajo realizando sus compras en Managua y  comprar los productos que sus clientes necesitan.
texts.en:
Miguel Gerónimo T. R. is 41 years old, single, and has one son who is 6 years old and is in primary school. His life companion is a homemaker. He wants to make repairs to his home to keep out the rain. Another desire of his is to always be able to maintain the rhythm of his sales as this represents his main source of income. He also wants to help his son to study at the university because he wants his son to be able to support himself in the future. Don Miguel’s business is selling clothes, shoes and men’s clothing. He has run this business for 10 years. He explains that the way he started the business was that his companion offered the merchandise and helped him get set up. He needs financing to shop in Managua for the products that his customers need.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
La señora Albina Z. Pérez  tiene 62 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, vive en la calle Tomás Zolano Mz 7 lote 13 segunda etapa Victor Raul del distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta tercero de primaria y tuvo que dejar de estudiar para trabajar porque no tenía apoyo ya que fue huérfana.
Se casó de 17 años con el señor Víctor Villacorta, con quien tuvo 5 hijos, uno fallecido, todos sus hijos ya están separados, pero tiene a su cargo un nieto.
Compró una vaca y empezó a vender leche, ahora tiene 4 vacas de las cuales vende leche, sus animales los tiene en un lugar llamado El Carmelo en Virú, pero la leche la trae a Trujillo.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles cancelados en 4 cuotas compró comida para sus animales. (Melaza y forraje).
Con este crédito de 500 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 22 gallinas ponedoras y comida para vaca.
Albina sueña con hacer en un terreno grande un pozo tubular.
texts.en:
Albina Z. P., 62, belongs to the Mujeres al Progreso ("Women Forging Ahead") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She dropped out of school after only three years because she had to work, something about which she had no choice because there was no-one to support her when she was orphaned. At 17, she married Victor Villacorta with whom she has 5 children, one of whom has died. Her children no longer live with her but she's raising a grandson. She bought a cow to start a milk business; she now has 4 cows and sells the milk they produce. She keeps the cows in a place called El Carmelo in Viru, but she brings the milk to Trujillo [to sell]. With her first 300-soles loan, which she repaid in 4 installments, she bought feed for her cows. (Molasses and fodder.) With this 500-soles loan, to be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy 22 hens and food for the cows. Albina dreams of building a tube well one day.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hens and feed for livestock business.

loans.name: Gladys Milagros

texts.es:
La señora Gladis, que tiene una hijita que ya asistirá el próximo año al colegio, se dedica a la venta de zapatos hace 2 años en el norte del Perú, Trujillo, adonde viaja regularmente. Siendo madre soltera, son denodados los esfuerzos por criar a su hija (aunque no pase mucho tiempo con ella por el trabajo) pero ella va más alla: la tristeza de hoy por no pasar mucho tiempo con su hija la ve como la felicidad de mañana por la oportunidad que podría brindarle a su hija en el ámbito educativo y personal. Es loable su actitud y perseverancia, se debe a nadie más que su hija.

Y con respecto a su situación laboral, requiere de 1000 soles que sustentarían sus viajes a Trujillo y la compra del calzado a vender, en aras de poder aumentar sus ingresos para poder solventar el venidero año que será el estreno escolar de su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Ms. Gladis, who has a daughter that will enter school next year, has been dedicated to the sale of shoes for the last two years in the Northern Peruvian city of Trujillo, which she visits regularly. Being a single mother, her efforts to raise her daughter are indefatigable (although she is still separated from her daughter often because of work) to allow her daughter to have a better life: not allowing today's sadness to get in the way of tomorrow's happiness thanks to the opportunity that Gladis can offer her daughter in the educational and personal areas. Her attitude and perseverance are laudable, and they are because of her daughter. With respect to her occupation, Gladis requires 1000 soles to permit trips to Trujillo and the purchase of shoes to sell in the interest of improving her income to pay for the her small child's upcoming first year of schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fund trips to Trujillo where she will sell shoes

loans.name: Ana Basilia

texts.es:
En el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Ana R. se dedica con gran esfuerzo a su negocio de venta de productos de madera específicamente adornos y utensilios del hogar.

Una de las grandes dificultades que ella ha atravesado es que es madre soltera y con cinco hijos que mantener por lo que ha buscado la manera de salir adelante y se ha apoyado de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel el cual los ha utilizado para la compra de los productos. Una vez más solicita un nuevo crédito para llenar sus estantes de estos productos de madera y así ofrecerlos en su negocio en el mercado de Chinandega.
texts.en:
In the central market of the city of Chinandega, Ana Rios works hard to earn a living selling wooden products such as home decorations and utensils. One of the challenges that she's faced is being a single mother of five children and having to find a way to make better lives for them. She's been supported by loans from Ceprodel which she's used to buy the products that she sells. Now she's applying for a new loan so that she can fill her shelves with products and resell them in the Chinandega market.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Ana J. con gran esfuerzo se ha dedicado a su negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega de donde es originaria. Esta dama se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora que a pesar de las difíciles situaciones económicas que ha atravesado ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio.

Debido a que comenzó hace seis años con su negocio, hoy en día ha logrado mejorarlo y salir adelante con el mantenimiento de su hogar compuesto por sus dos pequeños hijos. No podemos obviar que ella es una madre soltera cuya labor es atender su negocio en el mercado y de igual forma atender a sus pequeños hijos.

La razón por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener el crédito para la compra de la ropa, cosméticos y productos personales para comercializarlos en su tramo.
texts.en:
Ana Jiron has established her clothes and cosmetics sales business with great effort. She operates the business in the central market of her native city, Chinandega. This lady is known to be very hard working, someone who despite having faced a difficult economic situation built a successful business.

She started the business six years ago and she's still improving it today. She's also managed to improve the lives of her family which is made up of her two small children. We can't forget that she is a single mother whose responsibility it is to tend to both her business in the market and her two kids.

Ana has approached Ceprodel to get a loan to buy clothes, cosmetics and personal products that she will resell.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Clarial

texts.es:
La venta de ropa y calzado es el negocio al cual se desempeña la señora Clarial P. C. en el mercado Central de Chinandega. Es importante destacar que día a día este mercado es muy visitado por los habitantes de la ciudad de Chinandega y es por este motivo que ella se esfuerza día a día para ofrecer su mercadería a sus clientes.

Para la señora Clarial este es el único ingreso que percibe por lo que tiene que mantener a sus dos pequeños hijos ya que es madre soltera y de igual forma tiene que mantener a su anciana madre que necesita de su apoyo. La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener el crédito oportuno que le permita la compra de calzado y de ropa para ofrecerla. Por eso espera que su crédito le sea otorgado para beneficio propio y de su familia.
texts.en:
Clarial P. C. sells clothing and shoes in the Central market of Chinandega. It is important to note that every day this marked is frequented by the inhabitants of Chinandega and it is for this reason that she works everyday to offer her merchandise to her customers. For Clarial this is her only income that she receives to support her two small children as she is a single mother and she also supports her elderly mother who needs her assistance. The reason she has approached Ceprodel is to obtain a loan that will enable her to buy shoes and clothing to sell. Therefore she hopes that her loan will be granted for her benefit and that of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing and shoes to sell

loans.name: Ana Milagritos

texts.es:
La señora Ana Milagritos H. F.  pertenece al banco comunal JERID Camino al Éxito II, tiene 31 años y vive en la calle Negreiros manzana 2 lote 2 pueblo joven Aurora Díaz del distrito de Salaverry provincia de Trujillo, departamento de la Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta segundo año de secundaria pero no continuo estudiando debido a que se casó con el señor Cristian Chirinos y tiene un hijo varón de 11 años y una hija mujer de 7 años.
Inició su negocio vendiendo marcianos, pero  como es una mujer que continuamente  analiza donde puede rendir mejor el negocio entonces incursionó en la compra venta de material para botes de madera y redes de pesca.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles pagados en 4 cuotas compró material para marcianos de hielo porque fue en la época de verano.
Con este crédito de 1000 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá en clavos y madera para botes.
Ana sueña con que un día Manuela Ramos crezca tanto como para poder brindar prestamos de mayor envergadura.
texts.en:
Ana Milagritos H. F. belongs to the JERID Camino al Exito II ("JERID Road to Success II") community bank. She is 31 years old and lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She dropped out of school after two years of high school to marry her husband Christian Chirinos. They have a son, 11, and a daughter, 7. She started out selling "marcianos" (a traditional sweet) but because she's always looking for ways to generate more revenue from the business, she jumped in to selling material for building small fishing boats and nets. With her first 300-soles loan, that she repaid in 4 installments, she bought material for iced marcianos because that's what her customers wanted when she got the loan in the summer. With this 1000-soles loan, to be repaid in 6 installments, she will invest in nails and wood for building small fishing boats. Ana dreams that one day Manuela Ramos grows so much that it can make loans of great scope.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for resale.

loans.name: Claribel

texts.es:
Claribel B. es una dama originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega el cual se dedica a laborar en el mercado central por medio de la venta de ropa y cosméticos comercializados todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta altas horas de la tarde.

Se ha destacado por ser una señora muy trabajadora que a pesar de los infortunios de la vida como lo es la crisis económica que ha atravesado, ha logrado salir adelante en la comercialización de sus productos.

La razón por la cual ha llegado a Ceprodel es para obtener el crédito con el cual comprar la mercadería como lo es la ropa y los cosméticos para su respectiva comercialización. Espera muy confiadamente que su crédito sea otorgado ya que se ha destacado como fiel cliente de Ceprodel habiendo cancelado sus anteriores 18 créditos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido en la institución.
texts.en:
Claribel B. is a woman originally from the city of Chinandega, who is dedicated to working in the central market through selling clothes and cosmetics in the very early hours of the morning until late into the afternoon every day. She stands out for being a very hardworking woman despite the misfortunes in her life, such as the economic crisis that she faced, but she has moved on by selling her products. The reason why Claribel came to Ceprodel is to obtain a loan with which she will buy merchandise like clothes and cosmetics. She waits confident that her loan will be granted since she has stood out as a loyal client who has repaid her previous 18 loans from Ceprodel on time and in a manner that was in accordance with the institution's established policies.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Darling Celeste

texts.es:
La señora Darling S. es una esforzada dama qeu se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde es originaria.

Esta dama es madre soltera y con dos hijos en obligación de mantener y por esta razón es que se desempeña grandemente en su negocio para suplir las necesidades de su hogar.

Hoy en día a la señora Darling le urge adquirir la carne para comercializarla y es por este motivo que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual comprar la carne y así comercializarla en su negocio.
texts.en:
Darling S. is a hardworking woman who sells products made from pork in the central market of Chinandega, the city where she was born. This woman is a single mother with two children to support. This is reason why she works so hard at her business in order to provide the necessities for her home. Today Darling urgently needs to buy meat to sell; for this reason she looks for help from Ceprodel to obtain a loan with which she can buy meat for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
La señora Anita Sánchez C.  tiene 42 años,  pertenece al Banco Comunal Hilos de Plata II y vive en la  Mz Y  Lote 8  Villa Judicial Sector Víctor Raúl – Manuel Arévalo distrito de Huanchaco.
Estudió primaria completa, no continuo por falta de apoyo, pero cuando llegó a Trujillo se matriculó en un Cenecape y aprendió Corte y Confección.
Se casó a los 24 años con el señor Vidal Mendoza Bravo con quien tienen dos hijas aun estudiantes.
Desde que terminó sus estudios de costura en al año 1992 se dedica a ello, sus clientes son sus vecinos y recibe contratos de las diversas instituciones para confeccionar uniformes, tal labor la realiza en su casa.
El monto del primer préstamo fue 200 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas con lo que incrementó su negocio.
Con este crédito de 200 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas  comprará telas, hilo y cierres, porque desea confeccionar ropa para vender.
Anita sueña con tener un gran taller.
texts.en:
Anita S. C., 42, belongs to the Hilos de Plata II ("Silver Threads II") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "distrito" of Huanchaco. She finished elementary school but there wasn't any money for her to go on. When she got to Trujillo, however, she entered a Cenecape (a kind of vocational school) and studied Cutting and Sewing. She married Vidal Mendoza Bravo when she was 24 years old and they have two daughters who are still in school. Since finishing her tailoring studies in 1992, she's made her living as a seamstress. Her customers are her neighbors and she receives orders for making uniforms from local institutions, work that she does at home. With her first 200-soles loan, which she repaid in 4 installments, Ana set up her business. With this 200-soles loan, to be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy cloth, thread and buttons because she wants to make clothes to sell. Ana dreams of owning a large workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth, thread and buttons for making clothes.

loans.name: Darling Scarleth

texts.es:
La señora Darling G. se dedica al negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos en el mercado central de Chinandega donde atiende desde hace 8 años. Es importante destacar que hoy en día el tramo de la señora G. requiere de inversión por lo que debe prestar mejores condiciones para brindar el servicio al cliente.

Es esta la razon por loa cual la señora Darling ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obeteenr el credito qeu le permita mejorar las condiciones de su negocio para lograr salir adelante en esta labor.
texts.en:
Darling G. is in the business of making and selling food in the central market of Chinandega, where she has been working for the past 8 years. It is important to note that today the area in which Mrs. G. works needs an investment so that she can provide better conditions for serving her customers. This is the reason why Darling has looked for help from Ceprodel to obtain a loan which will allow her to make improvements to her business so she can move forward with her work.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements to her work area.

loans.name: Gladis Elvira

texts.es:
Al ser 8 personas las que viven en su casa (esposo,2 hijos, 2 nietos y otros familiares) la señora Elvira es el principal sostén económico, sin embargo, no es mucho lo que recauda a partir D. sus 2 negocios, siempre tienD. a serle insuficiente el dinero a la hora D. adquirir los insumos necesarios y, por enD., sus ingresos no suelen incrementarse como realmente pudieran. A pesar D. su edad, ella sigue siendo el sustento D. todos sus hijos y nietos, siendo la persona con más responsabilidad en su hogar pero ella no declina ante nada, continúa su escarpado camino hacia la obtención D. una calidad D. vida adecuada para sus menores nietos, especialmente.

Requiere D. 1100 soles para tan noble labor, que le permitiría alcanzar sus sueños como madre y como abuela.
texts.en:
Though 8 people live in her home (her husband, two children, two grandchildren and other relatives), Mrs. Elvira provides the principal economic income for the family. In spite of running two businesses, she doesn't earn enough to support them all and always comes up short at the time of making basic purchases for the family. Her income has not increased sufficiently to meet the family's needs as she would have liked. In spite of her age, she is still the one who provides primary sustenance for her children and grandchildren, being the most responsible person in her home. However, she doesn't give up but continues her steep climb towards obtaining a more adecuate quality of life for her grandchildren. She needs a loan of $375 which will help her to realize her dreams as a mother and grandmother.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Financing of her businesses: sequined handicrafts and shoe sales

loans.name: Diana Estefanía

texts.es:
El negocio al que se dedica la señora Diana E. es a la venta de pollo en el mercado central de Chinandega. Esta dama se ha destacado por ser una persona muy esforzada el cual ha invertido recursos para mantener su tramo en el mercado y así mantener a su familia compuesta por su pequeño hijo.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo, el negocio de la señora Diana requiere inversión para la comprar de pollos y por este motivo espera que su crédito en Ceprodel sea aprobado para continuar con su negocio. Una vez que obtenga el crédito se beneficia tanto ella como su humilde familia.
texts.en:
Mrs Diana E. sells chicken in the central market of Chinandega. Diana is a very hardworking women who has invested resources in order to keep her stand in the market. Her business allows her to earn money to rise her son. Like all developing businesses, Diana's needs investment. Diana needs to buy more chicken and hopes her credit will be approved so she can continue with her business. The credit will benefit her and her humble family.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken

loans.name: Asunción Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Asunción del Pilar A. Beltrán pertenece al banco comunal  JERID Camino al Éxito, tiene 47 años y vive en la avenida La Marina 615 del distrito de Salaverry en la provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió educación primaria completa, pero no continuó estudiando por falta de recursos económicos.  Se casó con el señor Alejandro Sánchez Vera y tienen 3 hijos, dos de los cuales dependen económicamente de ella.
Empezó su negocio, vendiendo calzado, cosiendo para vender o para reparar ropa, actualmente vende calzado en Lima, hace ondulaciones en su casa, vende rosquitas y manjar, cose ropa todo en su casa.
Su primer monto fue de 300 soles, devuelto en 4 cuotas,  con lo que incursionó en la venta de calzado, rosquita y manjar.
Con este crédito de 900 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará calzado y enviará a Lima, lo mismo terminará su quiosco que está instalando en su casa.
Como toda mujer trabajadora y emprendedora sueña con ser mayorista.
texts.en:
Mrs. Asunción del Pilar A. Beltrán belongs to the community bank JERID Camino al Exito (Road to Success). She is 47 years old and lives in the district of Salverry in the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad Peru. She studied to be an elementary teacherbut she didn't finish her studies due to a lack of economic resources. She married Mr. Alejandro Sánchez Vera and they have three children, two of which depend on her financially. She began her business, selling footwear, sewing items to sell and repairing clothing. At this time she sells footwear in Lima, perms hair in her home, sells cakes and sweets, and sews clothing, all in her home. Her first loan was for 300 Soles ($100 US) which she repaid in 4 months. With that money she entered into the sale of footwear, rosquita (baked goods) and manjar (caramel/dulce de leche). With this loan of 900 Soles ($300US) which will be repaid in 6 months she will buy footwear and will send it to Lima. She will also complete the storefront that she is installing in her home. This hardworking and enterprising woman dreams of becoming a wholesaler.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of footwear.  Maintenance of kiosk/storefront (for the sale of sweets).

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, especificamente en el mercado central, la señora Eusebia L. se dedica al negocio de venta de granos básicos el cual los comercializa en su propio tramo con el propósito de mantener su familia la cual requiere del apoyo de la señora Eusebia.

Es importante destacar que ella posee una gran cantidad de clientes y hoy en día se le han agotado sus estantes por lo que ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de dichos granos básicos y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio ya que son sus sueños convertirse en una gran comerciante en su sector.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, specifically in the central market, Mrs. Eusebia Lopez works selling basic grains in her own stretch of the market; she uses the money she earns to maintain her family which needs her help economically. It is important to highlight that she has a large number of customers and she is currently out of stock; that is why she has requested a loan from Ceprodel in order to buy those basic grains and move forward with her business. Her dream is to become a great saleswoman in her sector.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains

loans.name: Jesus Flor

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 35 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo y Progreso y vive en la Av. Mesa Arizona MZ.13, Lote 9, distrito de Caraz, provincia de Huaylas, departamento de Ancash.   
Empezó vendiendo golosina desde hace 3 años y ahora trabaja vendiendo cuy en su domicilio. Su esposo es chofer y además es quien la ayuda a trasladar los cuyes. 
Con este préstamo de S/.300, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará pasto, 10 cuyes y 3 sacos de afrecho.
Desea ser mayorista en la exportación de cuyes.
texts.en:
Jesús is 35 years old, has 2 children, and is a member of the Development and Progress Community Bank. She lives on Mesa Arizona Avenue, MZ. 13, Lot 9 in the district of Caraz, in the province of Huaylas, Ancash. She began selling sweets 3 years ago and now sells guinea pigs in her home. Her husband is a driver and also helps her transfer the guinea pigs. With this loan of 300 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy fodder, 10 guinea pigs, and 3 sacks of bran. She wants to be a wholesale in the export of guinea pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fodder, guinea pigs, and bran

loans.name: Francisca Diojana

texts.es:
Francisca A. se dedica desde hace 22 largos años al negocio de venta de queso el cual comercializa con mucho entusiasmo en el mercado central de Chinandega donde es originaria.

Sus inicios fueron muy duros por lo qeu vendía pocas cantidades de queso y por ende poseía poca cantidad de ingresos. Sin embargo desde que comenzó a hacer uso de los créditos brindados en Ceprodel ha logrado mejorar su situación y hoy en dia se ha perfilado como excelente comerciante en el mercado. Una vez mas acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y de esta manera mejorar la condición de su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisca A. has worked for the past 22 years selling cheese which she sells with great enthusiasm in the central market of Chinandega, her native town. Her first years were very difficult as she sold very little cheese; therefore, she earned very little income. However, once she started to make use of the loans available through Ceprodel, she has been able to improve her situation and now she stands out as an excellent salewoman in the market. Once again, she has come to Ceprodel to obtain a loan in order to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dairy products

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina C. es una dama cuya labor es la venta de ropa el cual comercializa en el mercado central de Chinandega. Todos sus esfuerzos los ha dedicado a su negocio ya que ha logrado salir adelante y llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.

Hoy en día atraviesa una necesidad como lo es la urgencia de obtener el capital financiero para la compra de la ropa. Para esto no ha dudado en acudir a Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado créditos los cuales los ha invertido directamente en su negocio y por esta razón ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Georgina Chavez is a woman whose primary work is the sale of clothing which she sells in the central market of Chinandega. She puts all her efforts into her business which has helped her to progress and helped her to sustain her family in her home. Today, she stands in urgent need of obtaining captial in order to purchase more clothing. That is why she has come to Ceprodel who has given her loans in the past which she has invested directly in her business and helped her business to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Gloria María

texts.es:
La señora Gloria A. se dedica con gran esfuerzo al negocio de venta de discos compactos de música y película en las afueras del mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega. Ella es una dama muy esforzada cuyo trabajo lo ha llevado a cabo gracias al apoyo brindado en Ceprodel por medio de los créditos otorgados.

Hoy en día la razón por la cual solicita un nuevo crédito es para la compra de los discos compactos para ofrecerlos a sus clientes. Una vez otorgado el crédito ella tiene la posibilidad de salir adelante en su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria A. works hard selling music CDs and DVDs on the outskirts of Chinandega's central market. She is very hard-working and has been able to carry out her business thanks to the support and loans of Ceprodel. Today, she is requesting a new loan to purchase more CDs to offer to her customers. Once she receives the loan, she will be able to improve her business and the conditions of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of music CDs

loans.name: Julia Adela

texts.es:
Julia tiene 41 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos y es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay. Vive y tiene su negocio en la carretera central s/n, distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. 
Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace 2 años y a pesar de tener un pequeño negocio de abarrotes también se dedica a la venta de comidas los días de feria en el campo ferial de la provincia de Yungay. Su esposo es docente y los días de descanso la apoya en la venta de comida.
Con este préstamo de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses comprará productos de primera necesidad para la venta de comida: 5 paquetes de gaseosa, 2 cajas de aceite y 5 sacos de arroz.
Su mayor sueño es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Julia is 41 years old, has 5 children, and is a member of the Fighting Women of Yungay Community Bank. She lives and has her business on the main road S/N in the district and province of Yungay, Ancash. She has sold groceries for 2 years, and in spite of having a small grocery store business, she also sells food on fair days on the fairgrounds in the province of Yungay. Her husband is a teacher, and on the weekends, he helps her sell food. With this loan of 300 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy products that are necessary for the sale of food: 5 packets of soda, 2 boxes of oil, and 5 sacks of rice. Her biggest dream is to have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy soda, oil, and rice

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Juana N. se dedica con gran esfuerzo al negocio de venta de ropa el cual comercializa en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en su negocio ya que gracias a la institución ha logrado surtirlo de ropa el cual los clientes le compran por tener precios favorables y de buenas marcas. La razón por la cual solicita el crédito es para la compra de la ropa ya que sus estantes se han venido agotando. Es importante destacar que ella es una fiel cliente de la institución ya que tiene un record de 25 créditos con la institución.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana N. works hard selling clothing in the central market of Chinandega. Ceprodel has been a pillar of her business since thanks to this institution, she has been able to supply her business with good-priced, brand-name clothing for her customers. She is requesting this loan since her shelves are virtually empty due to good sales. It is important to highlight that she is a faithful customer of Ceprodel having already repaid 25 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Juana del Socorro C. se dedica desde hace 7 años al negocio de venta de verduras y frutas en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde es originaria. Esta dama se ha caracterizado por ser muy esforzada y el motivo por el cual hoy en día acude a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito que le permita obtener las verduras para su respectiva comercialización.

Con el crédito obtenido por Ceprodel se beneficia tanto ella como su amada familia a la que tiene que mantener y brindarle su apoyo.
texts.en:
For seven years, Joan del Socorro C. has been in the business of selling vegetables and fruits in the central market in the city of Chinandega (where she is originally from). She has been characterized as very hardworking. She now goes to Ceprodel seeking a loan that allows her to obtain vegetables for her own marketing. With the credit obtained by Ceprodel, her family (whom she must maintain and support) will benefit greatly.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Julia Olimpia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 42 años de edad, es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay y vive en la calle 9 MZ. 1 Lote 3, distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. 
Desde hace 1 año viene trabajando en la venta de abarrotes, negocio que está ubicado en su domicilio. Todas las mañanas abre sus puertas para brindar el mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Con este préstamo de S/.300, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará productos como 1 saco de arroz, 3 sacos de azúcar, 5 bolsas de golosinas y 2 cajas de atún. Esta inversión le permitirá surtir el negocio.
A pesar de ser madre soltera con un hijo sigue hacia adelante con su negocio y sueña con hacerlo crecer.
texts.en:
Julia is 42 years old and is a member of the Fighting Women of Yungay Community Bank. She lives on 9 MZ Street, Lot 3 in the district and province of Yungay, Ancash. For one year, she has sold groceries. This business is located in her home. Every morning, she opens her doors to offer the best service to her clients. With this loan of 300 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy products, including 1 sack of rice, 3 sacks of sugar, 5 bags of sweets, and 2 boxes of tuna. This investment will allow her to supply her business. Despite being a single mother with a son, she continues going forward with her business and dreams of making it grow.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy rice, sugar, bags of sweets, and tuna

loans.name: Margarita Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Margarita Jirón se dedica desde hace 15 años al negocio de venta de artículos de plástico teniendo su propio tramo en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega de donde es originaria. La señora Margarita es una pe4rsona muy esforzada que con mucho sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante y le ha llevado el sustento a sus hijos que tanto lo necesitan.

Hoy en día la razón por la cual ha buscado el refugio en Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito que le permita comprar sus productos de plástico para ofertarlos y de esta forma continuar generando ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
For the past 15 years, Margarita Jirón has sold plastic goods in her own section in the central market of the city Chinandega, where she is originally from. Margarita is a very hardworking person whom, with a lot of sacrifice, has managed to succeed and sustain her children with what they need. Today, she is seeking to obtain a loan from Ceprodel that will allow her to purchase plastic products at discounts and thus continue to generate revenue for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora T. es una dama muy alegre y con un gran espíritu de superación en su negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos los cuales los comercializa en el mercado central de Chinandega. Esta dama se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora ya que ha logrado mantener el negocio desde hace 10 años.

Una de las razones por las cuales ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para la compra de los productos por la razón de que sus estantes deben de ser llenos para que de esta manera pueda vender y así obtener ingresos para el mejoramiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora T. is a very cheerful lady with a great spirit of improvement in her business of selling clothes and cosmetics, which she sells in the central market of Chinandega. This lady is a hard-working person who has already managed to stay in business for 10 years. One of the reasons why she has sought support from Ceprodel is for the purchase of products so that her shelves are full, so that she can sell products and earn money to upgrade her home.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Norma Luisa

texts.es:
Norma tiene 57 años de edad, tiene dos hijas quienes ya no están a su cargo,  es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay, y vive en el Jr. 28 de julio s/n, distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. 
Solicita un préstamo para implementar su cerrajería que se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio, la cual es administrado tanto por ella como por su esposo. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará una maquina de soldar y 3 fierros para implementar su cerrajería.
Sueña con tener un negocio más grande, la cual le permita ser exportadora de puertas, ventanas, etc.
texts.en:
Norma is 57 years old. She has two daughters who are no longer under her care. She is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay (Fighting Women of Yungay) and lives on the 28th of July Avenue in the district and province of Yungay in the deparment of Ancash. She is requesting a loan to invest in her locksmith shop, which is located at her home, and is run by her husband as much as by her.

With this loan of 500 Soles, which will be paid off in 4 months, she will buy a welding machine and 3 tools to use in her locksmith shop.

She dreams of having a bigger business, which would allow her to be an exporter of doors, windows, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy a welding machine and 3 tools

loans.name: María Estela

texts.es:
En el mercado central de Chinandega, la señora María N. se dedica desde hace 3 años con muchísimo esfuerzo al negocio de venta de ropa el cual es comercializada con mucha dedicación en su propio tramo ubicado en el sector de ropa.

Es una dama con la obligación de mantener a sus tres pequeños hijos que son el motive de sus grandes esfuerzos. Una de las necesidades que hoy en dia ella atraviesa es que requiere adquirir ropa para comercializarla y es por esta razón que ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le de la oportunidad de adquirir la mercadería y continuar en su negocio de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
In the central market of Chinandega, Maria N. has sold clothing for the past three years with much effort and dedication in her own plot in the garment sector. She is a lady with the responsibility of raising their three small children who are the motive for her great efforts. Today, one of her needs is to purchase clothing for marketing; it is for this reason she has gone to Ceprodel to request credit for the opportunity to purchase the goods and continue her business of selling goods.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Olga Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 42 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay y vive en el Jr. Atuspararia s/n, distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.
Tanto ella como su esposo se dedican a la agricultura y a la venta de abarrotes, negocio que está ubicado en el mercado campo ferial de Yungay.  Con este negocio viene trabajando 15 años. 
Con este préstamo de S/.1,700, el cual será cancelado en 8 meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como 5 cajas de aceite, 10 bolsas de fideos, 5 bolsas de arroz y 10 sacos de azúcar. Con esta inversión se podrá surtir el negocio. 
Sueña con hacer grande su negocio y vender tanto al por mayor como al por menor.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 42 years old and has three children. She is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay (Fighting Women of Yungay) and lives on Atuspararia Avenue, in the district and province of Yungay in the department of Ancash.

She and her husband work in agriculture and in selling groceries at their business located in the country fairground market in Yungay. She has been working in this business for 15 years.

With this loan of 1,700 Soles, which will be paid off in 8 months, she will buy basic necessity products, such as 5 boxes of oil, 10 bags of noodles, 5 bags of rice, and 10 sacks of sugar. With this investment she will be able to stock up her business. She dreams of making her business bigger and selling as much in bulk as in smaller amounts.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy oil, noodles, rice, sugar

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
El Seños Juan José junto con su esposa la señora Nadia tiene dos hijos que son pequeños de edad escolar están solicitando un préstamo, para construir la barda trasera de su casa ya que donde está ubicada la vivienda solo hay un terreno solo y se encuentran muchos animales es por eso desea construir la barda y así darles mas protección y seguridad a su familia.

El Seños Juan José trabaja casi todo el día en una compañía de mantenimiento industrial en el área de ayudante de soldador y plomería éste es el ingreso de su familia. Don Juan José y la señora Nadia necesitan la cantidad de $325.00dlls para comprar el material ya que él mismo construirá la barda.
texts.en:
Juan Jose and his wife, Nadia, have two small children. They are asking for a loan to build a fence around their house, which is located in an area with a lot of animals. They'd like to build a fence to provide more protection and security for their family. Juan Jose works nearly all day as a welding and plumbing assistant in an industrial maintenance company. This is the family's only source of income. Juan Jose and Nadia need a loan of $325 to buy the materials that Juan Jose needs to construct the fence.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a fence around their house

loans.name: Olinda Viviana

texts.es:
Olinda tiene 43 años de edad, es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres  Luchadoras de Yungay y vive junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos en el Jr. 2 de mayo, distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. 
Su esposo trabaja como seguridad y también la ayuda con la venta de abarrotes, el cual se encuentra ubicado en el campo ferial de la provincia Yungay, sección abarrotes. Viene trabajando en dicho lugar desde hace más de 12 años.
Con este préstamo de S/.1,200, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses comprará 8 sacos de arroz, 4 sacos de azúcar, 6 cajas de aceite y 2 cajas de leche. Con esta inversión se podrá mejorar el negocio. 
Su mayor sueño es tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Olinda is 43 years old. She is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay (Fighting Women of Yungay) and lives with her husband and their three children on the 2nd of May Avenue in the district and province of Yungay in the deparment of Ancash. Her husband works in security and also helps her with grocery sales, which are located in the country fairgrounds in the Yungay province, in the grocery section. She has been working in said location since more than 12 years ago. With this loan of 1,200 Soles, which will be paid off in 6 months, she will buy 8 sacks of rice, 4 sacks of sugar, 6 boxes of oil, and 2 boxes of milk. With this investment she will be able to improve her business. Her biggest dream is to have a store of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy rice, sugar, oil, and milk

loans.name: Yenny Magaly

texts.es:
Jenny tiene 29 años de edad, es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay, tiene dos hijos menores y trabaja junto con su esposo. 
Tiene un puesto de abarrotes en el mercado campo ferial, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. Todas las mañanas sale a ofrecer sus productos a sus cliente.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad como 10 sacos de arroz, 20 sacos de azúcar, 30 cajas de aceite y 5 cajas de leche.
Su mayor sueño es ser mayorista de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Jenny is 29 years old. She is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay (Fighting Women of Yungay). She has two young children and works with her husband.

She has a grocery shop in the country fairgrounds market located in the district and province of Yungay, department of Ancash. Every morning she goes out to offer her products to her clients.

With this loan of 3,000 Soles, which will be paid off in 6 months, she will buy basic necessity products, such as 10 sacks of rice, 20 sacks of sugar, 30 boxes of oil, and 5 boxes of milk.

Her biggest dream is to be a grocery wholesaler.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy rice, sugar, oil, and milk

loans.name: Delia Felicitas

texts.es:
Delia, tiene 62 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos, es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay, y vive junto a su esposo, quien es agricultor y la apoya en el negocio, en el jr. 28 de julio s/n, distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.
Desde hace tres años tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes, el cual está ubicado en su domicilio. Todas las mañanas abre sus puertas para brindar el mejor servicio a sus clientes. 
Con este préstamo de S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad como 5 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de sal y 1 bolsa de azúcar.  
A pesar de su trabajo como autoridad, su más grande reto es hacer crecer su negocio, es por ello que sueña con superarse y ser mayorista.
texts.en:
Delia is 62 years old, has 5 children, and is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Luchadoras” of Yungay. She lives with her husband, who is a farmer and supports her in the business, at jr. 28 de julio s/n, Yungay district and province, in Ancash department. For three years she has had a grocery store business in her home. Every morning she opens her doors to provide the best service to her customers. With this loan for S/.800, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy basic needs products such as 5 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of salt, 1 bag of sugar. Her greatest goal is to grow her business, and this is why she dreams of being successful and become a wholesaler.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, salt and sugar.

loans.name: Sebastián

texts.es:
Al contar con 15 años de experiencia en la crianza y venta de chanchos, el señor Sebastián tiene más de 30 casado (su esposa es la que sale en la foto), junto con ella se ha propuesto conseguir una calidad de vida adecuada para sus próximos años puesto que su única hija ya está casada y en el mismo negocio independientemente. Con su vida entera dedicada al negocio y, a eventuales trabajos de carpintería y construcción, no le alcanza para tener un estilo de vida regular siquiera, pero la venidera temporada navideña le abren las puertas de la esperanza.

Debido a la alta demanda de lechones (chanchos pequeños, de entre 0 y 6 meses) por dicha campaña, es que requiere de 700 soles para poder financiar el alimento de sus lechones y poder venderlos a un precio justo para su inversión.
texts.en:
With 15 years of experience in raising and selling pigs, Sebastian has been married for over 30 (his wife is the one in this photo). Together, the couple work to achieve an appropriate quality of life for themselves over the upcoming years, due to the fact that their only daughter is now married and has her own business in this field. Sebastian has worked his entire life, raising pigs and doing odd jobs like carpentry and construction, but he has not yet achieved a normal standard of living. However, the upcoming Christmas season opens the doors of hope. Due to the high demand for piglets (between zero and six months old) during this season, Sebastian needs 700 soles to finance the food for his piglets and sell them at a fair price for his investment.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in pig food and sales to prepare for the Christmas season

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Con 8 meses de experiencia en la venta de chanchos, la señora Isabel realiza hasta 3 labores para poder solventar los estudios de sus 2 menores hijos, la principal es la venta de chanchos, también lava ropa una vez por semana en una casa muy lejos de la suya y ayuda en el comedor popular de su barrio; sin embargo, estos 3 ingresos no le son suficientes para darle la educación que quiere a sus hijas y va en detrimento de la relación que quisiera tener con ellos, por lo escaso del tiempo. A mediano plazo, el sueño de la señora Isabel es consolidarse en la venta de chanchos y en el comedor para así evitar lavar ropa y, lo que ella no quiere, pasar tiempo alejada de sus hijos.

Para empezar a hilvanar su sueño al lado de los suyos, necesita de 500 soles como préstamo.
texts.en:
With eight months of experience, selling pigs is one of the three jobs that Mrs. Isabel works to pay for the education of her two youngest children. Her principal work is selling pigs, and she also washes clothes once each week in a house that is far away from her own. Her third job is helping out in a popular restaurant in her neighborhood. Nevertheless, these three sources of income are not sufficient to provide the education that Isabel would like her children to have, and it damages their relationship because she doesn't have enough time to spend with them. In the medium term, Isabel would like to work only in the pig sales business and in the restaurant, and give up her job washing clothes. This would help her spend more time with her children. To start making her dream a reality, Isabel needs a loan of 500 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pig food to raise Christmas pigs

loans.name: Rosa Felipa

texts.es:
Con denodado esfuerzo, la señora Rosa se dedica a la venta de chanchos hace 17 años, también es Presidenta de un comedor popular al costado de su casa; ambas labores le deparan casi todo su tiempo pero ella lo hace porque detrás suyo hay 7 hijos y, como madre soltera, ella lo hace gustosamente para el bienestar de sus hijos. Aunque de sus 7 hijos, 3 ya sean mayores, aún viven bajo su techo y ella los acoge con el amor de siempre.

Con tantas trabas de por medio pero con más ganas que nunca, la señora Rosa necesita de 800 soles para emprender aquella travesía que la llevará, de la mano con sus hijos, hacia el éxito.
texts.en:
With a lot of effort, Mrs. Rosa has been selling pigs for 17 years. She's also the President of a popular restaurant, which is attached to her house. Together these jobs take up nearly all of her time, but Rosa does them because she is a single mother of seven, and she takes great pleasure in the wellbeing of her children. Even though three of her seven children are now grown-up, they still live with her and Rosa receives them with the same love that she always has. With so many obstacles in the way, but with more determination than ever, Rosa needs 800 soles to set her business on course, and hand in hand with her children, toward success.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in food for pigs that she'll sell during the Christmas season, when demand is high

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Mrs. Phin M. is a villager in Phdaov Chum Kiet Village in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a 39-year-old widow with no children. Mrs. M. is a duck breeder who raises about 100 ducks. Since this business is going well, she want to expand it, is so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks to breed. She will use the rest of the loan buy duck food to feed them. 

She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with these new additions.

loans.use: To buy more ducks to breed and duck food to feed them.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan S. H. is a farmer in Yok Bath Village in Kandal Province. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her household. Her husband, Mr. Chhorn Buncheng, is a tuk-tuk driver who now faces a small problem because his motorbike is too old and he spends a lot of money on gasoline to support his motorbike. In order to reduce family expenses, Mrs. Chan S. H. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a new motorbike for her husband's business. Mrs. Chan S. H. is 29 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband's business.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mr. Mao S. was born in Kandal Leu Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. He is a construction worker who makes a small income to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Mok Samey, is a housewife. 

Although they have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions and in an old house. Now, their house needs to be repaired, so Mr. Mao S. has decided to ask for a loan to fix their house. 

Mr. Mao S. is 46 years old and the father of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. The four middle children attend the local school. The youngest is just one year old.

His wife appears on his left in the photo.

loans.use: To fix their house.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mr. Sam S. is a villager in Phlov Trei Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. He owns a small piece of land where he grows rice to earn a living. 

He now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy rice seeds to cultivate, so he has decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. With the rest of the loan, he will buy fertilizer and pesticides to support his crop. 

His wife, Mrs. Chea Huot, owns a small restaurant where she sells rice soup. Mr. Sam S. is 60 years old and the father of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory. The remaining three attend the local school. 

His wife and child are on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds to cultivate and fertilizers and pesticides to support his crop.

loans.name: Ung

texts.en:
Mrs. Ung Y. is a villager in Trapang Kransang Village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband, Mr. Chork Sorphorn, are farmers. They now live in poor conditions because they have only one business. To improve these living conditions, Mrs. Ung Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. 

Mrs. Ung Y. is 46 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom repair motorbikes.The remaining three attend the local school. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Mrs.chhoen Chan Thy's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank borrowing group consists of sixteen members and is located in Oknha Pang Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. The group members will use their shares of the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Chhoen C. T. is the village bank president and she owns a small place where she sells Khmer noodles to villagers and passers-by. She is a 40-year-old widow with four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the remaining three are attending the local school. Although Mrs. Chhoen C. T. and her children have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions and in an old house. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Chhoen C. T. has decided to ask for a loan to add to her saving to build a new house for her household to live in better conditions.

Mrs. Ouern P. did not come to the loan group meeting but her husband did, so he is present in the picture instead.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eleven members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.
