> Actualmente, solicita un préstamo por USD$225 a un plazo de 3 meses, con la finalidad de comprar ropa para su venta posterior. <

> Judith inició hace 4 años, primero vendía la ropa personal que no le quedaba o gustaba y al observar que obtenía buen os resultados optó por la compra ropa usada para su venta posterior, y asi ella siguió vendiendo y estudiando al mismo tiempo, cabe señalar que los ingresos obtenidos le permitieron solventar sus estudios y ayudar con los gastos de la casa. <

> La necesidad por estudiar y no ser una carga económica para sus padres motivo a Judith a ayudarles un poco llevando lo indispensable a la casa. <

> ¡Los invito a que apoyen a Judith ya que ha demostrado ser una persona emprendedora! <

>
texts.en:
Judith is originally from Linares Nuevo León, she is single and is 21 years of age.

Currently, she is asking for a loan of $225 to be repaid in 3 months, with the goal of buying clothing to then sell.

She started four years ago, first selling her own clothing that did not fit her or that she did not like and, seeing good results, she decided to buy used clothing for resale and that way she continued selling and studying at the same time. It is worth pointing out that her income allowed her to afford her studies and to help with the household expenses.

The need to study and not be a financial burden for her parents motivated Judith to help them a little to bring in what is needed for their home.

I invite you to support Judith as she has shown herself to be an enterprising person!

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
María del Socorro inició el negocio porque las necesidades se incrementaron a medida que sus hijos crecían y ella deseaba apoyar a su esposo con un ingreso adicional para poder completar en los gastos de la casa, la familia y con los estudio de sus 4 hijos. Hace cinco años inicio con la venta de blancos y zapatos por catalogo por iniciativa propia vendiendo entre sus amistades y familiares, y en la escuela de sus hijos, lo que le ayudo a generar mas ingresos para su familia.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $525 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancía de la nueva temporada.
texts.en:
María del Socorro started her business because the needs increased as her children grew and she wanted to support her husband in the costs of the home, the family, and the studies of their 4 children. It has been five years since she started in the sale of bedding and shoes by catalog on her own initiative, selling among her friends and relatives and in her children's school. This has helped her generate more income for her family. She needs a loan of $525 that she will repay in 5 months to buy merchandise for the new season.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa inició el negocio ya que se quedo solo y tenia que sacar a sus 6 hijos adelante. Comenzó su negocio hace mas de 11 años cuando logro la concesión de la cooperativa de la escuela de sus hijos, donde podía vender la comida que los niños compran en su hora de recreo, y hasta la fecha lo sigue haciendo con éxito.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para surtir mercancía para poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa has a business because she was alone and had to get her six children ahead. She started more than 11 years ago when the right to have the school co-op was granted to her, where she can sell food to kids during their break, to this date she has been successful with the business. She needs a loan of US $300 that will be repaid in three months to purchase merchandise and continue with the business.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina inició el negocio cuando se divorcio hace 15 años y sus hijo aun estaban estudiando, la pensión que recibía no le alcanzaba para los pagos de manutención y escuela, además de la enfermedad de su hijo que falleció después. Ella comenzó su negocio de venta de cosméticos hace mas de 5 años sus familiares la apoyaron par que pudiera empezarlo, adquiriendo mercancía, actualmente vende a familiares, amigos y vecinos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y poder continuar con su negocio. Con tu apoyo podrá lograrlo.
texts.en:
Guillermina started the business when she got divorced 15 years ago and her children were in school, the alimony she received was not enough for living and education expenses, as well as the health expenses of her late son. She started the business of cosmetic sales more than five years ago, her family helped her get started to purchase merchandise, currently she sells to family, friends and neighbours. She needs a loan of US$375 to be repaid in six months to purchase merchandise and continue with her business. With your support she will be able to achieve her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma inició el negocio por iniciativa propia, para salir adelante con la economía de su hogar. Decidió emprender una actividad que le generara ingresos cuando se separo de su pareja y no tenía sustento ya que sus hijos no le ayudan y ella se quedo con la tutela de una nieta de 2 años, la cual ahora depende económicamente de ella. Comenzó su negocio hace 2 años, una hermana le dio ropa para que la vendiera fuera de su casa, y poco a poco con las ganancias fue comprando pacas de ropa.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $525 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar ropa de temporada y poder continuar con su negocio. Con tu apoyo podrá lograrlo!!.
texts.en:
Irma started the business on her own, to cover her living expenses. She decided to do an activity that would generate income when she got separated from her partner and didn’t have a way to support herself, her children don’t help her and she had to take care of her two year old grandaughter, who now depends on her financially. She started her business two years ago, one of her sisters gave her clothes to sell outside her house and with the profit she slowly started to buy more merchandise. She needs a loan of US $525 to repay in six months, to purchase season clothing and continue with her business. With your support she can get it!

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Irma Aracely

texts.es:
Irma inició el negocio para completar los gastos familiares y poder ofrecerles mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 pequeños: Genaro de 9 años y Karina de 2. Comenzó su negocio de venta de ropa hace mas de 2 en su casa, después busco un mercado donde se instalo y con las ganancias que ha obtenido ahora desea establecerse en un local comercial.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara en 6 meses para compra de ropa de temporada para la próxima época navideña.
texts.en:
Irma started her business to help with the family expenses and provide her two children a better quality of live: Genaro, nine and Karina, two. She started selling clothes from home more than two years ago, then she looked for a market where to sell and with the profit made until now she wishes to establish the business in a commercial location. She needs a loan of US$375 to be repaid in six months to purchase clothing for the upcoming Holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María de Jesús inició el negocio por la necesidad de que su hijo terminara sus estudios en Ingeniería en Sistemas, además de que los pagos de servicios y manutención se incrementaban y su esposo siempre ha tenido ingresos variables. Comenzó hace más de 11 años haciendo costuras a sus amistades y familiares, quienes la han ido recomendando y actualmente goza de buena reputación por la calidad de su trabajo.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar material de trabao y poder hacer unas pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Maria de Jesus started her business because of the need to help her son finish his Systems Engineering degree and also because living expenses started to increase and her husband doesn’t have a steady income. She started more than 11 years ago, doing tailoring and alterations for her friends and family, who have recommended her and she currently has a good reputation because of the quality of her work. She needs a loan of US$300 that will be repaid in three months to purchase material and fulfil pending orders.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Mercede s Z. es una humilde anciana que se dedica desde 20 años al negocio de elaboración y venta de comida en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega. Ella es una dama muy esforzada que ha logrado subsistir gracias a este negocio que hoy en día busca la manera de mejorar.

La razón por la cual la señora Mercedes ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de la material prima para la elaboración de los alimentos y de esta manera continuar con su negocio en el mercado de Chinandega.
texts.en:
Mercedes Z. is a humble elder lady that has prepared and sold food in the central market of Chinandega for 20 years. She is a hardworking lady that has subsisted thanks to this business that she is trying to improve. The reason why Mercedes needs the support from Ceprodel is to get a loan that allows her to buy ingredients to prepare food and continue with her business in the market of Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to prepare food for sale

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
El joven Nelson C. es una persona que se dedica a la venta de calzados en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega de donde es originario. Es padre soltero y con la responsabilidad de mantener a su pequeña niña en edad escolar.

La razón por la cual hoy en día el joven Nelson ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito que le permita obtener los calzados para su respectiva comercialización. Por esto es que espera muy confiadamente a que su crédito sea otorgado y así salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The young man Nelson C. is a person who works selling shoes in the central market of the city of Chinandega, which is his hometown. He is a single father and has the responsibility of supporting his young school aged daughter.

The reason why Nelson has come to Ceprodel today is to apply for a loan that will allow him to obtain footwear for its respective sale. This is why he waits very confidently so that his loan is granted and through this he will advance in his business.


Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes.

loans.name: Nidia Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Nidia Esperanza G. se dedica desde hace 10 años a su negocio de venta de frutas en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega de donde es originaria. Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora que en todo momento está buscando como llevar el alimento a su hogar y de esta forma beneficiar a sus tres pequeños hijos.

La razón por la cual hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito que le permita la compra de las frutas con el propósito de comercializarlas en el mercado de su comunidad en Chinandega.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nidia Esperanza G. has worked fro the past 10 years in her fruit selling business in the central market of the city of Chinandega, which is her hometown. She is characterized as being a very hard working person who at all times is seeking to support her home and in this way benefit her three children.

The reason why she has come to Ceprodel today is to apply for a loan that will allow her to purchase fruits with the purpose of selling them in the market of her community in Chinandega.


Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase to fruits

loans.name: Petrona Cecilia

texts.es:
Petrona E. es una dama cuya labor es la venta de verduras y frutas en el mercado central de Chinandega de donde es originaria.

Ella es una madre soltera y con la responsabilidad de brindarles buenas condiciones a sus dos pequeños hijos que tanto lo necesitan. Es por este motivo que ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para la compra de las frutas y verduras con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y así continuar con el mantenimiento de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Petrona E. is a lady whose work is the sale of vegetables and fruits in the central market of Chinandega, which is her hometown.

She is a single mother and with the responsibility of providing good conditions to her two young children who need it so much. It is for this reason that she is seeking support from Ceprodel to purchase the fruits and vegetables with the goal of improving her income and through this continue supporting her children.


Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perishable goods.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reya E. es una dama cuya labor es la venta de perecederos o verduras en el mercado de central de Chinandega donde se desempeña desde hace cinco años.

Es importante destacar que ella se ha esforzado grandemente y por este motivo ha doblado sus esfuerzos para así seguir supliendo las necesidades de su hogar que tanto necesita de su apoyo. El motivo por el cual espera en Ceprodel es para obtener el dinero para la compra de los perecederos para ofertarlos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Reya E. is a lady whose business is the sale of perishable goods and vegetables in the central market of Chinandega where she has worked for the past five years.

It is important to point out that she is has worked very hard and for this reason she has doubled her efforts to continue supplying her home’s necessities that need her support so much. The reason why she is waiting for Ceprodel is to obtain the money for the purchase of the perishable goods in order to offer them to her clients.


Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perishable goods.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Reina R. es una dama el cual se dedica a la venta de verduras específicamente a la venta de tomates los cuales son comercializados en su tramo en el mercado central de Chinandega donde labora arduamente.

Es muy visitada por los clientes por la razón de que ella vende hermosos tomates y por esto se ha destacado grandemente. El motivo por el cual hoy en dia ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener el crédito con el cual comprar los tomates y de esta forma ofertarlos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Reya Escalante is a lady whose business is the sale of perishable goods and vegetables in the central market of Chinandega where she has worked for the past five years.

It is important to point out that she is has worked very hard and for this reason she has doubled her efforts to continue supplying her home’s necessities that need her support so much. The reason why she is waiting for Ceprodel is to obtain the money for the purchase of the perishable goods in order to offer them to her clients.


Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La señora Rosa M. se dedica con gran esfuerzo al negocio de venta de reposterías en las afueras del mercado central de Chinandega.

Ella se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace 19 años y gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel ha mejorado por lo que ahora ha comprador una vitrina para almacenar las reposterías. La razón por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un nuevo crédito para continuar con la mejora de su negocio y así brindar las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo
texts.en:
Mrs Rosa M. works very hard in the sale of pastries in the area outside of the central market of Chinandega.

She has worked in the business for the past 19 years and thanks to the support that Ceprodel has provided her she has made improvements which is why she has purchased a display cabinet to store her pastries. The reason why she has come to Ceprodel is to apply for a new loan to continue improving her Business and in this way provide the conditions necessary for its development.


Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of pastries.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa H. se dedica a su negocio de venta de ropa en las afueras del mercado central de Chinandega donde se ha desempeñado a esta labor desde hace 10 largos años. A pesar de las dificultades económicas que a lo largo de este período ha atravesado ha logrado bendecir a su familia llevando el sustento y el pan que tanto necesitan sus tres hijos para sobrevivir por lo que es madre soltera.

Hoy en día ella ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de la ropa y espera muy confiadamente que su crédito sea aprobado para adquirir su mercadería ofreciéndola en el mercado y así mantener a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
Teresa H. sells clothes on the outskirts of the central market in Chinandega, where she has carried out this work for 10 long years. In spite of the economic difficulties that have crossed her path, she, as a single mother, has succeeded in giving her family the sustenance that her three children need to survive.

Today, she is requesting a loan from Ceprodel so that she can buy clothes. She hopes that her loan is approved so that she can buy the merchandise she sells in the market and, in this way, take care of her kids.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La venta de zapatos, chinelas y sandalias es el negocio al que se dedica la señora Veronica C. en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinadega. Esta dama desde hace 7 años inició su negocio y ha logrado mejorarlo gracias a los créditos brindados por Ceprodel el cual los ha utilizado para la compra de estos productos.

Una vez mas ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener el capital financiero para la compra de la mercadería y de esta forma ofrecerla en su negocio para continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar que tanto requiere de su apoyo por ser ella el único sustento de la casa.
texts.en:
Veronica C. sells shoes, slippers, and sandals in the central market in Chinadega. This woman began her business 7 years ago and has succeeded in improving it, thanks to the loans offered by Ceprodel, which have been used to buy her products.

She has come to Ceprodel again with the goal of getting the capital so that she can buy merchandise and sell it in her store. Her earnings will allow her to continue with the maintenance of her home, which requires her support because she is the only provider in the house.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Ron

texts.en: Mrs. Ron S., 49, is a rice farmer who lives in Chhouk Khsach Commune, Kampong Thom Province. She is married to Mr. Hang Chen, a farmer, and has six children, all of whom are single.  Four are employed as garment workers in Phnom Penh and help to support family monthly with a salary of $100 each.  Two are younger and in school. Because she faces physical difficulty with farming labor, Ron requests a loan of $600 to add her savings to purchase two oxen to use for farming.

loans.use: To add her savings to purchase two oxen to use for farming.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom N., 49, is a rice farmer and also raises pigs to sell, earning around $2.50 per day. She is married with three children; two of which are married and the other is single and works as garment worker. Her husband, Mr. Samet Hean, 46, is a fisherman and also a construction worker, and earns around $4.80 per day. To improve her farming job, Sokhom requests a loan of $600 to add her savings to purchase a plowing machine that can used for plowing farmland and for transportation.

loans.use: To purchase plowing machine that can used for plowing farmland and for transportation

loans.name: Sarak

texts.en: Mr. Sarak T. is 43 years old and is a policeman, who lives in Damrei Choankhla Commune, Kampong Thom Province. He married to Mrs. Sambat Sin, 37, a fish seller in the market.  They have five children; three sons and two daughters and all of them are in school. To expand his wife’s business, Sarak requests a loan of 600000 Riel to increase working capital to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: To increase working capital to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Kranh

texts.en: Mr. Kranh S., 48, has musical instruments for rent. Normally, he rents to people in his area who are celebrating happy ceremonies or wedding parties and he gets around US$ 30 each time. He has been running this business since 2005 and earns around US$ 150 per month. He is married to Mrs. An Chhay, 45, who works raising pigs, and they have eight children; four married, four single. Three of them are employed as garment workers in Phnom Penh. Kranh and his wife need a loan of US$1,000 to purchase more new, modern musical instruments and to buy a second-hand motorcycle with a cart to transport his instruments for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more musical instruments and a motorcycle with cart to transport them

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en: Mr. Nhor S. is a motorcycle taxi driver who is married to Mrs. Sopheap Heng. They have three children. Nhor can earn around $3 per day while his wife earns around $2 per day selling Khmer food. One of his children is a construction worker who earns $50 per month to help support the family. They live in Sralao Commune, Kampong Thom Province. To increase their income, Nhor needs a loan of $300 to purchase a trailer to use with his motor transport S. he can carry wood to sell when he is not driving the taxi. He will use the other $50 of the loan to purchase groceries for his wife's business.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer and groceries

loans.name: Roum

texts.en: Mr. Rom P., 56, is a carving wood seller. He sells carving wood by horsecart to customers's homes and earns approximately $3 per day. Rom married to Mrs. Khen Roeurn, 36, raises pigs. He has nine children, one of whom is married and eight are single. With his large family, Rom and his wife work hard every day. Rom and his wife request a loan of $250 to purchase a new horsecart for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new horsecart for his business

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Mrs. Phorn K., 35, is a fish seller in the market. Normally, she buys fish from fishermen to sell in the market, earning around US$ 4 per day. Her husband, Chuy Choung, 38, works raising pigs. The family lives in Kampong Thmor Commune, Kampong Thom Province. Phorn needs a loan of US$ 200 to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to use to transport the fish for sale and to carry food for their pigs.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Koeurn

texts.en: Mr. Koeurn K., 53, is a motorcycle taxi driver and earns around $6 per day. He is married to Mrs. Laitoun Phlong, 54, who is a grocery seller operating from the front of their house, earning around $2 per day. They have five children, one of whom is married and four are single. One is employed as a garment worker in Phnom Penh. Koeurn needs a loan of $1000 for his wife's business to purchase more grocery inventory to sell. (Koeurn's wife is pictured because he was not available)

loans.use: To purchase more grocery inventory to sell for his wife's business

loans.name: Savoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Savoeurn M., 47, grows and sells vegetables, earning around $1 per day. She is married with five children, three of whom are married and other two are single. Two work as garment workers in Phnom Penh. Her husband, Mr. Pan Long, 48, makes wood bed, earning around $2.50 per day. Savoeurn requests a loan of $700 for her husband to purchase more wood to make beds and to buy 200 baby ducks to breed.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to make beds and to buy 200 baby ducks to breed

loans.name: Iem

texts.en: Mrs. Iem P., 38, sells oxen. She is married with two children, both of whom are young. Normally, she buys oxen and livestock and keeps them for a while so that she can sell them for a profit. She cooporates with her husband. To improve their business, Iem and her husband need a loan of 1,000,000 Riel to add as capital to purchase oxen for sale.

loans.use: to add as capital to purchase oxen for sale

loans.name: Hae

texts.en: Mrs. Hae H., 38, is a fisherwoman who lives in Chrolorng Commune, Kampong Thom Province. She has been fishing since 1990 and earns around US$ 1.50 per day. Her husband, 51, is a palm tree climber who makes palm juice and turns it into palm wine for sale, earns around $1.50 per day. Hae has one child who is still young. Hae needs a loan of US$ 150 to purchase bamboo to use as a ladder for climbing palm trees.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo to use as a ladder for climbing palm trees

loans.name: Nang

texts.en: Mrs. Nang T., 31, works raising pigs to sell, earning US$ 2 per day. She is married with two children, both of whom are young and stay home. Her husband, Mr. Hay Hang, 35, sells wood for carving that he finds in the forest. To improve her husband's business, Nang needs a loan of 3,000,000 Riel to purchase two buffalos to use for transporting the wood. Nang's husband is pictured because she was not available.

loans.use: to purchase two buffalos to use as transport

loans.name: Khan

texts.en:
Khan Z. is an older man with lots of experience. He is married with five children and he lives in the Biangah Nangrahar province.

He is uneducated and he works in agriculture and has been involved in this business for more than 30 years, working with his family during this time. He has some land, but he would love to have more. To buy more land, he needs extra money. Therefore, he has requested an individual loan of 40,000 Afghanis for 24 months to buy some seeds for his land.

He is a professional farmer and, from back when he started his business, he has always wanted to improve his business. In the town where he lives, when any of the agricultural men face any difficulties, they come and ask Khan Z. to help with their problems.

He is grateful for this loan process. He wants to say that it is his first loan and it is really great, especially for agriculture workers. He wants to continue his partnership and encourage other workers to use this loan service.

loans.use: buying seeds and other things for his land

loans.name: Orifdjon

texts.ru:
Азизов Орифджон, 1982 года рождения, женат. Начал свой бизнес с продажи хозтоваров и его стаж в этой деятельности 7 лет. Он торгует на рынке «Мубориз» Гисарского района хозяйственными товарами. В его ассортименте имеются электропечь, электроплита, светильники, ведра. Также в продажи имеются разновидность чайников, посуды, термосы, утюги, кухонные комбайны и т.д. С наступлением осени увеличивается спрос на электроплиты и печи. Орифджон  хочет пополнить свой товар, увеличить товарооборот и получить больше доходов. Покупает товар в оптовом рынке Корвон и у поставщиков из Китая. 
Орифджон хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 4000 сомони чтоб закупить электропечи.
texts.en:
Orifdjon A. was born in 1982, he is married. He started his business selling household products and he has seven years of experience. He sells on the Muboriz market of the Gissar region. His assortment includes items such as electrical ovens (grills), electrical stove, lamps and buckets as wells as different types of pots, pans, china, thermos, irons and food processors. With the beginning of autumn the demand for electrical stoves and ovens increases. Orifdjon wants to increase the variety of his products, increase sales and get more profits. He buys the merchandise on the wholesale market Korvon and from suppliers from China.

Orifdjon wants to receive a loan with the help of Kiva for 4000 somoni (USD$1,200) to stock up on electrical stoves.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electrical stoves

loans.name: Zulfiniso

texts.ru:
Каюмова Зулфинисо, ей 48 лет и она замужем. У нее 3 детей. Зулфинисо начала свой бизнес с продажи детской одежды. В бизнесе она вот уже 13 лет. Она торгует на рынке «Мубориз» Гисарского района детскими одеждами. В ее ассортименте имеются спортивные костюмы, джинсовые брюки и костюмы, футболки, свитера и джемпера. С наступлением осени увеличивается спрос на осеннее - зимнюю форму, чего у нее мало. Прошлогодние остатки товаров в меньшем количестве и Зулфинисо хочет обновить свой товар. Покупает товар в оптовом рынке Корвон и у поставщиков из Китая. 
Зулфинисо хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 3000 сомони чтоб закупить осенний товар, спортивные костюмы.
texts.en:
Zulfiniso K. is 48 years old and married. She has three children. Zulfiniso started her own business selling children's clothing and has been in this business for thirteen years. She sells on the Muboriz market of the Gissar region. Her inventory includes sports wear, jean pants and suits, t-shirts, sweaters and pull-overs. With the coming of autumn the demand for the autumn-winter clothes increases and she does not have very many in stock. She only has last year's leftovers in small quantities and Zulfiniso wants to update her inventory. She buys the merchandise on the wholesale market Korvon and from suppliers from China.

Zulfiniso wants to get a loan with the help of Kiva for 3000 somoni (USD$900) to buy autumn merchandise and sports wear.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sports wear

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru:
Обидова Рохат, 1956 года рождения, она замужем и у них 4 детей. Рохат начала свой бизнес с продажи тапочек. В бизнесе она вот уже 13 лет. Она торгует на рынке «Мубориз» Гисарского района женской одеждой. В ее ассортименте имеются джемпера, безрукавки, нижнее белье, наски, носовые платки. Также в продажи имеются женская обувь и большой ассортимент тапочек. С наступлением осени увеличивается спрос на джемпера и тапочки. Рохат хочет обновить свой товар, увеличить товарооборот и получить больше доходов. Покупает товар в оптовом рынке Корвон и у поставщиков из Китая. 
Рохат хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 4000 сомони чтоб закупить тапочки.
texts.en:
Rohat O. was born in 1956, she is married and has four children. Rohat started her own business selling slippers and has been doing it for thirteen years now. She sells women's clothing on the Muboriz market of the Gissar region. In her assortment of inventory there are pull-overs, tank-tops, undergarments, socks and handkerchiefs. There are also women's shoes and a large variety of slippers. With the arrival of autumn the demand for pull-overs and slippers grows. Rohat wants to update her inventory, increase circulation and make more profits. She buys the merchandise on the wholesale market Korvon and from suppliers from China. Rohat wants to receive a loan with the help of Kiva for the amount of 4000 somoni (USD$1,200) to buy slippers.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy slippers

loans.name: Inoyatullo

texts.ru:
Сайфиддинов Иноятулло, 1971 года рождения, женат и у них 4 детей. Иноятулло имеет 7 летний стаж в этой деятельности. Он торгует на центральном рынке Гисара продуктами питания. В его ассортименте имеются разновидность сливочного масла, маргарина, конфет производства России, Ирана и Турции. Также в продаже имеются кондитерские изделия такие как печенье, пряники, халва, сахар и сушеные фрукты. У Иноятулло небольшая лавка, но в дальнейшем хочет арендовать большое помещение для открытия магазина оптовой торговли. Покупает свой товар в оптовых магазинах Сафар – Центра. 
Иноятулло нужны средства для покупки сахара, и он хочет получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони.
texts.en:
Inoyatullo S. was born 1971, married and has four children. Inoyatullo has seven years of experience in his business. He sells food and produce on the central market of Gissar region. His inventory includes different types of butter, margarine, candies from Russia, Iran and Turkey. He also has confectionery goods such as cookies, gingerbread, halva, sugar and dried fruits. Inoyatullo has a small shop, but he want to rent out a bigger space in the future to open a store for wholesale. He buys the merchandise from wholesale stores in Safar-center. Inoyatullo needs financing to buy sugar and he wants to receive a loan for 2000 somoni (USD$600).

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru:
Садиева Мехринисо, 1973 года рождения, замужем и у них 2 детей. Начала свой бизнес с продажи фруктов и овощей. У нее 15 лет опыта в этой деятельности. Она торгует на рынке «Дехконбозор» Гисарского района фруктами, овощами,  а в сезон продает рыбу, жаренную и сырую. У Мехринисо много постоянных клиентов, часто ее рыбу закупают оптом в столовые и пивные бары. Хосият хочет увеличить товарооборот и получить больше доходов. Покупает товар у дехкан, рыбаков  и поставщиков из Худжанда.
Хосият хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 1500 сомони чтоб закупить рыбы.
texts.en:
Mehriniso S. was born in 1973, she is married and has two children. She started her own business selling fruits and vegetables. She has fifteen years experience in this business. She sells on the Dehkonbozor market of the Gissar region things such as fruits, vegetables, and fried or raw fish when it's the season. Merhiniso has many regular customers who often buy her fish in wholesale for eateries and beer pubs. Merhiniso wants to increase her goods circulation and make more profits. She buys the goods from fisherman and suppliers from Hudjand. She wants to get a loan with the help of Kiva for 1500 somoni (USD$450) to buy fish.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Ni Ketut Lori

texts.id: Ibu Ni Ketut Lori saat ini tinggal bersama dengan suami dan seorang anaknya yang masih duduk di bangku SLTA. Dalam kesederhanaannya Ibu Ni Ketut Lori bersama Ketut Soma suminya bahu membahu dalam memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga mereka. Karena Ibu Ketut Lori hanya tamat Sekolah Dasar saja sehingga  tidak banyak keterampilan yang dimilikinya, namun hal ini tidak membuatnya patah semangat. Ibu Ni Ketut Lori tetap berusaha keras untuk bisa membantu suaminya walaupun hanya dengan usaha kecil yang dikelola di rumah yaitu dengan beternak babi. Sampai saat ini Ibu Ni Ketut Lori hanya memelihara babi penggemukan saja. Pemeliharaan babi penggemukan ini dilakukannya selama lima sampai enam bulan dan bisa dijual Rp 800.000 – Rp 1.000.000 per ekor sesuai dangan beratnya masing-masing dan dari penjualan ini keuntungan yang bisa diperolehnya sekitar Rp 300.000 – Rp 400.000 dan dipakainya untuk membantu biaya pendidikan anaknya. Ibu Ni Ketut Lori berharap bisa berbuat lebih lagi untuk keluarga lewat usahanya ini dan memilih untuk mengikuti program ternak babi yang dikelola oleh Yayasan Dinari dengan jangka waktu enam bulan dan pengembalian pinjaman dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjaman.
texts.en:
Mrs Ni Ketut Lori lives with her husband and child who is studying in high school. Ni Ketet Lori works hard with her husband, Ketut Soma to fulfill her family's needs. Ketut Lori only has grade school education, therefore she does not have many skills. Ni Ketut Lori however, is still very motivated to help her husband by starting a small pig farm at home. She currently only farms fattening pigs. Every 5 to 6 month cycle, she can earn $33-$45 profit from $88 to $110 sales . She uses that earnings to pay her child's tuition. Ni Ketut Lori hopes to expand her business and earn more money for her family. She is requesting training and a 6 month loan from DINARI foundation.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Ni Made Suniti

texts.id: Ibu Ni Made Suniti dengan tekun menjalankan usaha ternak babinya yang sudah ditekuninya sejak menikah dengan I Nyoman Ariasa dan usahanya ini telah begitu banyak membantu keluarganya dalam memenuhi segala kebutuhan mereka. Saat ini Ibu Ketut Suniti masih memelihara satu ekor babi penggemukan dan berencana untuk menambah jumlahnya beberapa ekor lagi. Itu sebabnya Ibu Ni Made Suniti mengikuti program ternak babi yang dikelola Yayasan Dinari dengan jangka waktu enam bulan yang akan dilunasi pada akhir periode. Ibu Ni Ketut Suniti memiliki harapan yang besar bahwa pinjaman dana yang diperolehnya bisa membantunya mengembangkan usahanya sehingga keuntungan yang biasanya diperoleh sekitar Rp 350.000 bisa bertambah  dan keluarganyapun bisa semakin sejahtera dan anaknya yang masih bersekolah bisa menyelesaikan pendidikannya.
texts.en:
Ni Made Suniti has been farming pigs since she got married to I Nyoman Ariasa. This business has been helping her pay for daily living expenses. Currently Ketut Suniti is farming a fattening pig. She plans to farm a few more pigs. Therefore, she joined DINARi foundation's pig farming training program and requesting a 6 month loan. Ni Ketut Suniti really hopes that the loan will help her expand the business so that she can increase her profit that is currently at about $40 per cycle. She plans to increase her family's living standard with the additional income and pay for her child's tuition.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Membeli anak babi dan pakan ternak

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sumadi

texts.id: Rumah Ibu Ni Nengah Sumadi terletak di daerah pinggiran kota kabupaten tetapi dengan suasana pedesaan yang masih sangat kental. Kehidupan masyarakatnya yang berjalan menurut adat istiadat Bali  membuat lingkungan disekitarnya tampak begitu harmonis. Ibu Nengah Sumadi saat ini memelihara dua ekor penggemukan  dan nerencana untuk menambah jumlah ternaknya. Walaupun selama ini usahanya yang masih kecil ini dielolanya dengan cara sederhana namun terbukti mampu memberikan nilai tambah bagi pemasukan keluarga, karena selama ini dari keuntungan yang diperolehnya dipakai untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga selain mengandalkan pendapatan suaminya yang bekerja sebagai petani. Saat ini Ibu Ni Nengah Sumadi mengikuti program ternak babi yang dikelola Yayasan Dinari dengan jangka wakyu pinjaman selama enam bulan dan waktu pengembalian pada akhir periode pinjaman. Pinjaman yang diperolehnya dipakai untuk membeli bibit penggemukan dan sebagian lagi untuk membeli pakan. Hasil yang biasa diperolehnya selama ini dari memelihara babi penggemukan tersebut sekitar Rp 300.000 – Rp 400.000 per ekor tergantung berat babi tersebut dan itu dipergunakannya membantu suami mencukupi kebutuhan rumah tangganya.
texts.en:
Mrs Ni Nengah Sumadi lives near the outskirt of a middle sized town. The Balinese tradition is still very important in many aspect of her community life, which contribute to the harmony of the village. Mrs. Nengah Sumadi farms two fattening pigs using simple traditional method. The farm income is ample enough to supplement her husband's farming income. Currently Mrs Ni Nengah Sumadi is enrolled in DINAR foundation's pig farm assistance program. She is applying for a 6 month loan that will be used to purchase piglets and feeds. She usually can earn $33 to $45 per pigs, depending on the weight. She uses that earnings to help her husband to afford her daily expenses.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Ni Wayan Werni

texts.id: Ibu Ni Wayan Werni saat ini tinggal bersama suami dan seorang anaknya yang masih duduk di Sekolah dasar. Mereka tinggal dalam rumah yang sederhana namun hal itu tidak membuat mereka berkecil hati tetapi  tetap bersemangat menjalani kehidupan ini.  Untuk membantu suami memenuhi kebutuhan hidup, Ibu Ni Wayan Werni memilih untuk memlihara ternak babi sebagai usaha kecil yang dikelola di belakang rumahnya. Usaha ini ditekuninya sudah cukup  lama yaitu sejak menikah namun usaha ini hanya dikelola dengan cara sederhana sehingga keuntungan yang diperolehnya tidaklah terlalu banyak berkisar Rp 300.000 – Rp 400.000, namun hal ini cukup membantunya dalam memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga termasuk juga untuk membiayai pendidikan anaknya. Saat ini ternak babi yang dipeliharanya dua ekor penggemukan dan rencananya akan menambah jumlah ternak peliharaannya. Ibu Ni Wayan Werni sangat tertarik dengan program ternak babi yang dikelola Dinari dengan jangka waktu enam bulan dengan sistem pembayaran dilakukan diakhir periode dan memilih mengikuti program ini.
texts.en:
Mrs Ni Wayan Werni lives with her husband and child that is currently studying in grade school. They live in a simple house, but it does not make them demotivated. To help her husband earn a living, Mrs. Wayan Werni farms pigs in her backyard. She started the business since she got married, however she could only earn modest profit of $33-$45 with her traditional farming method. This income is enough to supplement her family's income and pay for her kid's tuition. She is currently farming 2 fattening pigs. She plans to purchase more pigs to be farmed. Mrs Ni Wayan werni was attracted to DINARI's foundation pig farm training and financial assistance program. She is currently applying for a 6 month loan.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Ri

texts.en: Mrs. Ri O., 53, sells groceries at Poi Pet Commune in Banteay Meanchey Province and earns about $5 per day. Ri has five children, all of whO. are single and live at home.  Her husband, Mr. Sok Saroeun, 56, helps his wife's business, selling groceries in Kbal Spean Village, Poi Pet Commune, Banteay Meanchey Province. Because of their growing business, Ri and her husband requests a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorcycle to use as transport and to buy more inventory to sell. The loans will help to improve their business and family’s income. (Ri's husband is pictured because she was not available)

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to use as transport and to buy more inventory.

loans.name: Pho

texts.en: Mrs. Pho K. was born in 1947 and lives in Teok Nem village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Vet Voeun, is a motorbike driver. They are the parents of two children who are both garment workers. Even though Pho and her husband both work they still earn a very low combined income. Thus, Mrs. Pho K. has decided to request a loan to purchase cow feed. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living condition with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase cow feed to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mr. Sok M., 35, motorcycle taxi driver who makes around $5 per day. Sok is single and lives in Kbal Spean Village, Poi Pet Commune, Banteay Meanchey Province. In order to enlarge his existing business, Sok now asks for a loan of $400 to purchase a new motorcycle instead his old. Sok hope that the loan will be able to generate more income for his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle instead his old

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Mrs. Ha M. is a villager in Trapeang Krosang village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and owns a plot of land for cultivating rice. Her husband, Mr. Ouv Vean, is involved in bicycle repair. They do not earn enough money for good living conditions because their careers are in small businesses. Thus, Mrs. Ha M. decided to ask for a loan to buy timbers to repair her house. She is 25 years old and does not have children yet. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy timbers to repair her house.

loans.name: Mov

texts.en:
Mr. Mov T. is a villager in Traeuy Troeng Village in Kandal Province. He is a construction worker who earns a small income to support his household. His wife, Mrs. Eang Srey, owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile, which has a bad effect on her crop. Her husband decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to support her land to produce a better crop.

Mr. Mov T. is 46 years old and the father of three children: one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another one is a blacksmith. The youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides to support her land to produce a better crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase timbers to repair her house.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mr. Heng L. lives in Traeuy Troeng Village in the Kandal Province. He is a 49-year-old widower with four children one of who is employed in a garment factory while two others are blacksmiths. His youngest child is 17 years old and  attends the local school. Mr. Heng L. owns a 0.5-hectar on which he cultivates rice. He now faces a  problem because he does not have enough money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the rice field. Thus, he has decided to request a loan for this purpose. Any remaining money would be used to buy more fertilizers to support the field and fuel to support the pump used to water his crop.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the rice field.

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Mrs. Khun S. is a farmer in Pro Soung Village in the Take Province. Aside from running her  plantation, she is also a pig breeder. Since the breeding business is going well, she would like a loan to expand it by purchasing ten more piglets for breeding.  Her husband, Mr. Touch Nora, sells Prohok which is made from small fish. Mrs. Khun S. is 33 years old and the mother of two children. One child is attending the local school while the youngest one is only 3 years old.  Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase ten more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Kimhun

texts.en: Mrs. Kimhun Y., 53, is a rice farmer, and her husband, Mr. Oem Phalla, 54, is a horse cart taxi driver. The couple have five children and live in Speu Kert Village, Kompong Cham Province. Kimhun earns around $1.50 per day while her husband earns $2 per day. Two of their children are married and the rest are single. Kimhun now requests a loan of $400 to buy one more horse to improve her husband's horse-cart business.

loans.use: To buy one more horse to improve horse-cart business

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Mrs. Lim S. is a villager in Kor Ky village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a 33-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a laborer in a rubber field and the other one is attending the local school. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She faces a small problem to her production in the field. Thus, Mrs. Lim S. decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer and to buy fertilizer to support her field. She hopes this loan will increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To hire a laborer and to buy fertilizer to support her field.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en: Mrs. Nan C., 32, is a farmer and raises pigs in the Tuol Chombok Village, Kompong Cham Province, earning around $1.50 per day. Her husband, Mr. Dy Thea, 34, is a farmer too. Nan has two children, both in primary school. Nan requests a loan of 1,200,000 Riel to purchase more small piglets and food to feed them. She and her husband hope the loan will make their family’s living conditions better and help further their children's studies.

loans.use: To purchase more small piglets and food to feed them

loans.name: Tey

texts.en: Mr. Tey V. was born in 1965 and now he lives in Chrap village in Kampong Cham Province. He owns a plot of land for cultivating rice. He faces a small problem to his production because the rice is not growing well. He does not earn enough money for living from rice cultivation. Thus, Mr. Tey V. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support his field. He is a father of three children, who are enrolled in school. His wife, Mrs. Out Sothea, is a vegetable seller and is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support to his field.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs.Keo M. is a villager in Pro Soung Village in the Take Province. Mrs. Keo M. is 46 years old and is the mother of seven children. Three children are employed in a garment factory, two are attending school, and two are infants. Keo and her husband, Mr. Um Rim, own a piece of land where they cultivate rice for a living. The family currently lives in poor conditions and in order to improve those living conditions, Mrs.Keo M. has decided to request a loan to start a grocery business. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To start a grocery business.

loans.name: Choem

texts.en: Mrs. Choem S. is a farmer in Trapeang Krasang Village in the Takeo Province. Her husband, Mr. Khut Mork, is a construction worker who earns a small income to help support his family. In spite of their dual income, the couple still live in poor conditions and in an old house. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Choem S. is requesting a loan to buy timbers to build a new home. Mrs. Choem S. is 32 years old and the mother of two children one of whom is attending the local school and the other child is 4 years old. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy timbers to build a new home.

loans.name: Khe

texts.en:
Mrs. Khe O. is a villager in Trapeang Krasang Village in Takeo Province. She has a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Tom Narin, is a transporter who transports wood for an income. Aside from this business, he is a construction worker.

Although Mrs. Khe O. and her husband have different businesses, they still cannot support their family well. Thus, Mrs. Khe O. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to raise and she hopes to increase her income after she sells that cow. Mrs. Khe O. is 33 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are attending the local school while the others, ages nine months and four years old, are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a cow to raise

loans.name: Chhorvy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhorvy V., 30, is a grocery seller working from her house in the Roung Kou Village, Kompong Cham Province, and earning around $5 per day. Normally, Chhorvy buys groceries from her suppliers in town and sells to customers in her village. She has only one son, who is a student in primary school. Her husband, Mr. Houy Khun, 35, is a rice farmer and earns about $2 per day.

For another source of income, Chhorvy now asks for a loan of $1,200 in order to purchase a grinding machine to make "crack cake" for sale and to purchase more grocery inventory. Chhorvy hopes that the loan will improve her family’s living conditions. For her future plan, she wants her son to be a doctor or a businessman.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding machine to make "crack cake" for sale and to purchase more grocery inventory

loans.name: Choem

texts.en: Mrs. Choem S. is a farmer in Trapeang Krasang Village in the Takeo Province. Mrs. Choem S. is 38 years old and is the mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest is an infant. Her husband, Mr. Kong Thorn, breeds cows for a living.  Mrs. Choem S. is requesting a loan for her husband to purchase two more cows for his breeding business.  Her husband is pictured with her in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase two more cows for breeding.

loans.name: Noa

texts.en: Mrs. Noa R. is a farmer in Phnom Rontas Village in the Takeo Province. Mrs. Noa R. is 37 years old and the mother of five children, four of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is only five years old.  Her husband, Mr. Bun Chun, owns a small farm where he raises ducks. He does not have enough money to buy duck food so Noa is requesting a loan to purchase the duck food for her husband's business. Any remaining money would be used to buy fertilizers to support her field. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase duck food for her husband's business.

loans.name: Tith

texts.en: Mrs. Tith M. is a villager in Phneas Village in the Takeo Province. Mrs. Tith M. is 27 years old and is the mother of a three year old child. She and her husband, Mr. Hem Sien, own a piece of land on which they cultivate rice. The field is infertile and is providing a small crop. In order to alleviate this problem, Mrs. Tith M. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to increase crop yield. Her husband is presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to increase crop yield.

loans.name: Koem

texts.en: Mrs. Koem K. was born in 1954. She lives in Chambock Village in Takeo Province. She has a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. However, her field is not very fertile, so she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. Mrs. Koem K. has four children: one is a monk, two are employed in a garment factory, and one is an officer in the government. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Toem

texts.en: Mrs. Toem N. is a villager in Pour Tamok Village in the Takeo Province.  Toem N. is 52 years old and the mother of two children who are both attending the local school She earns her living by cultivating rice on a small piece of land that she owns. Her field has become infertile which is lowering her crop yield. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Toem N. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field. Her husband, Mr. Nak Tum, is a construction worker and is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her field.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en: Mrs. Phat S. is 26 years old and single. She now lives in Pour Tamok Village in Takeo Province. She is a duck breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Tuon

texts.en: Mrs. Tuon M. is a 21 year old villager in Pour Tamok Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who  faces an obstacle of infertile soil. To increase her crop yield, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers. Her husband, Mr. Bun Hing, is a fisherman and is presented in the picture on the right.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to increase her crop yield.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sao Y. is a farmer in Samraong Khang Kiet Village in Takeo Province. In her plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crop. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to amend the field to make her crop more productive.

Her husband, Mr. Lao Ream, is a motorbike taxi driver who can make only a small income to support his family. Mrs. Sao Y. is 49 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a farmer while the remaining three are attending the local school. Her husband is in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to amend the field

loans.name: Sophanny's Group

texts.en:
This is a small group loan for three members and Mrs. Sophany is group leader. Mrs. Sophanny K., 29, is a vegetable seller who transports produce to customer's home via used bycicle, earning approximately $3.75 per day. She lives with her three children, all of whom are students, in the Krolorng Village, Kompong Cham Province. Her husband, Mr. Kheav Sokhon, 33, is a bricklayer and earns about $5 per day. With her growing business, Sophanny now requests a loan of 600,000 Riel to purchase more vegetable inventory to sell. Because of her business, she is able to support her family’s living expenses and to support her children in getting a higher education. The other two members are:

1- Mrs. Sreyroth C. is a rice farmer and raises pigs. She requests a loan of 400000 Riel to purchase pig food to fatten her pigs.

2- Mrs. Soknoeurn Y. is a rice farmer and sells vegetable. She is widowed and requests a loan of 400000 to purchase more vegetables to sell.

The group lives in Chrey Vean Commune, Kampong Cham Province.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable inventory to sell

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Mrs. Soy P. is a villager in Samraong Khang Kiet Village in the Takeo Province. Soy P. is 25 years old and the mother of two young children ages 5 and 1.  She and her husband, Mr. Choek Sokhorn, cultivate rice for a living. The field has become infertile and is not producing enough of a crop. Mrs. Soy P. has decided to request a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field and increase crop yield. Her husband is shown on the right of picture.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to increase crop yield.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma Baji, married to A. A., lives in a small village called Kot Radha Kishan near the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house, in which she has been living for the last 20 years. Salma has three sons, the eldest of whom is in the 9th grade, the middle one - in the 7th grade, - while the youngest is still in kindergarten. Salma Baji’s husband earns money raising livestock: he buys buffalos and then re-sells them. Salma Baji is a housewife, taking care of the household and the family. She is currently applying for a loan to be able to purchase another buffalo for her husband's livestock business.

loans.use: Purchase of a buffalo for a livestock business

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Irshad Baji is married to Mr. B., and the couple has five children: a son and four daughters. Irshad Baji's son is in 10th grade, while her daughters stay at home and help take care of the household. The family lives in a small town called Kot Radha Kishan near the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Irshad Baji’s husband earns income selling milk to a number of shops and directly to people in the community. Irshad Baji is a housewife and also helps her husband in milking the buffalos. She is now applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband’s milk sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of a buffalo for a milk sales business

loans.name: Bilquis

texts.en:
Bilquis baji is the wife of R. A. and lives in a small place named Kot Radha Kishan of the city Kasur, Pakistan. Kot Radha Kishan is 40km from Kasur. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 18 years. She is the mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. Her elder son completed his education till 5th standard and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Her younger son is in 6th standard. Her eldest daughter does household work. Her younger daughters are in kindergarten.

Bilquis baji’s husband is a milk seller, having experience of 50 years. He has a milk shop on the main road and everybody comes to him for buying milk. Bilquis baji is a housewife and helps her husband in getting milk from the buffalos. She is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her husband’s milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk business

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Irshad Baji, married to J. F., lives in a small town called Kot Radha Kishan, located near Kasur, Pakistan. She has been living in the town for the last 8 years. Irshad Baji has two daughters, the eldest of whom is 7 years old, while the youngest is 1 year old. For the past five years, Irshad Baji’s husband has been working as a tractor driver, while Irshad Baji has been earning income running a milk sales business. She owns two buffalos that produce up to 24 liters of milk per day. On average, Irshad Baji earns US$5-6 per day from the milk sales. Currently, she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her milk business.

loans.use: Purchase of another buffalo for a milk business

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida Baji is married to M. A. and lives in a town called Kot Radha Kishan located 40 km from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Sajida Baji owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 15 years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Sajida Baji’s husband earns income selling milk - it is a business that he has been in for the last 50 years. He makes about US$5 to US$6 per day. Sajida Baji is a housewife and sews clothes for her neighbors to earn extra income for the family. She is now applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her husband’s milk sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of a buffalo for a milk sales business

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en: Kosar Baji is married to N. A. and lives in Kot Radha Kishan, a small town near the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Kosar Baji has been living there for the last 25 years. She has two sons and two daughters: her elder son is in the 10th grade, while the younger one doesn’t yet go to school. Her daughters stay at home and help take care of the household. Kosar Baji’s husband earns income running a shop where he sells milk to people from the local community. He has been in this profession for the last 30 years. Kosar Baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of the family. She is currently asking for a loan to buy an additional buffalo for her husband’s milk sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of an additional buffalo for a milk sales business

loans.name: Geejan

texts.en: Geejan Baji, married to H. A., lives in Kot Radha Kishan, 40 km from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Geejan Baji owns a four-room brick house, in which she has been living for the last 35 years. She has two sons and two daughters: Geejan Baji's elder son has finished five years of schooling and now drives an auto-rickshaw, a local 3-wheel motor-vehicle. Her younger son is currently in the 8th grade. Geejan Baji's daughters stay at home and help take care of the household. Geejan Baji’s husband earns income selling milk obtained from buffalos to people in the local community. He has been in the business for the past 40 years and, presently, owns two buffalos. Geejan Baji herself is a housewife, taking care of the household and the family. She has successfully re-paid her two previous loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now, she is applying for a new loan to buy an additional buffalo for her husband's milk sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of a buffalo for a milk sales business

loans.name: Mahwish

texts.en: Mahwish Baji is married to A. A.. Since last year, the couple has been living in a small town called Kot Radha Kishan, located 40 km from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Mahwish Baji’s husband earns income selling buffalo milk to a number of shops. He has been involved in this business for the last 10 years. Presently, A. A. owns two buffalos.  Mahwish Baji herself is a housewife, taking care of the household. She is now applying for a loan to buy an additional buffalo for her husband’s milk sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of a buffalo for a milk sales business

loans.name: Azizan

texts.en: Azizan baji is the wife of Z. A. and lives in a small place named Kot Radha Kishan of the city Kasur, Pakistan. Kot Radha Kishan is 40 kilometers from Kasur. She has been living in this place for the last 20 years. She is the mother of three children: one son and two daughters. Her son is in 10th standard and her daughters are in 8th standard. Azizan baji’s husband runs a grocery shop. Azizan baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband’s grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: Mizhgona

texts.en: For almost five years now, Mizhgona has been in her business. Everyday, she services many brides. In general, she offers bride dresses, manicures, pedicures, make-up, and hair styles. Her salon is always full of clients because she does her job professionally. She wants to take out a loan to extend her business. She wants to buy additional equipment and hire an employee. Mizhgona likes her job very much because she likes to see the smiles of happy brides everyday.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her beauty salon

loans.name: Lukia Nakiranda’S Group

texts.en:
Lukia is a leader of 5 members of a group. She is a 46-year-old married woman with 5 children, aged between 29 and 21. Three of her children go to school. Lukia doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She is a very responsible member within her group. She resides in and owns a 3-room house, where she is staying with 4 people. They have electricity but no piped water at home.

The family gets 3 meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area that is on the outskirts of Kampala. Lukia sells bricks at her home. She buys these blocks from different areas and uses a lorry to bring them to her home. She sells to all categories of people, both wholesale and retail.

Her main challenges are water, thieves, and defaulters. Lukia works 7 days a week and has been with MCDT for 9 years, servicing her eighteenth loan. She wants to use this loan to expand her business and aspires to build rental rooms.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.en:
Gulnoza B. has been selling the national coat called “chapan” for more than seven years. These coats are widely used by men in the region. She buys the coats from villagers and sells them in the central market.

Some years ago, she became a widow and has been raising and educating her two children. Gulnoza wants to use a loan to enhance the business and increase her income, which will provide her family a brighter future.

loans.use: To purchase additional coats for resale

loans.name: Maria Nakagwa’S Group

texts.en:
Maria is a leader of 4 members of a group. She is a 38-year-old married woman with 8 children, aged between 22 and 1. Four of her children go to school. Maria also takes care of 3 orphans. She resides in and rents a single-room house, where she is staying with 4 people. They don’t have electricity or piped water at home.

The family gets 2 meals a day and rarely takes tea. She resides and works in a semi-urban area that is on the outskirts of Kampala. Maria sells secondhand clothes and moves on foot selling them; she doesn’t have a fixed place. She sells to all categories of people. Maria’s monthly expenses include medication, rent, and food for the family.

Maria works 6 days a week and has been with MCDT for 4 years, servicing her eighth loan. She wants to use this loan to expand her business and aspires to sell new clothes.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Safina Birungi's Group

texts.en:
Safina is a leader of 4 members of a group. She is a 54-year-old widowed woman with 6 children, aged between 38 and 21. None of her children go to school. Safina also takes care of 4 grandchildren. She resides in and owns a 2-room house, where she is staying with 6 people. They don’t have electricity but have piped water at home.

The family gets one meal a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area that is on the outskirts of Kampala. Safina operates a retail shop in Kyebando Nsooba, one of the city suburbs, and buys her products from Bwaise. Safina uses public transport to go back and forth to her business. She sells to all categories of people, and her monthly expenses include school fees, medication, rent, and food for the family.

Safina works 6 days a week and has been with MCDT for 6 years, servicing her thirteenth loan. She wants to use this loan to expand her business and aspires to sell wholesale.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rose Nalwadda’S Group

texts.en:
Rose is a leader of 4 members of a group. She is a 46-year-old married woman with 6 children, aged between 30 and 8. Two of her children go to school. Rose takes care of 4 grandchildren. She resides in and owns a 6-room house, where she is staying with 6 people. Rose takes care of additional family members. They have electricity but no piped water at home.

The family gets 3 meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area that is on the outskirts of Kampala. Rose operates a retail shop in Kamwokya Kifumbira, one of the city suburbs, and buys her products from Kampala City. Rose uses public transport to go back and forth to her business. She sells to all categories of people, and her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

Rose works 7 days a week and has been with MCDT for 8 years, servicing her sixteenth loan. She wants to use this loan to expand her business and aspires to sell wholesale.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Fayzidin

texts.ru:
Шарипов Файзидин, 1983 года рождения, женат и у них 3 детей. Начала свой бизнес с продажи продуктов питания. У него 8 лет опыта в этой деятельности. Накопив капитал Файзидин купил собственный магазин и переоборудовал его под продовольственный магазин. У него в ассортименте все необходимые продукты питания, мука, растительное масло, сахар, конфеты, хлебобулочные и кондитерские изделия, печени, пряники, консервная продукция и т.д. Также в продаже имеются товары народного потребления и хозтовары, стиральные порошки, туалетное мыло, шампуни и другие принадлежности. У илхома много постоянных клиентов. Покупает свой товар в магазинах Сафар-Центра.
Файзидин хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 4000 сомони чтоб закупить сахар, масло и муки.
texts.en:
Fayzidin S. was born in 1983, he is married and has three children. He started his business selling food and produce. He has eight years of experience in this field. By saving some capital, Fayzidin has bought his own store and remodeled it as a convenience store. In his assortment there are all kinds of necessary products such as flour, vegetable oil, sugar, candy, baked goods and sweets, cookies, doughnuts, canned products and more. There are also products for personal and household use such as detergents, soap, shampoo and other products. He has many regular customers. Fayzidin buys his merchandise from stores in the Safar center.

He wants to receive a loan with the help of Kiva for 4000 somoni (USD$1,200) to buy more sugar, oil and flour.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, oil and flour

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani Baji is married to Mr. Khalil and lives in a small town called Kot Radha Kishan, loacted near the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Rani Baji owns a two-room brick house, in which she has been living for the last 10 years. She has three children: two sons and a daughter. None of her children go to school. Rani Baji’s husband runs a milk-sales business: he chose this profession 15 years ago, learning from his parents who are also involved in the dairy business. Rani Baji herself is a housewife, taking care of the household and the family. She has successfully re-paid her two previous loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now, she is applying for a new loan to buy an additional buffalo to expand her husband’s milk sales business.

Rani Baji is borrowing together with a few other people from the local community: Sharifan Baji, who needs a loan to buy bricks for sale, Safia Baji, who will use the loan money to buy milk cream to sell to grocery shops, Hafizan Baji, who wants to borrow to be able to buy a buffalo for her milk sales business, and Zareena Baji, who needs additional capital to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are held equally responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of a buffalo for a milk sales business

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru:
Шарифова Саида, 1988 года рождения, Начала свой бизнес с продажи продуктов питания. У нее 2 года опыта в этой деятельности. Саида арендовала магазин и переоборудовал его под продовольственный магазин. У нее в ассортименте все необходимые продукты питания, мука, растительное масло, сахар, разновидность конфет производства России и Ирана, хлебобулочные и кондитерские изделия, печени, пряники, консервная продукция и т.д. Также в продаже имеются товары народного потребления и хозтовары. У илхома много постоянных клиентов. Покупает свой товар в магазинах Сафар-Центра.
Саида хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 4000 сомони чтоб закупить масло и муки.
texts.en:
Saida S. was born in 1988. She started her own business selling food and produce and has two years experience. Saida has rented out a shop and renovated it as a food store. In her assortment of inventory there are all kinds of necessary food products such as flour, vegetable oil, sugar, candies from Russia and Iran, baked good and confectionery products, cookies, gingerbread and canned goods. There are also household and daily use products available. Saida has many regular customers. She buys her merchandise from stores in Safar-center. Saida wants to receive a loan with the help of Kiva for the amount of 4000 somoni (USD$1,200) to buy oil and flour.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy oil and flour

loans.name: Safina Nakasagga’S Group

texts.en:
Safina is a leader of 4 members of a group. She is a 34-year-old married woman with 2 children, ages 12 and 8. All her children go to school. Safina takes care of additional family members. She resides in and owns a 5-room house, where she is staying with 6 people. They have electricity but no piped water at home.

The family gets 3 meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area that is on the outskirts of Kampala. Safina operates a retail shop in Kamwokya Kifumbira, one of the city suburbs, and buys her products from Kampala City. Safina uses public transport to go back and forth to her business. She sells to all categories of people, and her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

Safina works 7 days a week and has been with MCDT for 3 years, servicing her sixth loan. She wants to use this loan to expand her business and aspires to build more rooms for rent.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ameena's Group

texts.en:
Ameena baji is the widow of M.Ashiq and lives in a small place named Kot Radha Kishan of the city Kasur, Pakistan. Kot Radha Kishan is 40 km from Kasur. She has been living in this place for the last 32 years. She is the mother of four sons. Her first two sons are daily wage laborers. Her younger son buys goats for reselling. Her youngest son is a milk seller by profession. He has been in this business for the past 3 years. Ameena baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo to expand her son’s milk selling business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Zuhra baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to resell. Nusrat baji and Jamila baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for their milk selling business. Farzana baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (tea, sugar and milk) for her tea stall. Rasoolan baji wants a loan to buy buffalo to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for milk business

loans.name: Gulnor

texts.ru:
Полвонова Гулнор, 1970 года рождения, замужем и у них 4 детей. Начала свой бизнес с продажи детской одежды. У нее 8 лет опыта в этой деятельности. Она торгует на рынке «Мубориз» Гисарского района. У нее в ассортименте детская одежда, начиная с младенца до школьного возраста. Это комплект детской одежды, джемпера, джинсовые брюки и костюмы,  носки, нижнее белье и т.д.. У Гульнор есть постоянных клиенты, которые приходя к ней хотят видеть новые товары. Гульнора постоянно обновляет свой товар чтоб не потерять постоянных клиентов. Покупает свой товар на оптовом рынке Корвон.
Гульнор хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 3500 сомони чтоб закупить сезонный товар, детские джинсовые брюки и костьюмы.
texts.en:
Gulnor P. was born in 1970, married and has four children. She started her business selling children's clothes. She has eight years of experience in this field. She sells on the Muboriz market in the Gissar region. In her assortment there is children's clothing for todlers and school age kids. There are items such as sweaters, jeans and suits, socks, underwear and more. Gulnor has regular customers who come to her for new merchandise. Gulnor always updates her inventory so that she does not lose her returning clients. She buys the merchandise on the wholesale market Korvon. Gulnor wants to receive a loan with the help of Kiva for the amount of 3500 somoni (USD$1,050) to buy seasonal merchandise, children's jean pants and jackets.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's jean pants and jackets

loans.name: Mary Kalenganire’S Group

texts.en:
Mary is a leader of 4 members of a group. She is a 50-year-old widowed woman with 5 children, aged between 30 and 20. One of her children goes to school. Mary takes care of additional family members. She resides in and rents a 3-room house, where she is staying with 6 people. They have electricity and piped water at home.

The family gets 3 meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area that is on the outskirts of Kampala. Mary operates a retail shop in Kamwokya Kifumbira, one of the city suburbs, and buys her products from Kampala City. Mary uses public transport to get back and forth to her business. She sells to all categories of people. She sells to an average of 20 people a day, and her monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and food for the family.

Mary works 7 days a week and has been with MCDT for 3 years, servicing her sixth loan. She wants to use this loan to build a house in the plot she bought from previous loans.

loans.use: To build a house in the plot she bought from previous loans

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia Baji is married to S. M. and lives in a small town called Kot Radha Kishan near the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Razia Baji has been living there for the last 30 years. She and her husband have four daughters: the eldest one sews clothes, charging US$2 per dress, while the others stay at home and help take care of the household. Razia Baji’s husband earns income selling milk. He has been in this business for the past 20 years and is now well-known in the local community, since most people buy milk at his store. S. M. earns about US$4 to US$5 per day. Razia Baji herself is a housewife and helps her husband in milking the buffalos. Razia Baji has already before taken out a loan - from Asasah, a micro-finance institute in Pakistan - and has been successful in repaying it. Now, she is applying for another loan to buy an additional buffalo for her husband’s milk sales business.
