Razia Baji is borrowing together with a group of several women: Zareena Baji needs a loan to buy goats for re-sale; Rehana Baji is borrowing to buy flowers for bouquet-making and sale; Ghazala Baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop; and Jamila Baji is in need of a loan to buy beams for her shutter-making business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are equally responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of a buffalo for a milk sales business

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran Baji is married to R. M. and lives in Kot Radha Kishan, a small town near the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house, in which she has been living for the last 25 years. Sugran Baji has five children: a son and four daughters. Her eldest daughter has completed five years of education and is now working in a factory. The other children stay at home and help with household work. Sugran Baji’s husband owns a brick-sales business, while Sugran Baji herself is a housewife, taking care of the household and the family. She is now applying for a loan to buy an additional amount of bricks for her husband’s brick-sales business.

She is borrowing together with a group of other women: Irshad Baji, Shabnam Baji, and Nazia Baji each need a loan to buy bricks for re-sale; Rashida Baji is borrowing to buy groceries for her grocery store, while Safia Baji and Majidan Baji each need a loan to buy a buffalo for their milk-sales businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are equally responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of bricks for re-sale

loans.name: Suraiya

texts.en: Suraiya Baji lives in a small town called Kot Radha Kishan near the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house, in which she has been living for the last 30 years. Suraiya Baji has three sons: the eldest one drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheel motor vehicle), while the other two work in a factory. Suraiya Baji’s husband earns income selling milk - he has been engaged in this business for the last 40 years and presently owns one buffalo. Suraiya Baji herself is a housewife, taking care of the household and the family. She is now applying for a loan to buy an additional buffalo for her husband’s milk sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of a buffalo for a milk sales business

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida baji, the wife of A. A., resides in Chichawatni, Pakistan. She has lived in this city for 20 years. She owns a two-room brick house. Zubaida baji couldn’t continue her studies after completing the 5th standard grade because her parents couldn’t bear her education expense. 

Zubaida baji’s husband has a livestock business. He buys cattle to raise and resell. He has been involved in this business for the past 10 years. Zubaida baji is a housewife. She prefers to do household work and take care of her family. 

Zubaida baji successfully repaid two previous loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members. Rashida baji wants a loan to buy honey to resell. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Taj baji wants a loan to repair her vehicle, a Hyundai Shehzore pickup truck, which she uses for loading. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy sheep and goats to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

NOTE: Baji, which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to resell

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
I. baji, the wife of M.I., lives in Chichawatni, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house where she has lived for the last 20 years. She completed her education through the 5th standard grade. She has one son who is in the 2nd standard grade. 

I. baji’s husband drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). He has been in this profession for the past 15 years. I. baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. 

I. baji is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her husband so that he able to earn more profit and meet the needs of her family.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members. Shamim baji and Rani baji want loans to buy seasonal fruits to resell. Latifan baji and Bilquis baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim baji, the wife of M. A., lives in Chichawatni, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 20 years. She completed her education until the 8th standard grade. She has one daughter who is in the 4th standard grade. 

Shamim baji’s husband has been selling peanuts for the past 10 years. He buys peanuts from the northern areas (Murree and Naran). Shamim baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. 

Shamim baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more peanuts to expand her husband’s peanut selling business.

She is joined in her loan group by four more members. Azra baji wants a loan to buy tools to repair vehicles for her workshop. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for hauling. Rafea baji and Hafizan baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy peanuts to resell

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat baji, the wife of A. H., lives in Chichawatni, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house where she has been living for the past 20 years. She got married after completing the 8th standard grade. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her eldest son works in a workshop. Her younger son is 12 years old. Her daughter, who is 18 years old, stays at home and does household work. 

Mussarat baji’s husband is a driver by profession and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Mussarat baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. 

Mussarat baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

She is joined in her loan group by five more members. Samina baji and Uzma baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Zareena baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business. Shahida baji wants a loan to buy utensils (plates, glass and spoons) for her hotel (food) business. Ghafooran baji wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar baji, the wife of M. J., lives in Chichawatni, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 20 years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Her younger son is just 7 years old. Her daughters stay at home and do household work. 

Kosar baji’s husband buys fruit from a fruit market and sells it in the community. Kosar baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. 

Kosar baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to repair her son’s auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

She is joined in her loan group by five more members. Abida baji wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business. Suraiya baji and Zahida baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Ramzana baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy chick peas and rice for her food business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo T. was born in 1966 and she now lives in Samraong Khang Kiet Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who currently faces a small problem because her field now has infertile soil which affects her crop so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer to amend her field to make her crop better. Her husband, Mr. Roth Mos, helps her on the plantation. Mrs. Keo T. has two children who are both enrolled in school. Her husband is in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer to make her crop better

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en: Mrs. Yoem T. is a villager in Kruos Village in the Takeo Province. Yoem T. is 26 years old and is the mother of three young children. She and her husband, Mr. Bun San, are farmers. Their field has become infertile and crop yields have diminished. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Yoem T. is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers to support the field.  Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to support the field.

loans.name: Blandine

texts.fr: Née le 02 Juin 1980 à Parakou dans le département du Borgou au Nord du BENIN, dame A. Blandine est de nationalité béninoise et est mariée à Monsieur DAVINON Paulin. Elle a à sa charge deux enfants: Marius et Bernice âgés respectivement de 7 ans et 4 ans. Coiffeuse de profession et diplômée depuis les années 1999 à Cotonou, elle a ouvert son atelier à son domicile et a sous sa responsabilité trois apprentis.Elle vient solliciter son deuxième crédit à ALIDé pour s'acheter un séchoir afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born on June 2, 1980 in Parakou in Borgou Province in the north of Benin, Mrs. Blandine A. is a citizen of Benin and married to Mr. Paulin Davinon. She is raising two children, Marius and Bernice, aged 7 and 4 respectively.

A hairdresser by trade, she earned her diploma in 1999 in Cotonou. She opened a salon in her home and is responsible for three apprentices. She has requested this, her second loan from Alidé to buy a hairdryer so as to better satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 6 dozen hair extensions and a hairdryer

loans.name: Sean

texts.en: Mrs. Sean S. lives in Romeat Village in the Takeo Province. She owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. She is a 42-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one is a construction worker. The youngest child is 16 years old and is still in school. Although Mrs. Sean S. and her children work, they still live in poor conditions. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Sean S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. This is the second time of Mrs. Sean S. has requested a loan in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Mariée à Monsieur HOUNNOU Justin, chauffeur de profession, dame A. Jeanne de nationalité béninoise, est née vers les années 1968 dans le département du Mono  au sud-ouest du BENIN. Elle vend depuis 5 ans des feuilles, racines et des écorces d'arbres utilisées dans la médecine traditionnelle pour guérir plusieurs maux. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour s'approvisionner en feuilles et différentes racines de plantes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jeanne A. is a citizen of Benin and was born circa 1968 in the Mono Department (Southeast Benin). She's married to Mr. Justin HOUNNOU, a professional driver. Mrs. A. has been selling leaves, roots and tree barks, used in traditional medicine to heal several sicknesses. She's seeking this loan to purchase leaves and various plant roots.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 sacks of various tree roots and leaves

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Mrs. Pich V. lives in Ampil Village in the Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Pen Khouv, are farmers. They have two children one of whom is employed in a shoe factory while the other attends the local school. Although Mrs. Pich V. and her family members all work, they still cannot support the family well. Thus, Mrs. Pich V. has decided to request for a loan to buy a cow for breeding which she hopes will increase her standard of living. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Chroek

texts.en: Mrs. Chroek M. is a villager in Tuol Kandal Cheing Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her household. Her husband, Mr. Phon Phoeurn, is a motorbike taxi driver. In this business, he now faces a small problem because his motorbike is too old and he spends much money on gasoline to support his old motorbike. His wife decided to ask for a loan to buy a new motorbike for her husband's business and she hopes to save more income with this way. Mrs. Chroek M. is 44 years old and the mother of one child, who is working in a rubber field. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband's business.

loans.name: Chroek

texts.en: Mrs. Chroek K. is a clothes seller in Tuol Kandal Cheing Village in Kampong Cham Province. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she is requesting a loan to buy more fashion clothes to resell. Mrs. Chroek K. is a 36-year-old widow with three children who are all attending the local school. Mrs. Chroek K. hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy more fashion clothes to resell.

loans.name: Zinsou Rufine

texts.fr: Dame A. Zinsou Rufine est née le 02 Juillet 1970 à Cotonou. Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, elle revend dans une boutique ouverte à son domicile, de la farine de manioc, du riz, du haricot, de l'huile de palme, et autres produits de ménage. Actuellement, elle est confrontée à une rupture de stock et manque cruellement de moyens financiers pour se ravitailler. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour s'approvisionner.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zinsou Rufine A. was born on July 2, 1970 in Cotonou. Married and the mother of two children, she resells, in a small store at her home, tapioca, rice, beans, palm oil, and other staples. She's currently out of stock and lacks financial means to resupply her stock, which is why she's seeking this loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy one sack of tapioca, one 25 liters of palm oil, and 50 kg of rice

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Mrs. Sao S. was born in 1954 and she now lives in Boeng Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who currently owns 2 hectares for cultivating rice. In this plantation, she faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds to plant. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and she will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers to support her crop. Her husband, Mr. Choek Chorn, helps her on the plantation. Mrs. Sao S. has two children, one of whom is a garment factory worker, while the younger one is a farmer. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds to plant and fertilizers to support her crop.

loans.name: Soeurng

texts.en: Mrs. Soeurng T. is a villager in Kradas Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer. Because her plantation has infertile soil, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field and make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. An Ngeun, assists her on the plantation. Mrs. Soeurng T. is 37 years old and the mother of two children, who are both attending the local school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Mrs. Say Y. lives in Kradas Village in Kampong Cham Province, and she is a farmer. She owns 2 hectares to cultivate rice. On this plantation, she now cannot cultivate rice because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy rice seeds to plant rice. Mrs. Say Y. is a 47-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the other is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds to plant rice.

loans.name: Yong

texts.en: Mrs. Yong Y. is 40 years old and single and she is a farmer in Krodas Village in Kampong Cham Province. She now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds to cultivate, so she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to amend her field. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr: Dame K. odette de nationnalité béninoise est née vers 1976 à Houéyogbé dans le département du MONO. Elle est mariée à Monsieur DAGBO Simon,Soudeur de profession et a 03 enfants à sa charge. Ambulante, elle vend la friperie et avait bénéficié depuis Novembre 2006, du Micro Crédit aux Plus Pauvre (MCPP) de montant 30000Fcfa initié par le gouvernement béninois. Après avoir bien remboursé ce crédit, elle a bénéficié d'un second crédit de 60000Fcfa qu'elle a fini de rembourser un mois avant la dernière échéance prévue. Elle a connu du succès dans son activité et vient solliciter pour son troisième crédit 100000 F cfa pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Odette K. is a citizen of Benin. She was born around 1976 in Houéyogbé in MONO County, is married to Mr. Simon DAGBO, a welder by trade, and has three children in her care. Going door-to-door, she sells second-hand clothing and had benefited since November 2006 from an MCPP loan (micro-loans for those who are the poorest) in the amount of 30,000 francs CFA introduced by the government of Benin. After having repaid this loan, she was the recipient of a second one in the amount of 60,000 francs, which she finished repayiing a month ahead of schedule. She has experienced success in her business and has come to request as her third loan 100,000 francs to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Keov

texts.en: Mr. Keov V. is a villager in Boeng Basak Village in Kampong Cham Province. He helps his wife, Mrs. Va Sinat, with her food-selling business. Because this business is going well, they want to expand it; so Mr. Keov V. decided to ask for a loan to buy ingredients to make the delicious food for his customers. Mr. Keov V. is 45 years old and the father of two children.  One child is attending the local school, while the other is two years old, too young to work or study.  Mr. Keov V.'s wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make delicious food for his customers.

loans.name: Anasthasie

texts.fr: Mariée à AFFOGNON Rémy, dame K. Anasthasie est agée de 38 ans et est née au BENIN. Elle vit avec son mari à Cotonou, plus précisement dans la zone des ambassades. Elle distribue à ses clients qui ont dans leur majorité des boutiques, des cacahouètes qu'elle met en bouteilles. Indépendamment de cette activité, elle vend de la bouillie et des beignets. Elle demande ce crédit pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Anasthasie K. is married to Remy Affognon. She is 38 years old and was born in Benin. She lives with her husband in Cotonou, more precisely in the embassy zone. Anasthasie distributes peanuts that she bottles, to her clients, who are mostly shop owners. Besides this business she also sells millet porridge and doughnuts. She is requesting this loan to improve her business.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sack of bottles, a sack of peanuts and a sack of cashew nuts

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en: Mrs. Kunthea Y., 35, is a rice farmer, who makes around $2 per day.  She lives with her three children, two of whom are students and the another is a worker, in the Tropeanh Boeung Village, Kompong Cham Province. Her husband, Mr. Sokchea Kut, 34, is a farm worker, earning around $4 per day from farming other people's fields. With her sustainable business and desire to grow it in the future, Kunthea now requests a loan of riel 2,000,000 to purchase a pumping machine to farm rice in the dry season. With the income generated by her business, Kunthea will be able to support her family’s living expenses and her children’s studies.

loans.use: To purchase a pumping machine to farm rice in the dry season

loans.name: Vuoch

texts.en: Mrs. Vuoch L. lives in Spork Reach Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a pig breeder who raises twelve pigs. Her husband, Mr. Liv Bunla, is a taxi driver who can generate a small income to support his family. Although Mrs. Vuoch L. and her husband both have businesses, they still cannot afford to buy a piece of land to keep and then re-sell later. Thus, Mrs. Vuoch L. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Mrs. Vuoch L. is 38 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school, while the youngest one is five years old and too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to keep and re-sell later at a better price.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom S. was born in1960, and she now lives in Sala Lek Pram Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a housewife who cooks very delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Seng Saroeurn, is a soldier who can make $50 per month, which is a small income to support his family. Because this family is building their house, which has not been completed yet, Mrs. Mom S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a front door. Mrs. Mom S. has three children, who are all attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a front door for her house under construction

loans.name: Martine Danlome

texts.fr: Dame AMOUZOUVI Martine est agée de 35 ans. Elle s'est mariée à WABI Waliou. De ce mariage est sorti 02 enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge . Elle vend de la friperie qu'elle achète au marché MISSEBO de COTONOU. Pour toucher plus sa clientèle, elle a construit une boutique sur fond propre. Elle manque de ressources financières pour se ravitailler et proposer à ses clients de nouveaux produits. Elle demande ce crédit pour s'approvisionner et donner satisfaction à sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Ms. Martine AMOUZOUVI is 35 years old. She is married to Waliou WABI, and togther they have two children, both in school and in her care. She sells second-hand clothing that she buys at the MISSEBO market of COTONOU. To bring in more customers, she built a shop with her own funds. She lacks the financial resources to restock her inventory and to offer her customers new products. She is asking for this loan to get supplies and to provide satisfaction to her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Khuon

texts.en:
Khuon S. is 34 years old and lives with three children and her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Since 2006, she has had a business selling sugar cane juice from her home. She typically makes US$6 in revenue each day, while her husband is a construction worker and sometime operates a motor-taxi whenever he free from construction. He earns a combined US$5 each day. All the children are students and she spends around US$15 on their education.
Khuon S. would like to take out a loan of US$500 to create another business by selling porridge from her home in the morning. In her future plan, she wants all the children to get a higher class.

loans.use: Selling porridge.

loans.name: Fatma's Group

texts.en:
Fatma has been selling handicrafts in Zanzibar for two years and is currently able to earn approximately $85 each month. A large market exists for wood carvings, masks, and other local crafts because many tourists visit Zanzibar and purchase these local mementos.

This will be Fatma's first loan, and with it she plans to buy more of these handicrafts as inventory for her shop. She intends to put any increase in profits that results from the loan back into her shop to continue to expand her business.

Fatma is 28 years old, married, and has three children, aged two, five, and eight. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Tabia, Zainab, and Tatu.

loans.use: To buy more handicrafts to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Sean

texts.en: Mrs. Sean S. was born in 1955, and now she lives in Khnach Krasang village in Kampong Province. She and her husband, Mr. Leang Hea, are farmers who cultivate both rice and vegetables. They have two children, one of whom is a construction worker, while the other is a motorbike repairer. Even though Mrs. Sean S.’s family members have various businesses, they still live in poor conditions. In the order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sean S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to enrich her vegetable and rice fields. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to help her vegetable and rice fields.

loans.name: Yath

texts.en: Mrs. Yath V. is a villager in Doung Pras Village in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Chheng Long Chhuon, are farmers who cultivate rice on 2 hectares of rice fields. On the plantation, they now face a small problem because their field's soil is infertile.  Thus, Mrs. Yath V. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field. Mrs. Yath V. is 47 years old and the mother of three children -- one of whom is a farmer, while the remaining two are attending the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her rice field.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en: Mrs. Chhin S. was born in 1974 and she lives in Samraong Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a vegetable farmer who owns 2 hectares for cultivating. In her plantation, she faces a small problem because her field is infertile soil which affects her crop, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to amend her field to make her plants more productive. Her husband, Mr. Chhun Tith, helps his wife in the plantation. Mrs. Chhin S. has two children who are both attending the local school. Her husband is in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to amend her field

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: Née le 25 Août 1965 à ABOMEY au centre du BENIN, dame Q. Yvette de nationalité béninoise et d'ethnie Fon est mariée à Monsieur CHADARE Marius, transitaire au Port Autonome de Cotonou. Elle a trois enfants à charge tous scolarisés : Charles, Noël et Célestine. Elle expose ses produits dans une baraque aménagée à la devanture de son domicile. Elle offre à ses clients de la farine de manioc, du sucre, du savon, des biscuits et du lait. Éprouvant d'énormes difficultés pour faire face aux nombreuses charges qu'elle a sous sa responsabilité et compte tenu du faible bénéfice qu'elle réalise sur ses divers articles, elle ambitionne se lancer dans la commercialisation de l'igname, du manioc et de la patate. Elle vient donc solliciter ce crédit pour saisir cette nouvelle opportunité qui s'offre à elle pendant cette période de récolte de ces différents produits.
texts.en:
Born on August 25, 1965 in Abomey in Central Benin, Mrs. Yvette Q. is a citizen of Benin, from the Fon ethnic group. She's married to Mr. Maris CHADARE, a freight agent in the Autonomous Port in Cotonou. She has three school-attending children to support : Charles, Noël and Célestine. She displays her products in a little stand in front of her house. She sells tapioca, sugar, soap, biscuits and milk. As she's experiencing huge difficulties in providing for the numerous expenses under her responsibility, and due to the small profit she makes out of the sale of these various items, she ambitions to start selling yam, cassava and potatoes. She's thus seeking this loan to seize the opportunity she's being offered since it is now the harvesting season of these products.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 sacks of yam, 2 sacks of potatoes, and one sack of cassava

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun S., 54, is married and lives with her husband and one child in the Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works together with her husband, Tom Vun, 60, in a rice field and also sells fish at the market to earn a living. She is able to make US$2 each day. She says her farming is just to support her family members and she never sells rice for extra profit. Farming is hard and makes less output now because the weather conditions are bad. The price of fertilizers has increased by double over the past year. Most of the farmers cannot afford the high price of fertilizers. Bun S. would like to take out a loan of US$200 to build a cage for her cow and to purchase fishing nets for her husband to catch more fish.

loans.use: To build a cage for her cow and to purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Mr. Sorn C. is a villager in Knach Krasang village in Kampong Cham Province. His wife, Mrs. Kim Sreymom, is a housewife who takes care of the house and their child. She is on the left of the photo. Mr. Sorn C. owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. He faces a challenge in his field. Thus, he has decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and hire laborers to enable his field to yield a more productive crop. He is 24 years old and the father of a one-year-old child, too young to work or study.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and hire laborers to enrich his field and make the crop more productive.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. Sim P. is a villager in Samraong Village in Kampong Cham Province. She owns 2 hectares to cultivate rice to earn a living. On this plantation she now faces an obstacle because her field is infertile, which badly affects her crop. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Sim P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field and make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Mon Vuth, assists his wife with the agriculture. Mrs. Sim P. is 36 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a farmer, while the youngest one is attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field and make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em T. is a farmer in Samraong Village in Kampong Cham Province. Because her plantation field is infertile, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to enable her field to yield a better crop. Her husband, Mr. Oem Lim, helps his wife with the agriculture. Mrs. Em T. is 66 years old and the mother of a child who is a farmer. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to help her field yield a better crop.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam C., 53, is a widowed farmer who lives with two of her children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a farmer and raises cows to earn a living and is able to make US$ 4 per day. She is aided by two of her children who are employed as garment factory workers.

At home she still takes care of her elderly mother and father. She says every month she pays around US$ 35 and US$ 5 on utilities. Sam C. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase wood to rebuild a proper stable for her cows.

loans.use: To rebuild a proper stable for her cows

loans.name: Bizume's Group

texts.en:
Bizume sells firewood in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. She is currently able to earn approximately $60 each month in profit from the sale of this fuel. She is now requesting her first loan so that she can purchase more inventory and invest the increase in profits back into her business so that it can continue to grow.

Bizume is 36 years old, divorced, and has four children, aged 6, 10, 17, and 18. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Kazija and Aziza.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to sell at retail prices.

loans.name: Moung

texts.en: Mrs. Moung S. is a villager in Steung Ping village in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Chin Chea, are farmers who cultivate both rice and vegetables. With their revenue, they can purchase very little because they own only a small plot of land. Mrs. Moung S. is 53 years old and the mother of five children; two of whom are farmers, another one is a laborer, and the other two are attending the local school. Although Mrs. Moung S.’s family members have different businesses, they still cannot afford to take care of their family very well. Thus, Mrs. Moung S. has decided to ask for a loan to pay for growing potatoes. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband is on the right of photo.

loans.use: To pay for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Limkheng

texts.en: Mr. Limkheng C., 53, makes about $5 per day farming in the village of Kork Kandal in Kompong Cham Province. Her husband, Mr. Theng Yen, is 55 years old and earns about $5 per day making wooden cupboards from their home. Limkheng has five children, two single and three married. Limkheng now requests a loan of $500 to purchase a pumping machine and fertilizer to use in her farming business and to buy a motorcycle for transporting produce. Limkheng realizes that the loans will help her produce enough income to cover her family’s living expenses and further her children’s studies.

loans.use: To purchase a pumping machine and fertilizer to use in her farming business and to buy a motorcycle to transporting produce.

loans.name: Idi

texts.ru: Сафоев Иди житель района Файзабод.Возраст 40 лет,женат,имеет  8 детей. Образование незаконченное высшее.По специальности агроном.Заработная плата маленькая,поэтому клиент дополнительно занимается куплей продажей фруктов.Иди скупает у местных жителей фрукты и реализует их на рынке.Бизнес является основным источником  дохода его большой семьи.Кредит нужен клиенту что бы увеличить денежный оборот.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Idi S. lives in the Fayzabad region. He is forty years old, married, and has eight children. He did not finish a college degree. He is an agronomist by profession. His wages are very low, and therefore the client buys and sells fruit as well. He buys fruit from locals and sells it at the market. This business is the primary source of income for this large family. The client requires a loan in order to increase turnover. He plans to pay off the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing turnover

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa K. is a 55-year-old widow and mother of five children, who have completed school. Hawa has been selling clothing door-to-door for the past twelve years. She is constrained by funds to run the business, so she wants a loan to purchase assorted clothing to serve her loyal customers. By upgrading her inventory, she will be able to scale up the progess of her business.  She belongs to the community group called “Ahobrasee” (meaning Humility) Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her clothing business

loans.name: Loa

texts.en:
Loa V., 55, is a widow and lives with two of her children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Since 1998, she has been working selling food to earn a living and is able to make US$ 6 each day. One of her children is married and one stays at home and helps manage the housework.

Loa would like to take out a loan of US$ 200 to install a public phone for extra profit. She will purchase a few cell phones with different lines of companies to serve the people in the area. In Cambodia, some people purchase a small booth and then install many kinds of phone lines to serve people. Normally, they charge US 10-15 cents per minute.

loans.use: To install a phone line.

loans.name: Mov

texts.en: Mr. Mov H. was born in 1959 and now lives in Steung Ping in Kampong Cham Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Nhoem Ni Yeap, are farmers who cultivate both rice and vegetables. With the revenue, he can purchase very little because he owns a small piece of land. Mr. Mov H. is the father of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the youngest one is attending the local school. Although, Mr. Mov H.’s family members are involved in different businesses, they still do not have enough money to support their field when they face problems. Therefore, Mr. Mov H. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a water pumping machine. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan. His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a water pumping machine for his farm

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Рахмонова Шахло жительница района Вахдат.Возраст 32 года,замужем, имеет 3 детей.Образование среднее.Клиентка занимается куплей продажей женских и мужских носков.Она имеет небольшую торговую точку на местном рынке района Вахдат.Имеет опыт в бизнесе 5 лет.На кредит Шахло хочет закупить больше качественного товара.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев
texts.en:
Shakhlo R. lives in the Vahdat region. She is thirty-two, married, and has three children. She has a high school education. She works buying and selling socks. She has a small shop in Vahdat’s local market. She has been doing this for five years. Shakhlo wants to use a loan to buy higher-quality goods. She plans to pay off the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying goods

loans.name: Fatma's Group

texts.en:
Fatma sells food items in Zanzibar. Already the recipient of one loan from BRAC which she repaid on time, Fatma is requesting her second loan in order to further increase the inventory of food carried in her shop. She will put any increase in profits back into her business so that it can continue to grow.

Fatma is 42 years old, married, and has five children, aged 17, 18, 25, and 20-year-old twins. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Naila, who also has a small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Mr. Yon K. is a villager in Pdaouv Chum Kiet village in Kampong Cham Province. He owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Kean Pho, is a pig breeder. She is on the left of the photo. Mr. Yon K. does not have enough money to earn a living. Thus, Mr. Yon K. decided to ask for a loan to buy five piglets to add to his business. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan. He is 32 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are attending the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy five piglets to add to his business.

loans.name: Ajara

texts.en: Ajara M. is married and has two children who have completed school. She lives with her family at Obuasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is 50 years old. She is involved in the sale of clothing and lace materials, and she has been selling through hawking for the past ten years. She is constrained by funds to run the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality and large quantity of clothing stock to upgrade her inventory. She belongs to the community group called "Ahobrasee" (meaning "humility") Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more lace and clothing materials.

loans.name: Maisara

texts.en: Maisara is a widow with two kids still living with her. She cooks very well. So she decided start her own business related to cooking. Also, this way she could support her family. She prepares sambusa – national dumplings. She has many customers but doesn’t have enough money to expand her business. She wants to borrow money and buy some tables and chairs for her customers and also cooking equipment.

loans.use: Purchasing cooking equipment

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.ru: Бобиев Искандар проживает в районе Файзабад.Работает фермером . Имеет фруктовый сад. Выращивает яблоки. Урожай продает на рынке. Имеет бычков и участок земли , где выращивает пшеницу. Планирует получить кредит  для того , чтобы закупить дополнительный товар , фрукты другого вида. Это принесет ему дополнительный доход. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Iskandar B. lives in the Fayzabad region. He works as the farmer. He has an orchard. He grows apples. He sells his crop in the market. He has calves and a plot of land where he grows wheat. He wants to take out a loan to buy additional goods, different kinds of fruit. It will bring in additional income. He can pay off the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying goods

loans.name: Arn

texts.en:
Mr. Arn K. is a 38-year-old motorcycle taxi driver, who supplements his income by raising pigs from his house in the Ti Brammuoy Village, Kompong Cham Province. He earns around $3 per day. His wife, Mrs. Keo Chanthy, is a 33-year-old cleaner at the Mettapheap Hotel in the Kompong Cham Province. She earns around $1.66 per day. They have three children, two of whom attend school and the other is married.

In order to cover his family’s living expenses and support his children’s study, Arn now asks for a loan of $500 to purchase piglets to raise and to purchase materials to make ice-cream to sell for another source of income. Arn’s wife is pictured because he was not available.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and to purchase materials to make ice-cream to sell for another source of income

loans.name: Hati's Group

texts.en:
Hati A. has been selling charcoal in Zanzibar for four years. Currently able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $120, Hati is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania in order to buy more charcoal and expand her business. She will use her increase in profits to reinvest in her business so that it can continue to grow.

Hati is 34 years old, married, and has two children, aged 12 and 14. She also cares for one additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Hidaya and Mwatum.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en: Mrs. Kuy S. is a villager in Prey Khvav village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and has a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Em Pheap, sells fish. Even though they have different businesses, they still do not earn enough money to afford good living conditions. Thus, Mrs. Kuy S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to transport her husband’s business. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living with this loan. She is 24 years old and the mother of child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to provide transportation for her husband’s fish-selling business.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en:
For many years, Farhod has offered taxi services with his personal car. He is married and has two children and is the only bread-winner in his family.

His car is wearing out so he wants to borrow money in order to repair it. He needs to keep the vehicle in good operating condition in order to continue his business and support the family.

loans.use: To repair the car being used as a taxi

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
For five years, Shuhrat has been offering taxi services with his car. This is how he supports his family. He is married and has two children. Since he is the only breadwinner in the family, he has to work hard every day.

His car is wearing out and he would like to borrow money in order to make necessary repairs. He can then serve more customers and offer a better quality service.

loans.use: To make car repairs necessary to continue taxi services

loans.name: Zinllahbodin

texts.en:
ZinllahboD., an educated and married man, has worked in agriculture for more than 10 years. With plenty of land available for cultivation, this hard-working man is requesting a loan to complete his stock and buy more seeds and ready his land for cultivation. ZinllahboD. is striving for success as a farmer to support his family and help build a better future for his children.

He would like to thank everybody supporting him and hopes to continue his partnership with both Kiva and AFSG in the years to come.

loans.use: To complete his stock and buy more seeds

loans.name: Yormahmad

texts.ru: Гадоев Ермахмад житель Файзабада. Женат и имеет одного ребенка. В возрасте 25 лет имеет опыт работы в бизнесе.  Работает  агрономом .Имеет сад , где выращивает фрукты. Так же занимается купле продажей яиц. Скупает яица у себя в селе и продает их на рынке. Планирует увеличить товарооборот и погасить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Yormahmad G. lives in Fayzabad. He is married and has one child. At only 25 years old, he already has business experience. He works in agriculture. He has an orchard where he grows fruit. He also buys and sells eggs. He buys eggs in the village and sells them in the market. He plans to increase sales and to pay off the loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Zalha's Group

texts.en:
Zalha sells clothes and underwear in Zanzibar. She previously received one loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid on time and is now requesting her second loan so that she may buy more inventory. If her profits increase as a result of this loan, she will put the money back into her shop so that her business continues to grow.

Zalha is married and has two children, aged three and eight. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Kazija, who also owns a small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and underwear to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Nhoem

texts.en: Mrs. Nhoem C. was born in 1959 and now lives in Pa Hy village in Kampong Chnang Province. She owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice, and she makes baskets. Her husband, Mr. Pring Pak, is a palm juice collector. His business is facing an obstacle, so Mrs. Nhoem C. decided to ask for a loan to buy firewood and palm juice collecting equipment. With this loan she hopes to earn much money to support her family. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a palm juice collector and the other who is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy firewood and palm juice collecting equipment.

loans.name: Ramzan M. Arshad Group

texts.en:
Ramzan baji, the wife of M. Arshad, lives in Chichawatni, Pakistan. She completed her education through the 8th standard grade. She owns a two-room brick house, where she has been living for the past 20 years. 

Ramzan baji is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her eldest son is a tailor and has a shop where he sews clothes. Her younger son is in kindergarten. Her daughter is in the 3rd standard grade. 

Ramzan baji’s husband drives a truck. He used this vehicle for hauling different things (fruits and vegetables). Ramzan baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. 

Ramzan baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy another sewing machine for her son.

She is joined in her loan group by three other members. Aziz baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothing business. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Курбонова Дилором проживает в городе Вхдат. Домохозяйка. Имеет небольшую семью. Замужем и имеет одного сына. Занимается животноводством. Муж покупает молодых телят , она их откармливает , а затем ее муж выводит скот на рынок , где продает по более выгодной цене. Бизнес приносит доход. Но для развития дела они хотят получить кредит и купить нового бычка. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Dilorom Q. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is a housewife. Her husband and son make up their small family. Dilorom raises livestock. Her husband buys young calves, she fattens them, and then her husband takes the animals to market where they are sold at a profit. The business brings in income. To expand their work, they want to recieve a loan for purchase of a new bull calf. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull calf

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en:
Dilshod paints houses and walls in his town. He started as a student and has now become a master painter. He has become independent by starting his own business and now has his own clients. He is married and has one child.

Dilshod wants to borrow money to buy new painting equipment and offer better services to his clients.

loans.use: Buy new equipment for painting houses

loans.name: Ramzan's Group

texts.en:
Ramzan baji, the wife of A. L., lives in Chichawatni, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 40 years. Ramzan baji completed her education throught the 8th standard grade. 

Ramzan baji’s husband sells clothes. He has been in this business for the past 15 years. He buys clothes from different cities (Multan and Faisal Abad). Ramzan baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work. 

Ramzan baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by four more members. Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy goats and sheep to resell. Azra baji wants a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and sketches) for her decorative embroidery business. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business. Bakht baji wants a loan to buy a welding machine for her workshop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Badriddin

texts.en: Badriddin lives with his elderly parents and he isn’t married yet. He likes livestock very much. He has 2 cows for fattening for his business, which is how he supports his family. He used his money to buy those cows and now needs to buy forage and hay for them to feed them in the winter season. He asks for 4000 somoni for 12 months.

loans.use: Purchasing forage and hay for cattle.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Абдуллоева Гулсара жительница района  Вахдата .Возраст 31 год,замужем,имеет 1 ребенка.Образование средне-специальное,по специальности продавщица. Гулсара имеет небольшой магазин на рынке.Клиентка торгует  парфюмерией. Закупает оптом товар и реализует его в розницу.На доход от своего бизнеса  она содержит свою семью. На полученный кредит Гулсара хочет увеличить ассортимент магазина.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Gulsara A. lives in the Vahdat District. She is 31 years old, married, and has one child. She has a technical secondary education specializing in sales. Gulsara has a small store at a market, where she sells toiletries. She buys the goods wholesale and sells retail. The income from her business supports her family. Gulsara will use the loan to expand her store's inventory. The loan will be paid back over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase store inventory

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji, the wife of M. A., lives in Chichawatni, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house where she has been living for the past 15 years. She completed her education through the 5th standard grade. She is the mother of two sons. Her eldest son sells fruits and vegetables. Her younger son has a juice corner. 

Parveen baji’s husband has a livestock business. He raises cattle and sells them in the market. Parveen baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. 

Parveen baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy cattle (sheep and goats) to resell. 

She is joined in her loan group by four more members. Zahida baji wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business. Qubra baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business. Zakia baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Nasira baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy cattle to resell

loans.name: Khakim

texts.en:
For many years Khakim has offered taxi services with his car. This is how he supports his family as the only bread-winner in his family.

His car is wearing out so he wants to borrow money in order to repair it. He can then serve more clients and offer a better quality service.

loans.use: To repair the car used for a taxi service

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani baji, the wife of S. A., lives inChichawatni, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house where she has lived for the last 20 years. She is the mother of two children: one son and one daughter. Her son memorizes the Holy Book, Quran-e-Pak. Her daughter is in the 7th standard grade. 

Rani baji’s husband has been selling wheat for the past 10 years. Rani baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy wheat to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by four more members. Munawar baji wants a loan to buy leather for her shoe-making business. Rafea baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business. Asma baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to resell. Ameer baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy wheat to sell

loans.name: Sharifahon

texts.en:
Sharifahon has sold fabrics and window curtains for almost nine years. She is very experienced in this business. One of her three children helps her with her business. Her husband sells dried apricots at the market.

Sharifahon buys her goods from other markets in another city which is about 80 miles from her home. She wants to borrow money so she can buy larger quantities of goods when she goes to this city.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji, the wife of M. A., lives in Chichawatni, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 20 years. She is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son completed his education through the 5th standard grade and now helps his father in his food business. The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. 

Naseem baji’s husband has run a food business for the past 5 years. He is a well-known person in the community. People often come to him to eat and buy food. Naseem baji is a housewife and helps her husband prepare food. 

Naseem baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her husband’s food business.

She is joined in her loan group by four more members. Ghulam Fatima baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Razia baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to resell. Sabra baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy woods to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy material for food business

loans.name: Abdulhokim

texts.ru: Азимов Абдулхоким житель города Яван. Возраст 36 , женат и имеет четверых детей. Зрабатывает деньги путем животноводства. Работает фермером. Имеет свое хозяйство, где имеет молодых бычков. Обратился к нам , для того , чтобы получить кредит и использовать его для покупки нового бычка. Это поможет ему увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdulhokim A. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 36 years old, married, and has four children. He makes a living raising animals. He keeps young bull calves on his own piece of land. The loan he approached us for will be used to purchase a new bull calf. This will help him increase his head of cattle. The loan will be repaid over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull calf

loans.name: Fatma's Group

texts.en:
Fatma owns a small shop in Zanzibar where she works for 18 hours every day and earns a monthly profit of approximately $115. Having repaid her first loan from BRAC Tanzania on time, she is requesting a second one in order to increase her inventory and expand her business.

Fatma is 29 years old, married and has a one-year-old child. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Mkongwe.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Latofat

texts.en:
Latofat is the loving mother of three adorable children. Her husband has gone to Russia to look for a better paying job. So, to help her husband support the large family, Latofat started her own business. She raises and fattens cattle, and then sells them at the cattle market. This is the way she feeds her family.    
With the help of this loan, Latofat plans to increase the number of her cattle, fatten them in the winter, and then sell them.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Абдухалилов Алишер житель города Нурек. Возраст 28 лет. Женат и имеет двоих детей.Имеет продуктовый магазин , который находится в центре Яванского базарв. Занимается торговлей уже пять лет. Планирует получить кредит сроком на 10 месяцев. Получив кредит он сможет увеличить ассортимент товара и привлечь новых клиентов. Это принесет дополнительный доход.
texts.en:
Alisher A. lives in the city of Nurek. He is 28 years old, married, and has two children. He runs a grocery store in the center of the Yavan bazar. He has been in working in sales for five years already. He decided to take out a 10 month loan. The loan will be used to expand his inventory and attract new customers, which will increase his income.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Munavar

texts.en:
Munavar is a mother of three wonderful kids. She sells men’s caps and belts at the market. She purchases her goods from other markets far from her home and sometimes from another country. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

She wants to expand her business with this loan and offer more goods to her clients.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for resale

loans.name: Mwanakheri's Group

texts.en:
Mwanakheri has been selling firewood and coconuts in Zanzibar for four years. Having repaid her first loan from BRAC Tanzania on time, she is requesting a second one in order to buy more inventory for her business and increase her sales. With the additional profits, Mwanakheri hopes to reinvest in her business so that it will continue to grow.

Mwanakheri is 29 years old, single, and has no children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Mwanajuma and Riziki.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Tété Célestine

texts.fr: Née le 25 Juillet 1983 à Hozin, un village situé dans le département de l'OUEME au sud-est du BENIN, dame H. Tété Célestine est mariée à Monsieur AGOUA Eusèbe (commerçant) et a à sa charge sept personnes dont Jeannot, Sylvie, Jacques et Roland sont ses enfants. Les trois autres personnes sont ses neveux. Elle vit avec son mari à Finangnon, un quartier de Cotonou. Elle est ambulante et vend aussi à son domicile il y a bientôt 5 ans des condiments. Elle s'approvisionne au marché Dantokpa, le plus grand marché de Cotonou. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et d'accroître sa marge bénéficiaire, elle voudrait expérimenter la vente du riz et du maïs. Ainsi, ses clients pourront acheter le Kilogramme de riz ou de maïs qu'ils voudront.
texts.en:
Born on July 25, 1983 in Hozin, a village located in the Oueme Province in the south-east of Benin, Mrs. Tété H. is married to Mr. Eusèbe Agoua (merchant) and is responsible for 7 people, of whom Jeannot, Sylvie, Jacques and Roland are her children. The three other people are her nephews. She lives with her husband in Finangnon, a district of Cotonou.

Mrs. H. is an ambulant salesperson who has also been selling condiments out of her house for almost 5 years. She stocks up in the Dantokpa market, the biggest open-air market in Cotonou. With a view to boosting her business and raising her profit margin, she wants to try out selling rice and maize (corn). Thus, her customers will be able to buy a kilo of rice or of corn, as they choose.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a 50-kg sack of rice, a 50-kg sack of maize, and half a basket of condiments

loans.name: Sharifmo

texts.ru: Садирова Шарифмо проживает в городе Душанбе. Работает медсестрой в городской больнице. Обратилась к нам за получением кредита. Планирует полученный кредит использовать для того, чтобы сделать ремонт квартиры. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 18 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sharifmo S. lives in Dushanbe. She works as a nurse in a city hospital. She approached Kiva to obtain a loan in order to remodel her apartment. She will be able to repay the loan within 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel her apartment

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.en:
Marhamat is a 55-year-old woman and, after 18 years, still has her own business selling corn and wheat at the market. Her daughter helps her with the business.

Marhamat is asking for a loan of $1200 to expand her business and she promises to pay it back in time.

loans.use: To expand the corn and wheat-selling business

loans.name: Victorine

texts.fr: Dame D. Victorine est née vers 1968 à Cotonou au BENIN. Elle est mariée à DOMINGO Louis (mécanicien) avec qui elle vit en location à Cotonou. Dame D. Victorine a deux enfants qui vivent avec elle. Elle vend dans un marché situé dans le premier arrondissement de la ville de Cotonou des condiments à savoir tomate fraîche, légumes, piments, oignon, poivre et huile d'arachide. Elle réalise en moyenne un chiffre d'affaire journalier de 15000Fcfa. Pour s'approvisionner en quantité; elle sollicite le renouvellement de son deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Mrs. Victorine D. was born around 1968 in Cotonou, Benin. She is married to Louis Domingo (mechanic) with whom she lives in Cotonou.

Mrs.Victorine D. has two children who live with her. She sells condiments, i.e., fresh tomatoes, vegetables, hot peppers, onions, black pepper, and peanut oil in a market situated in the first official district of the town of Cotonou. She has an average daily turnover of 15,000 F CFA. She is requesting the renewal of her second loan so that she can buy in bulk.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a half-sack of onions, a half-basket of hot peppers, 2 baskets of fresh tomatoes, 2 cases of tinned tomatoes and 2 jerricans of peanut oil

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma owns a small business in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. She has already repaid two loans from BRAC Tanzania which enabled her to bring her monthly profit up to approximately $125 each month and is hoping that with this third loan request she can further increase her inventory and sales.

Mwajuma is 29 years old, single, and has no children.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr: Née vers 1967à Abomey, l'une des villes historiques situé au centre du BENIN, dame E. Juliette est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont l'aîné Agossi est mariée et n'est plus à sa charge, Roger âgé de 17ans est en classe de Seconde au cours secondaire, Yvette âgée de 14 ans est en classe de Quatrième et Innocent âgé de 9ans est en classe de cinquième. Désireuse d'augmenter son stock en période de fête afin de faire  face à la demande de sa clientèle, elle vient solliciter son troisième crédit qui lui permettra de se donner de nouveaux élans.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juliette E. was born circa 1967 in Abomey, one of the historical towns in Central Benin. She's married and the mother of four children, out of which the eldest, Agossi, is married and is no longer in her care. Roger (age 17), Yvette (age 14), and Innocent (age 9) all attend school. Wishing to bolster her stock during the holiday period to meet customer demand, she's seeking a third loan that will give her a new boost.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two sacks of rice, two sacks of corn and five cans of peanut oil

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: Née vers 1970 à Sakété dans le département du Plateau au Sud-est du BENIN, dame E. Alice est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Épouse de ADOUSIBA Nestor, elle est une revendeuse ambulante. Ayant déjà obtenu un crédit de démarrage et un autre de renforcement, elle vient solliciter son troisième crédit pour développer au mieux son activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1970 in Sakété in Plateau Province in the south-east of Benin, Mrs. Alice E. is married and the mother of three children. Wife of Nestor Adousiba, she works in ambulant sales. Having already been granted a starter loan and a business reinforcement loan, she has just requested her third loan to further develop her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of two sacks of different sorts of Omo (detergent) and 6 cases of various soaps

loans.name: Umarali

texts.ru: Кодиров Умарали житель Варзобского района. Работает на СТО . Занимается ремонтом автомашин. Женат и имеет шестерых детей. Один является кормильцем семьи. Решил получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить автозапчасти. Это поможет ему продавать запчасти прямо у себя в мастерской. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Umarali K. lives in the Varzob district. He works at an auto service station repairing automobiles. Married with six children, Umarali is the sole provider for his family. He decided to obtain a loan in order to purchase auto parts. This would enable him to sell the auto parts right at his repair shop. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase auto parts

loans.name: Muminboi

texts.en:
Muminboi is a married man and has 4 kids. He is a craftsman and makes traditional baskets out of twigs. His wife also helps him in making baskets. They collect twigs in fields all the time and then all together they make baskets. He also teaches his kids the secrets of his mastership. 

He wants to borrow money because he also sells other home stuff and wants to offer more products for sale.

loans.use: Expanding his business

loans.name: Marguérite

texts.fr: Originaire de Lokossa dans le département de Mono au Sud-ouest du BENIN, dame G. Marguérite est née vers 1972 à Lokossa. Mariée à AVONON Firmin, elle est mère de deux enfants, Narcisse âgé de 15ans est en classe de Troisième et Rosine âgée de12ans est en classe de Cinquième. Douée dans la distribution, dame G. Marguérite est revendeuse au marché Dantokpa de Cotonou. Pour fidéliser ses clients, elle préfère chaque fois se rapprocher de ses derniers à leurs domiciles mettre à leur disposition ses articles. Elle sollicite son deuxième prêt à ALIDé pour donner satisfaction à l'une de ses clientes dont elle à reçu une commande.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marguérite G., originally from Lokossa in the Mono Department, Southwest Benin, was born circa 1972 in Lokossa. She's married to Firmin AVONON and the mother of two school-attending children, Narcisse (age 15) and Rosine (age 12). Gifted for distribution, Marguérite G. is a reseller at the Dantokpa market in Cotonou. To build a loyal customer base, she prefers to go to her clients' houses to sell her goods. She's seeking a second loan from Alidé in order to satisfy one customer order.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two bales of fabrics

loans.name: Bahati's Group

texts.en:
Bahati has been selling charcoal in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she may increase her inventory and expand her business. With an increase in profits, Bahati intends to reinvest in her business so that it may continue to grow.

Bahati is currently able to earn a profit of approximately US$ 15 each month. She is 23 years old, single, and has no children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Tunu, who also has a small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Arilowé

texts.fr: Née vers 1973 à Sakété dans le département du Plateau au sud du BENIN, dame A. Arilowé est mariée et mère deux enfants. Mariée à Razack BABALOLA, elle voyage sur Lomé pour l'approvisionnement de ses articles qu'elle vient distribuer à ses clients avant de vendre à petit coup le reste. Désireuse de renforcer ses capacités et couvrir la demande de ses clients elle demande ce crédit pour également faire face à la concurrence.
texts.en:
Born around 1973 in Sakété in the Plateau Province in the south of Benin, Mrs. Arilowé A. is married and the mother of two children. Married to Razack Babalola, she travels to Lomé to buy the articles she distributes to her clients, before selling whatever is left over retail. Wishing to reinforce her business and meet her customers' demand, she is requesting this loan so that she can stand up to the competition.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 6 dozen pairs of shoes and 2 dozen handbags

loans.name: Shavkatjon

texts.en:
Shavkatjon is divorced and has two of his children living with him. He is a craftsman and makes national baskets out of twigs, and sieves and rolling-pins out of wood. He buys raw materials from vendors in other markets where they are less expensive. He then sells his products in the village markets where he lives. 

He wants to borrow money to purchase more raw materials so he can increase his inventory of sieves, rolling-pins and baskets. This will allow him to earn more money to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials and increase inventory of products for sale

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma sells fish, flour, and oil in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can expand her inventory and increase her sales. She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $125 each month.

Salma is 45 years old and married.

loans.use: To buy fish, flour, and oil

loans.name: Gafaratou

texts.fr: Née vers 1979  à Sakété dans le département du Plateau au sud BENIN, dame B. Gafaratou est mariée et mère d'un enfant âgé de cinq ans.  Elle est revendeuse des perles, des produits de soins corporels et d'autres petits produits de beautés. Pour accroître sa capacité à satisfaire ses clients et pour faire face à la demande de sa clientèle en période de fête, elle sollicite son premier crédit afin de ne pas connaître une rupture de stock en période de fête.
texts.en:
Born around 1979 in Sakété in the Plateau Province in the south of Benin, Mrs. Gafaratou B. is married and the mother of a 5-year-old child. She sells beads, cosmetics and various other little beauty products. To boost her ability to saisfy her clientele and meet demand in the holiday period, she is requesting her first loan so that she will not find herself without certain products during the holidays.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of two dozen strings of beads and 2 cases of pommades

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza owns a small business in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more inventory for her shop to help her increase her profit.

Aziza is 33 years old, married, and has two children, aged 13 and 16. She also cares for an additional 10-year-old dependent.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her business

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Нарзуллоев Диловар житель города Душанбе. Работает на стройке . Холост. Живет с родителями. Не смотря на то , что он не женат , он один обеспечивает семью. Хочет получить кредит для покупки компьютера. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев. Приобретение компьютера даст возможность работать на дому , а так же получать образование.
texts.en:
Dilovar N. lives in Dushanbe. He works at a construction site. He is single and lives with his parents; however, he is the sole provider for his family. He wants to obtain a loan in order to purchase a computer. He will repay the loan within 12 months. Purchasing a computer will enable Dilovar to work from home and to obtain education.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a computer

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a married woman with two children. She sells candies and waffles at the market. She purchases her goods from vendors in other villages and sells them in her town.

She has her constant clients who buy goods from her all the time. Now she wants a loan to buy more goods and offer  different types of candies and waffles to her clients.

loans.use: Purchasing more food products for resale

loans.name: Mwashamba's Group

texts.en:
Mwashamba H. sells kanga in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. Kanga is a local fabric with elaborate patterns, bright colors, and a local adage written in Swahili on the bottom. Tanzanian women use kanga for clothing, wraps, baby slings, tablecloths, and other day-to-day needs. This is Mwashamba's first loan, and she intends to use it to buy more inventory and expand her business.

Mwashamba is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $15 each month. She is 30 years old, married, and has no children. She will share this loan with her fellow group member, Zaituni, who also owns a small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more kanga for her shop

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha has been selling clothes in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for seven years. She has previously taken two microloans from BRAC Tanzania, both of which she repaid successfully and on time. With this third loan she hopes to further grow her inventory and increase her profit beyond her current approximate monthly profit of $50.

Asha is 46 years old, married, and has six children, aged 7, 14, 18, 20, 21, and 25. She works for twelve hours every day.

loans.use: To buy more clothing as inventory for her shop

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina has been preparing and selling food in Zanzibar for 3 years. Her most popular food item is called "vitambua," which is eaten for breakfast or as a snack throughout the day. Vitambua is made of rice flour and cooked in oil in a pan with small round indents. The pan is kept over coals, and as the vitambua batter cooks, Zaina flips each one so that the finished product is a round, slightly browned starchy snack.

Zaina has previously taken out 1 loan from BRAC Tanzania, which she paid back successfully and on time. She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $60 each month, and she is hoping that this second loan allows her to cook and sell more and increase her profit.

Zaina is 36 years old, married, and has no children.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients, like oil and flour, for the foods she prepares and sells

loans.name: Rakia
