texts.en: Rakia Z. is 59 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Two of her children are married and living in their matrimonial homes, while the other two are still in school. She has been a trader for fifteen years, and she is hard-working and enterprising. She sells food such as maize, plantains, beans, groundnuts, and gari in the neighborhood to her loyal customers. She treks to the northern part of Ghana to purchase her supplies. She says her business is very lucrative. Therefore, she wants to expand her inventory to generate enough additional income to rent a store room. Rakia is a member of the group called “Matit” ("God will provide") Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan. Her picture was taken during their group meeting.

loans.use: To buy food to sell.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati J. owns a small business in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can expand her business and increase her profit.

Bahati is 39 years old, married, and has 8 children, aged 2, 3, 9, 10, 14, 17, 18, and 20.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her business

loans.name: Maali

texts.en: Maali M. is 40 years old, married, and the mother of three children. All her children are currently in school.  Maali is a food vendor and she prepares waakye (cooked brown rice with beans, eaten with vegetable sauce or shito) which most people eat in the morning, evening, and sometimes in the afternoon. Schoolchildren and workers in her neighborhood also enjoy it because of its affordability. She has been selling waakye and stew for ten years.  Now she wants to buy more rice, vegetables, and vegetable oil to avoid price hikes in the commodities. She hopes to increase her savings towards her children’s future with this loan. She is a member of the group called “Saamu” which means "receiving." Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Her picture was taken during one of their group meetings.

loans.use: To buy rice, vegetables, and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul L. A., a 35-year-old dealer in mobile phones and accessories, is single with one child who is currently in school. Also a provider of repairs and servicing for his customers, Abdul says that the sale of mobile phones has become a very lucrative business in Ghana because almost every Ghanaian desires one for easy and fast communication.

Since he buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices, he is requesting a loan to procure an increased stock of phones and accessories. With the resulting additional profits, Abdul hopes to expand his shop to include the sale of computers and computer parts.

Abdul belongs to the group called “Saamu” (Receiving) Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee each other’s loans.

loans.use: To procure an increased stock of mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma has had a small business in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for 6 years. She has taken out 1 prior loan from BRAC Tanzania, which she paid successfully and on time. It helped her increase her profit to approximately $85 each month. She is hoping that this second loan further increases her profit.

Mwajuma is 28 years old, married, and has 2 children, ages 3 and 7. She also cares for an additional 13-year-old dependent.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her business

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent S. is 42 years old. He is married and the father of two children who are currently in school. He has been in the furniture and interior decoration business for eighteen years. He is a specialist in dining sets, beds, upholstered chairs, kitchen decoration etc. His experience, skills and designs are first-class. He gives his customers a new look in their homes, offices, and kitchens. He hopes to increase his savings to provide his children with quality educations. He is a member of the community group called Saamu, which means "Receiving Group." In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access and repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of furniture and upholstery materials.

loans.name: Zuwena

texts.en:
Zuwena has owned a small business in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She works daily from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM and earns a profit of approximately $100 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more inventory for her shop and increase her profit.

Zuwena is 38 years old and has 4 children, ages 3, 7, 10, and 12.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to expand her business

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Kokou A. est âgé de 36 ans et gagne sa vie en conduisant un véhicule taxi à Kpalimé une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. ces derniers temps il a problème de moteur et passe tout son temps au garage. Il désire par ce crédit acquérir un nouveau moteur afin de relancer son activité.
texts.en:
Kokou A. is 36 years old and earns his living driving a taxi in Kpalimé, a city located about 120 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. For the last few times, he has had engine problems and spends all his time at the garage. He would like to use this loan to acquire a new motor in order to restart his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new motor for his taxi

loans.name: Aimée

texts.fr: Dame Q. Aimée est née le 28/04/1967 à Cotonou et est originaire de ouidah, ville historique du département de l'Atlantique. Elle est mariée à DOSSOUGOUIN Frédéric, gérant d'une station d'essence et est mère de 02 enfants, Razack 13 ans en classe de 4éme et la seconde Brigitte 09ans est en classe de CM1. Après son echec au Brevet d'Etude du Premier Cycle (BEPC), sa mère l'a initié à la vente de divers articles à savoir savons, lait, conserves, pâtes alimentaires, huile végétale, etc qu'elle continue de vendre jusqu'à ce jour.  En vue de renforcer son activité et de pouvoir répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle, elle sollicite ce second prêt. Elle compte s'approvisionner  en riz , lait en boîte , sucre et  pâte alimentaire.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aimée Q. was born on 04/28/1967 in Cotonou, she is from Ouidah, a historic town in the Atlantic department. She is married to Frederic DOSSOUGOUIN, a gas station manager, and is the mother of 2 children, Razack - 13 - in 8th grade and Brigitte - 9 -in 4th grade.

After failing her middle school exit exam in 9th grade, her mother initiated her to the sale of various goods such as soap, milk, canned good, dry pasta, vegetable oil etc. that she continues to sell up to now. In order to strengthen her business and to better meet her customers’ needs, she is requesting this second loan. She hopes to be able to stock up on rice, sugar and dry pasta.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 3 bags of rice, a box of milk, a box of sugar, and 4 boxes of dry pasta.

loans.name: Frankline

texts.fr: H. Frankline est née le 29/ 08/1979 à cotonou. Elle est mariée à ADOUKONOU Clément, chauffeur et elle est mère de 02 enfants: Horace, 08  ans est en classe de CE2 et Chancelle a 1an 5 mois.Très jeune elle a abandonné les cours en classe de CM2 et aidait sa mère à vendre dans l'un  des plus grands marchés de la ville de Cotonou, le marché Gbégamey.Voici 08 ans, elle s'est mise à son propre compte. Au départ, elle avait débuté avec la vente des fruits, ensuite les tubercules. Aujourd'hui elle ne vend que les céréales haricot, riz, maïs, farine de manioc séché et autres. C'est justement pour cette activité qu'elle sollicite ce second prêt en vue de réhausser son étalage et satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Frankline H. was born on August 29, 1979 in Cotonou. She is married to Clément ADOUKONOU, a chauffeur, and is the mother of two children: Horace, age 8 and in the 3rd grade; and Chancelle, age 1 year and 5 months. At a young age, she abandoned school in the 5th grade and helped her mother in commerce in one of the largest marketplaces in the city of Cotonou, the Gbégamey Market. For eight years now, she has been on her own. In the beginning, she sold fruit, and then tubers. Today, she only sells grain, beans, rice, corn, dried cassava flour, and so forth. It's only for this activity that she is requesting this second loan with the intent of enhancing her display of goods to satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 sacks of rice and 1 sack of corn

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Dame A. Hélène est née le 18/08/1972 à Cotonou. Elle est mariée à SOSSOUHOUNTO Franck , couturier brodeur. Après son échec au Certificat d'Etude Primaire(C.E.P) elle a été apprentie coiffeuse pendant un an. Ensuite elle s'est lancée dans la vente de divers produits vivriers à savoir haricot, riz et divers autres articles qu'elle a héritée de sa défunte grande sœur. Elle sollicite ce second prêt en vue d'accroître son capital et renforcer son activité. Elle compte surtout s'approvisionner en riz.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hélène A. was born on 08/18/1972 in Cotonou. She is married to Franck SOSSOUHOUNTO, a dressmaker-embroiderer. After she failed her primary school exit certificate, she became an apprentice hairdresser for one year. Then she launched herself in the sale of various food products such as beans, rice and various other articles that she inherited from her late older sister. She is requesting this second loan in order to increase her capital and to strengthen her activity. She wishes to buy mostly rice.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 50 bags of rice

loans.name: Danilo Candelario

texts.es: Danilo Candelario P. Guido habita el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla del municipio de Ticuantepe, es casado,  su esposa Arlin Rodríguez  es ama de casa, tienen 3 hijos, quienes todavía están a cargo de sus padres, Danilo trabaja en una organización llamada CENADE desempeñándose en el cargo de Ing. Agrónomo, tiene 7 años trabajando para esta organización. Danilo solicita el crédito para hacer varias mejoras en su casa de habitación, como por ejemplo,componer una parte del techo por donde se le filtra el agua cuando llueve
texts.en:
Danilo Candelario P. Guido lives in the region of Juan Ramon Padillo in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He is married, and his wife Arlin Rodriguez is a homemaker. They have 3 children and they are all still under their parents' care. Danilo works for an organization called Cenade, working under Mr. Agronomo. He has been working 7 years for this organization. Danilo is requesting this loan to make various improvements to their home, such as, for example, fixing a part of the roof where water seeps through when it rains.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel their home.

loans.name: Francisco Alonso

texts.es: Tiene 57 años de edad, habita en el Barrio Laureles Sur de Managua, esta soltero, le tuvieron 5 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y cada uno tiene su propia familia. Francisco se dedica a la Venta de Ropa y mantiene una línea de clientes que siempre está abasteciendo, además posee una Moto-Taxi en la cual transporta a pasajeros del Mercado Mayoreo al Bo. Gertrudis Áreas lo que le genera buena ganancia, el solicita su crédito para incrementar su Inventario ya que se acerca la temporada en la cual los pedidos se incrementan y necesita satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Inició su negocio con fondos propios los que ha sabido administrar muy bien, su mayor anhelo es ahorrar para la compra de otra Moto-Taxi.
texts.en:
Mr. C. is 57 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood of Managua. He is single and has 5 grown up children who all have their own families. Francisco sells clothing and has a broad client-base that he is always supplying with merchandise. Additionally, he owns a motorcycle taxi in which he transports passengers from the wholesale market to Gertrudis Áreas, which generates good profits for him. He is requesting this loan in order to increase his inventory because the season in which sales climb is fast-approaching, and he needs to meet customer demand. He started the business with his own funds, which he has been able to manage well. His biggest aspiration is to save money so that he can purchase another motorcycle taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise (clothing)

loans.name: Mana

texts.fr: Mana S. achète et revend depuis 3 ans en détail des pagnes à Kpalimé au Togo. C’est un commerce très florissant ; Elle souhaite par ce second crédit acheter de nouveaux pagnes pouvant répondre à l’attente de sa clientèle qui devient de plus en plus exigeante. Les profits tirés de son activité lui permettront de faire face à ses soucis financiers et de répondre aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Mana S. has been retailing "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African-print cloth) for three years in Kpalimé in Togo. It is a flourishing business. With this second loan she wants to buy new "pagnes" that meet the expectations of her clientele who are becoming more and more demanding. The income from this business allows her to face up to her financial problems and meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Akua

texts.fr: Akua A. est une commerçante dynamique  âgé de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle exploite une boutique de prêt à porter dans un  quartier très commercial de Kpalimé une ville du Togo. Elle veut contribuer à la prospérité de son affaire en gagnant la confiance de ses clients  et désire par ce troisième crédit renforcer son  fond de roulement. Avec cette chance de Kiva, elle pourrait désormais faire face à une clientèle exigeante en tissus de marque, gagner plus d’argent et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akua A. is an energetic merchant, 42 years old, married, and the mother of two. She has a shop selling ready-to-wear clothing in a highly commercial district of Kpalimé, a city in Togo. She wants to help her busines prosper by earning the trust of her customers and therefore would like to use this third loan to bolster her working capital. With this Kiva opportunity, she would then be able to address her customers who demand name-brand fabrics, to earn more money, and to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy outfits and shoes for sale

loans.name: Eli

texts.fr: Eli A. est propriétaire et gérante d’un bar-restaurant à Kpalimé au Togo  Agée de 32 ans, Eli est très réputée pour être spécialisée en cuisine. Avec cette chance de Kiva et ce troisième crédit de FECECAV, elle désire faire davantage de stock de tubercules, de mais pour les plats de fufu et de la pâte, des plats très appréciés par la clientèle. Elle apprécie cette opportunité qui lui permettra de participer plus à la prise en charges des besoins de la famille par les profits qu’elle va dégager
texts.en:
Eli A. is the owner and manager of a bar-restaurant in Kpalimé in Togo. Eli has a very good reputation as a cook. With this Kiva opportunity and this third loan from FECECAV, she wishes to make a larger stock of coco yams, corn to make fufu dishes and paté, dishes that are well liked by her customers. She appreciates this opportunity that will enable her to take a larger financial responsibility in providing for her family's needs, thanks to the profit she will earn.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of coco yams, and bags of corn to prepare dishes

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Akou D. est une revendeuse de poissons très connue dans son quartier qui prend toujours son affaire au sérieux ; Elle habite à Kpalimé une ville située au sud-ouest du Togo et souhaite par ce  crédit augmenter son fond de roulement pouvant lui permettre d’acheter en gros et faire face à la demande de sa clientèle afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice
texts.en:
Akou D. is a well-known retailer of fish in her district who always takes her work seriously. She lives in Kpalimé, a city located in the southwest of Togo, and wishes to use this loan to increase her working capital. This would enable her to buy in bulk and to address the demands of her customers in order to realize more profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish for retail sale

loans.name: Zenelia

texts.es: Zenelia  es una mujer emprendedora, humilde, trabajadora, y muy responsable con los créditos que se le han otorgado; tiene 2 hijos que estudian la educación primaria.  Tiene un pequeño negocio de pulperia, el cual le brinda los ingresos con los cuales mantiene los gastos de la casa y los estudios de sus hijitos,  cuenta con el apoyo del papá de los niños; actualmente solicita su crédito para comprar productos como granos básicos que son los que mayor rotación presentan y reforzar el inventario del mismo, y de esta manera seguir trabajando para lograr que sus hijos puedan continuar con sus estudios y ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Zenelia is an enterprising, humble, and hardworking woman; she has been very responsible with the previous loans that she has been granted. She has two children who study in primary school. She has a small local store, which offers her an income to keep up with the household costs and study costs of her little children. She works with the support of the father of the children. Presently she is requesting a loan to buy products like basic grains, which are always sold and need restocked, and to increase her present inventory. In this manner she will continue working to ensure that her children can continue their studies and be someone in life.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and increase the inventory of her local store.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es: El Señor Lucas está solicitando  su crédito para invertirlo en  mejora de su vivienda como es repellar el dormitorio que él habita y así tener un poco de comodidad , trabaja como Auxiliar de Enfermeria, tiene dos hijos: el mayor de 8 años estudia su segundo grado de educación primaria y el niño menor de 4 añitos, su esposa tambien trabaja como auxiliar de enfermeria ambos comparten los gastos familiares. Es importante  mencionar que este joven desde muy pequeño ha apoyado a su mamá,  inició a laborar desde temprana edad ya que son una familia de escasos recursos económicos, desempeña su labor con mucha responsabilidad, él se siente feliz  con su trabajo ya que ayuda a muchas personas de la comarca Jacinto Baca en Nueva Guinea. Es estudiante de Lic. en Enfermeria, vale la pena recalcar que este joven se caracteriza por su sencillez y humildad, pero posee un alto espiritud de superación personal, y aspira llegar a ser un excelente profesional para asi seguir ayudando a su familia y toda la comunidad, su sueño es poco a poco ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y que a su familia no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Lucas is requesting a loan to invest in making improvements to his home, such as plastering the walls of his bedroom and thus making it a little more comfortable. He works as a nursing assistant and has two children: the oldest is 8 years old and is in second grade, and the youngest is 4. His wife also works as a nursing assistant and together they share household expenses. It's important to mention that since Lucas was very young he has supported his mother. He started working at a young age since his family has limited economic resources, and carried out his work with a lot of responsibility. He feels happy with his job because he helps many people in the Jacinto Baca region. He's studying for a nursing degree, and it's worth emphasizing that this young man is characterized by his modesty and humility, but he posses a strong desire for personal improvement. He aspires to become an excellent professional so he can continue helping his family and the entire community. His goal is to little by little improve his quality of life and that his family lacks nothing.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plaster the walls of his home

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: Dame K. Madeleine âgée de 28ans est née à Zinvié dans le département de l'Atlantique. Elle est mariée à NOUFIONSSOU Célestin et est mère de 03 enfants. Dès son jeune  âge, elle aidait sa tutrice à vendre du pagne dans le grand marché de Ouando dans le département de l'Ouémé. Après la naissance d'Esaïe, elle s'est mise à son propre compte en revendant divers articles autres que les pagnes qu'elle achetait dans son village natal  que sont huile de palme et farine de manioc. Aujourd'hui, elle ne vend que les pagnes. Dans le soucis d'accroître le capital de son petit commerce et de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un troisième prêt d'un montant de 120000f .
texts.en:
Mrs. Madeleine K., 28, was born in Zinvié in the Atlantique Province. She is married to Célestin Noufionssou and is the mother of 3 children. From girlhood, she helped her guardian sell "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African-print cloth) in the big open-air market of Ouando in Ouémé Province. After the birth of Esaïe, she opened up her own stall, selling other items than pagnes, things she bought in the village where she was born, e.g., palm oil and manioc flour. Today, she only sells pagnes. In order to add to her working capital and better satisfy her clientele, she is requesting a third loan in the amount of 120,000 F. .

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 40 lengths of African-print cloth

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Dame P. Antoinette est née le 27/10/1959 à Agoué au Sud Est du Benin. Elle est veuve depuis 06 ans et a deux orphelins à sa charge. Après deux échecs au baccalauréat, elle s'est mise à revendre des pagnes avec sa maman. Aujourd'hui, outre la distribution de pagnes qu'elle fait habituellement, elle commercialise divers articles tels que les conserves, les pâtes alimentaires, l'huile d'arachide et la farine de manioc dans une petite boutique à son domicile. En vue d'accroître le niveau de son activité, elle sollicite ce troisième prêt de 160000fcfa pour s'approvisionner essentiellement en huile végétale, savons et conserves.
texts.en:
Ms. Antoinette P. was born on October 27, 1959 in Agoué in the southeast of Benin. She has been a widow for six years and has two orphans in her care. After two failed attempts at earning her high school diploma, she got started selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) with her mom. Today, besides distributing pagnes as she usually does, she markets various items, such as canned foods, pasta, peanut oil, and cassava flour out of a small shop in her home. Given the growth in her business, she is requesting this third loan of 160,000 francs CFA to acquire supplies essentially in vegetable oil, soap, and canned foods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 25 liters of oil, 4 boxes of soap, 2 boxes of milk, and 3 boxes of canned tomatoes

loans.name: Bocar

texts.fr: Bocar D. est un menuisier qui habite dans le quartier de ouakam. Il a plus de dix ans d'expérience dans ce métier. Il fait un travail de qualité et il a une clientéle fidéle. Il fait des chiffres d'affaires en moyenne de 400 000 f cfa par mois. Il gagne bien sa vie et entretien sa famille. Il sollicite un crédit pour augenter son fond de roulement
texts.en:
Bocar D. is a cabinet-maker who lives in the Ouakam district. He has over ten years of experience in this trade. He does quality work and has loyal customers. Having average sales figures of 400,000 francs CFA per month, he is earning his living and supporting his family. He is requesting a loan to increase his working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Carpentry

loans.name: Selia

texts.fr: Dame L. Selia est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est née à Dangbo dans le département de l'Ouémé. Mariée à AMIDOU Taho, revendeur de serrures elle est mère de 03 enfants. Initiée dès son jeune âge par sa grande mère paternelle au commerce, elle aidait cette dernière à vendre divers articles tels les seaux, les ustensiles de cuisine. Aujourd'hui elle revend essentiellement les pommes fruits et accessoirement divers produits de vente à solde. Actuellement elle a épuisé son stock de pomme fruit et compte sur ce troisième prêt de 100000fcfa pour saisir l'opportunité de mieux vendre.
texts.en:
Mrs. Selia L., 36, was born in Dangbo in Ouémé Province. Married to Taho Amidou, who sells locks, she is the mother of 3 children. Her paternal grandmother taught her salesmanship when she was just a girl, and she helped her grandmother sell various articles such as buckets and kitchen utensils. Today she sells mostly apples with some other reduced-price goods. Right now she is out of apples and is counting on this, her third loan in the amount of 100,000 F CFA to be able to make more sales.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 3 cases of apples, etc.

loans.name: Sokhna Diarra

texts.fr: Sokhna Diarra S. est une habitante du quartier ouakam à Dakar. Elle exerce le commerce de vétements depuis deux ans. Elle fait en moyenne un chiffre d'affaires de 15000 f cfa par jour. Elle est célibataire et méne bien sa vie. Elle veut un crédit pour renforcer son stock et préparer les fêtes de fin d'années.
texts.en:
Sokhna Diarra S. lives in the Ouakam district of Dakar. She has been selling clothing for two years. Her average daily turnover is 15,000 F CFA. She is single and has a sensible life-style. She wants a loan to boost her inventory so as to be prepared for the New Year holidays.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Daouda's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Koudaba excelle dans la transformation des céréales et la vente de moulins. Il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter du mil et faire face à la demande.
Ce groupe basé au quartier de Santhiaba rural participe à l'allégement des travaux des femmes
texts.en:
The group Koudaba excels in the transformation of cereals and the sale of mills. They are requesting this loan to buy millet and to meet the customers' demand. This group based in the neighborhood of rural Santhiaba participates in the lightening of women's work.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mills (cereal transformation)

loans.name: Kassoumaye Fm Group

texts.fr: Kassoumaye FM est une petite radio communautaire qui participe au bien être des femmes et de la petite enfance par des émissions sur le VIH SIDA, la drogue, les mutilations sexuelles etc Les responsables de cette radio sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des consommables pour leurs émissions et les publi-reportages qui constituent une de leur rentrée de fonds
texts.en:
Kassoumaye FM is a small community radio station that contributes to the well-being of women and young children through broacasts concerning HIV/AIDS, illicit drugs, sexual mutilation, etc. The managers of this radio station are requesting this loan to buy consumables for their broadcasts and the editorial-style advertising which constitute one of their inflows of funds.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy computer consumables

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.en:
"Mujeres Unidas" is a group of 15 women, all looking to receive a loan. Half of this group will be receiving their second loan, and trying to expand their small businesses. The other half are hoping to receive their first loans. All members of this group come from a very poor pueblo in Puerto Plata and are looking to change their life.

Bellamy G. is the group leader and representative of this group, and I had a chance to talk with her for a short period. After speaking with her, I could instantly tell why she was the group leader, and it's because she is a very talkative and intelligent women. She is receiving her second loan and is having good success selling used clothing.

With this loan, she says, she wants to expand and start selling her clothing in other areas. She is the mother of 2 very young children and says her dream is help them have a good life. She wants them both to attend college someday. This whole group is excited about taking this step towards a better life and are committed to making it happen!

On behalf of Bellamy, the group, and Esperanza International----- Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: Buying and selling used clothing

loans.name: Aldi Forti Group

texts.en:
This is Majula S. and Abdul B.. They call their group Aldi Forti. They have received several loans through SMT. They repaid their loans on time and have requested a new one. Their previous loans were a great blessing to these entrepreneurs. The last loan they received was for Le 500,000.00 each. This enabled the group’s leader, Majula, to boost her business, which was on the verge of collapsing at the time of the loan.

Majula was born in Kabala thirty-two years ago. She is married to a Health Inspector and they are raising four children, two from their marriage and two from a previous marriage. (Her first husband passed away.) Two of the children are in secondary schools and the other two are in primary schools. Majula pays the fees for her two children in secondary schools. Majula sells soft drinks, bottled water, sardines, Vaseline, creams and a lot more in her shop at the centre of Kabala town. She has been in business for the past 10 years now.

With this loan, she would like to buy some items she currently lacks in her shop. She will invest in items like onions, rice, and provisions. She buys her goods in Freetown where the prices of goods are cheaper than in Kabala. The greatest challenge she faces as a businesswoman is that most of the items her customers are asking for are not available in her shop. This causes her to lose some of her customers to rivals. But with this loan, she will be able to buy most of the items her customers want.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is Isatu B.. Isatu is a member of a group called Good Sababu. This will be her fourth loan from SMT. Isatu’s business had been completely ruined by the rebel invasion of her town when she approached SMT for her first loan. But thanks to SMT’s loans, she was able to gradually get herself off the ground once again.

Previously, she received Le 600,000.00 from Kiva through SMT. The loan helped her business and improved her livelihood. She thanks God for that loan as it enabled her to solve her numerous problems. She has repaid it successfully and is today requesting a loan of Le 800,000.00 to help further strengthen her business.

Isatu was born in Kabala and is forty years of age. She is married with four children. One of her daughters is already married, two are in school and the last is not yet of school age. Her husband trades in cows and she trades in miscellaneous items. She sells items like palm oil, kola nuts, dishes, clothes, cigarettes, cheese and so on. She buys some of the goods she sells in Freetown (about 570 miles round-trip) because of the cheaper prices in Freetown. She buys the other items in Bo, the country’s second largest city, located in southern Sierra Leone.

With this loan, Isatu is planning to buy more inventory so that the amount of profit she makes will increase. With a lot of profit, she will be able to solve her household problems, assist her children in their schooling and buy herself a piece of land.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Way To Success Group

texts.en:
This is Alpha S. K. and Marie M.. Their group name is Way to Success. They named their group Way to Success because of the firm belief that with loans from SMT, they are on their way to success. This will be their 3rd loan from Kiva through SMT. The previous loan they received from SMT was for Le 500,000 each. This was a great help to these entrepreneurs. 

Alpha is the leader of the group. He was born in Kabala 21 years ago. He is single with no children. He has been in business for 3 years now. Alpha dropped out of school when his dad passed away. He became the breadwinner for his family following the death of his father. He started a small business in order to raise money to support his 5 junior brothers in their schooling. Three of them are still in primary school and 2 are in secondary school.

Alpha sells biscuits, margi (used in sauce), toothpaste, sardines, batteries, milk, sugar, soaps, and a lot more. He buys these items in Freetown (abut 570 r/t) because of the cheaper prices in Freetown.

One great challenge he is facing as a businessman is the lack of items in his shop. But with SMT, he is now confident that gradually he will be able to get a shop full of items to sell.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Sorie

texts.en:
Sorie is thirty-four years old. He was born in Kabala and is married with two children. His children are still not of school age. His wife is a businesswoman who sells food in a market.

Sorie is a member of a group called Try Me. He is requesting a loan of Le 800,000 to strengthen his business. He has received previous loans from Kiva through SMT. With the previous loans he was able to expand his business to include items like hardboards, sinks, tackboards, wheelbarrows and balusters. Before the loans, he was selling only  cement. He travels to Freetown (about 570 miles round-trip) to buy the materials he sells. With income generated by the loans he received from SMT, he is proud to say that today he has a shop full of building materials.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Trabajadoras Sociales Group

texts.en:
"Trabajadoras Sociales" is a group that is trying to receive loans to start the process to a better life. Each member in this group is looking to try and expand their small businesses and start increasing their incomes. Andrea is the group representative and has a small business selling food. She took her first loan and bought food products and now makes empanadas and sells them in her area. With this next loan she wants to sell a bigger variety of food, and wants to start selling food in other neighborhoods as well. She has two very young children, and wants nothing more than a better life for her kids. She told me that she dreams of having enough money to send them to college and to allow them to have a better life. Her dream for her business is to have her own restaurant someday. This whole group is excited about the new possibilities that are arising, and are ready to take advantage of this loan and this opportunity to better their lives. 
On behalf of Andrea, the group, and Esperanza International----- Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: These people would like to improve their small businesses.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
La señora Amanda pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres D. Éxito, el cual está ubicado en el Jr. Aguaytia Mz. O Lt. 13 Urbanización el Triunfo, distrito D. Manantay, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 51 años D. edad, es madre D. 3 hijos mayores D. edad, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo D. una motokar.

Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. ropa. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño taller D. costura, cosiendo diferentes prendas D. vestir, actividad que le brinda ganancias para pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.

Con este préstamo D. S/.3,000, el cual será cancelado en 5 meses comprará 1 maquina D. coser, 5 kilos D. tela algodón, 8 metros D. blondas, 2 docenas D. cierre, etc. 

Gracias al apoyo D. Manuela Ramos su negocio se ha ampliado y la estabilidad económica D. su familia ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Amanda belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres D. Éxito” (Successful Women), which is located at Jr. Aguaytia Mz. O Lt. 13 in the Triunfo neighborhood, Manantay district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 51 years old, mother to 3 grown children, married, and her husband drives a motorcar. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos for S/.300 she decided to invest in selling clothing She has worked with the Communal Bank for 8 years. Today she has a small seamstress shop, sewing different articles of clothing, an activity that provides her earnings to pay her loan with punctuality. With this loan for S/.3,000, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy 1 sewing machine, 5 kilos of cotton fabric, 8 meters of silk lace, 2 dozen zippers, etc. Thanks to the support of Manuela Ramos her business has expanded and her family’s economic stability has improved.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine, cotton fabric, lace, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amigas por Siempre”, ubicado en el Jr. Iparía Mz. 145 Lt. 3-C, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como Policía de Transito. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de  Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de ropa.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de productos de zapatos Grendha y a venta de productos de belleza (AVON, UNIQUE, EBEL Y NATURA). Todas las mañanas reparte sus productos a sus clientes y por las tardes se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,800, el cual será pagado en 5 meses comprará 3 docenas de sandalias y zapatos Grendha y productos de belleza Natura, Ebel y Unique.  

Carmen está muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por brindarle su apoyo para demostrar su habilidad en los negocios.
texts.en:
Señora Carmen belongs to the "Friends Always" Communal Bank located in the Jr. Iparía Mz. 145 Lt. 3-C, district of Yarinacocha, Colonel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is 38 years old and a mother of 3 children that still depend on her. She is married and her husband works as a Traffic Policeman. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Branches of 300 soles, she decided to invest in the sale of clothes. Currently she is dedicated to the sale of products from Grendha shoes and beauty products (AVON, UNIQUE, EBEL AND NATURE). Every morning she distributes her products to her clients and in the afternoons she is dedicated to the care of her children. With this loan of 1,800 soles, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy 3 dozen sandals and shoes from Grendha and Nature, Ebel and Unique beauty products. Carmen is very grateful to Manuela Branches for offering her its support to show her ability in business.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals and beauty products for resale

loans.name: Carol

texts.es:
La señora Carol pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del 2000”, ubicado en la Av. Bellavista Nº 668, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como profesor de Educación Superior. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de especería (condimento). Tiene 1 año trabajando con el Banco Comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y especería (condimento), actividad que le brinda ganancias para poder pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.

Con este préstamo de S/1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará 2 cajas de leche, 1 paquete de aceite, ½ de arroz, 2 paquetes de harina, 7 kilos de cominos, 6 kilos de pimienta, salchicha, sillao, etc.

Gracias a Manuela Ramos su negocio ha mejorado. Se siente contenta porque tendrá la oportunidad de darle una mejor educación a sus 2 menores hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Carol belongs to the "Women of 2000" Communal Bank located at 668 Bellavista Ave. north, district of Callería, Colonel Portilla province, department of Ucayali. She is 28 years old and married. Her husband works as a professor of higher education. With the first loan that she received of Manuela Branches of 300 soles she decided to invest in the sale of spices (seasonings). She has been working with the Communal Bank for one year. Currently she is dedicated for sale of groceries and spices (seasonings), an activity that offers her profits to be able to pay her loan promptly. With this loan of 1,200 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 2 boxes of milk, 1 package of oil, ½ package of rice, 2 packages of flour, 7 kilograms of cumin, 6 kilograms of pepper, sausage, soy sauce, etc. Thanks to Manuela Branches her business has improved. she feels happy because she will have the opportunity to give a better education to her 2 small children.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy packages of milk, oil, rice, flour, cumin, pepper, sausage, soy sauce, etc

loans.name: Carola

texts.es:
La señora Carola pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres D. Éxito”, ubicado en el Jr. Pachitea Nº 197, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 38 años D. edad, es madre D. 5 hijos, 2 D. ellos mayores D. edad y 3 que aún dependen D. ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo D. una motokar. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. comidas típicas. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal.  

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio D. venta D. comidas típicas. En las mañanas se va al mercado a comprar todo lo necesario para salir a vender por las noches y brindar una buena atención a sus clientes.  

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 5 kilos D. arroz, 4 docenas D. huevos, 3 kilos D. chorizo, 4 pollos, 1 racimo D. plátano, 3 kilos D. pescados, etc.

Carola agradece el apoyo del Banco Comunal porque tendrá la oportunidad D. darles una mejor educación a sus queridos hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Carola belongs to the "Women of Success" Communal Bank located in the Jr. Pachitea Nº 197, district of Callería, Colonel Portilla province, department of Ucayali. She is 38 years old and a mother of 5 children, 2 of them of legal age and 3 that still depend on her. She is married and her husband is dedicated to the management of a motorcar. With the first loan that she received of Manuela Ramos of 300 soles she decided to invest in the sale of typical foods. She has been working with the Communal Bank for 5 years. Currently she continuous with the same typical foods sale business. In the mornings she goes to the market to buy all that is needed to leave to sell at night and to offer good service to her clients. With this loan of 1,000 soles, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy 5 kilograms of rice, 4 dozen eggs, 3 kilograms of sausage, 4 chickens, 1 bunch of bananas, 3 kilograms of fish, etc. Carola is grateful for the support of the Communal Bank because she will have the opportunity to give a better education to her beloved children.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, eggs, sausage, chicken, bananas, fish, etc.

loans.name: Doris Marlene

texts.es:
La señora Doris pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amigas por Siempre”, ubicado en la Urbanización Fonavi Mz.A Lt.10, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 48 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como repartidor de productos de primera necesidad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes. 

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa, para lo cual se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus hijos, ir al mercado y comprar lo necesario para su bodega. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 3 paquetes de fideos, 2 cajas de leche, detergente, gaseosas, etc. 

Doris es una mujer trabajadora. Se siente contenta por todo lo que ha logrado en la vida.
texts.en:
Señora Doris belongs to the "Friends Always" Communal Bank located in the Urbanization Fonavi Block Lot 10, district of Yarinacocha, Colonel Portilla province, department of Ucayali. She is 48 years old and a mother of 3 children, 2 of legal age and one that still depends on her. She is married and her husband works as a distributor of groceries. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, she decided to invest in the sale of groceries. Currently she relies on a convenience store at home, for which she rises very early to attend her children, to go to the market and to buy the necessary things for her store. With this loan of 1,500 soles, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy 1 bag of rice, 1 bag of sugar, 3 packages of noodles, 2 boxes of milk, detergent, carbonated water, etc. Doris is a hard-working woman. She feels happy for everything that she has achieved in life.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc for her convenience store.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sol Naciente”, ubicado en el Jr. 28 Guillermo Sisley Nº 735, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 54 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo es jubilado de la carrera de Medicina. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta ce comida y gaseosa. Viene trabajando hace años con Manuela Ramos.

En la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño restaurante en casa. Se levanta a las 5am para ir al mercado y luego preparar sus deliciosos platos para vender y brindar una buena atención a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 20 kilos de arroz, 3 litros de aceite, 6 pollos, 6 kilos de carne, 5 kilos de pescado, verduras, etc. 

Elsa expresa alegría en su rostro porque su negocio ha mejorado y sus clientes van más seguido a su restaurante y a la vez le dan la oportunidad de seguir surgiendo en la vida.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the community bank "Sol Naciente", located in Jr. 28 Guillermo Sisley No. 735, in the district of Calleria within the province of Coronle Portillo in Ucayali. She is 54 yeras old and she is mother of 5 children, all of whom are of age. She is married and her husband is retired from a career in medicine. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, amounting to S/.300, she decided to invest in the food and soft drink sales. She has been working many years with Manuela Ramos.

Currently she runs a small restaurant from her home. She wakes up at 5 a.m. to go to the market and then prepaper her delicious cooking to sell and provide good service to her clients.

With this loan, amounting to S/.1000 for a term of 4 months, she will purchase 20 kg of rice, 3 litres of cooking oil, 6 chicken, 6 kg of meat, 5 kg of fish, vegetables, etc.

You can see happiness in Elsa's face because her business has improved and her clients come back more often to her restaurant, and at the same time they give her the opportunity to keep succeeding in life.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, cooking oil, meat, fish, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Eteldita

texts.es:
La señora Eteldita pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Doncellas”, ubicado en la calle 15 Mz. 26 Lt. 23 AA.HH Primavera Segunda Etapa, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años de edad,  es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como independiente. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de  Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decide invertir en la venta de productos de belleza. Tiene 4 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos. 

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y también se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción (arena, ripio, piedras). 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 18 metros de arena, 5 metros de piedra, ripio y productos de belleza. 

Eteldita manifiesta que recibe un gran apoyo de Manuela Ramos porque su negocio ha crecido y desea seguir surgiendo en la vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eteldita belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Doncellas,” located at calle 15 Mz. 26 Lt. 23 AA.HH Primavera Segunda Etapa, Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 33 years old, mother of 3 small children who are still dependent on her, married, and her husband is an independent worker. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/.300, she decided to invest in beauty products. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 4 years. Today she continues with the same business and also sells construction materials (sand, brick fragments, stone). With this loan for S/.1,200, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy 18 meters of sand, 5 meters of stone, brick fragments, and beauty products. Eteldita states that she receives great support from Manuela Ramos because her business has grown and she wishes to continue succeeding in life.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sand, stone, brick fragments, and beauty products

loans.name: Margaritas Group

texts.es:
El tejido a mano de chompas, abrigos, mantillas para adultos y niños, es una de las actividades mas comunes dentro la asociación “margaritas” que trabaja en el centro focal de Germán Buch. Además  tejido algunas también se dedican al bordado a maquina, singulares diseños son aplicados en prendas de vestir, Todas casadas han encontrado en Pro-Mujer la oportunidad de crear pequeños negocios, que les permite obtener ganancias suficientes para el sustento diario de sus familias. 
La asociación Margaritas desea ampliar sus ventas con el fin de obtener mayores ganancias, para esto precisa mayor capital para la compra de prima.
texts.en:
Hand-knitting of sweaters, coats and shawls for adults and children is one of the most widespread activities within the “Margaritas” Association, who work in the municipal center of the province of Germán Busch. In addition to knitting, some also work at machine embroidery, producing unique designs that are used on clothing. All married, they have found in Pro-Mujer the opportunity to create small businesses that allow them to earn enough to provide for their families’ daily needs.

The Margaritas Association would like to expand their sales in order to obtain higher earnings, and for this they need more capital to buy raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: They need increased capital to buy raw materials

loans.name: Glendys Melina

texts.es:
La señora Glendys pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Siete Estrellas”, ubicado en el Jr. Libertadores Nº 299, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 22 años de edad, es madre de una hija  menor de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo de una motokar. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de repuestos. Ya tiene 2 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal.
 
En la actualidad cuenta con la venta de productos de belleza (EBEL). En las mañanas se dedica de su pequeña hija y en las tardes reparte sus productos a sus clientes. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1.700, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará productos de belleza, colonias de bebe, cremas de cuerpo, etc.   

Glendys agradece a Manuela Ramos porque a su corta edad se ha independizado y ha logrado mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Glendys belongs to the communal bank “Las Siete Estrellas” (“The Seven Stars”), located in the Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, in Ucayali. She is 22 years old, the mother of a young daughter who still depends on her, married, and her husband drives a motokar. With the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the sale of spare parts. She has been working with the communal bank for two years.

Currently, she sells EBEL beauty products. In the mornings, she cares of her small daughter and in the afternoons she distributes her products to her customers.

With this loan of 1,700.00 soles, to be repaid in six months, she will purchase beauty products, baby colognes, body creams, etc.

Glendys is grateful to Manuela Ramos because, at her young age, she has been able to become independent and managed to improve her financial situation.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase beauty products, baby colognes, body creams, etc.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Graciela pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres D. Éxito”, ubicado en al Av. Bellavista Nº 594, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 40 años D. edad, es madre D. 2 hijos menores D. edad que aún dependen D. ella, es casada y su esposo tiene un pequeño kiosco en el I.E Pedro Portillo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. productos D. belleza.
 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus hijos y a las 10 a.m. sale a repartir y a cobrar  sus productos D. belleza a sus clientes. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará productos D. belleza (colonias, lápiz labial, cremas D. manos y cuerpos, perfumes, talcos, etc).  

Graciela manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es una ayuda para su familia, gracias a ello su estabilidad económica ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Graciela belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres D. Exito" (Successful Women), located at number 594 Bellavista Avenue, Calleria district, Coronel Portillo province, in the department of Ucayali. She is 40 years old, is a mother of 2 young children who still depend on her. She is married and her husband has a small kiosk in Pedro Portillo street. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 Soles, she decided to invest in beauty products sales.

She currently continues with this same business. Every day she rises very early to take care of her children and at 10:00 am she goes out to distribute her beauty products to her clients and collect from them.

With this loan of 1,200 Soles, which will be paid off in 5 months, she will buy beauty products (cologne, lipstick, hand and body lotion, perfume, talc, etc).

Graciela mantains that Manuela Ramos is a help for her family. Thanks to them her economic stability has improved.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy beauty products (cologne, lipstick, hand and body lotion, etc.)

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.es:
La señora Inocencia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Éxito”, ubicado en la Calle 24 Mz. 24 Lt 9 AA.HH Primavera Segunda Etapa, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 53 años de edad, es madre de 6 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como independiente. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de golosinas. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal de Manuela Ramos. 

En la actualidad cuenta con el negocio de venta de chicharrones. Trabaja todos los días en el mercado Nº 1 desde las 10 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m. con la ayuda de su esposo.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 30 menudencia diarias, 8 kilos de chanco, 2 racimos de plátanos y un motokar de segunda para tener mas ingresos y pagar su préstamo con puntualidad. 
  
Inocencia se siente muy contenta porque todo lo que ha logrado es gracias a su esfuerzo y a su habilidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Inocencia belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres de Exito" (Successful Women). She lives at 24th Street, block 24, lot 9 in the Asentamiento Humano, Primavera Segunda Etapa, in the district of Calleria, Coronel Portillo province, in the deparment of Ucayali. She is 53 years old and a mother of 6 grown children. She is married and her husband is self-employed. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, of 300 Soles, she decided to invest in selling candy. She has worked with the communal bank of Manuela Ramos for 8 years.

Nowadays she has a business selling chicharrones (fried pork skin). She works every day in the Number 1 market from 10 a.m. until 5 p.m. with the help of her husband.

With this loan of 3,000 Soles, which will be paid off in 5 months, she will buy 30 giblets daily, 8 kilos of pork, 2 bunches of plantains, and a used motokar (a motorcycle with a cart behind it) to have more income and pay her loan on time.

Inocencia feels very pleased because all that she has accomplished is thanks to her effort and her skill.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy giblets, pork, plantains, and a second-hand motokar (motocycle with a cart behind)

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicado en el Jr. 28 D. Julio Mz. A Lt. 30, distrito D. Yarinachoca, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 60 años D. edad, es madre D. 5 hijos mayores D. edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como agricultor. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la  confección D. diferentes prendas D. vestir (costura). Tiene 4 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos.

En la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño taller D. costura en casa. Confecciona prendas D. vestir desD. los 19 años. Siempre se acostumbró ha levantarse temprano para realizar sus actividades D. casa y luego dedicarse a la costura.  

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 10 metros D. telas dacrón, 8 kilos D. algodón, 6 docenas D. cierre, hilos D. diferente color, etc. 

Gracias a la ayuda que recibe D. Manuela Ramos su negocio ha mejorado, por eso está feliz y agradecida con el Banco Comunal y sobre todo con Dios.
texts.en:
Isabel belongs to the "Vecinas Unidas" Communal Bank, located in the Jr. 28 D. Julio Mz. A Lt. 30, Yarinachoca district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 60 years old, has 5 grown children, is married and her husband works as a farmer. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, Isabel decided to invest it on the manufacturing of different clothing pieces (seamstress). She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 4 years.

Currently, she has a small seamstress shop at her home. She has been making clothing pieces since she was 19 years old. She is used to waking up early to do the household chores and then dedicate the time to sewing. With this loan of 1500 soles (Peruvian currency), which she will repay in 4 months, Isabel will buy 10 meters of Dacron fabric, 8 kilos of cotton fabric, 6 dozens of zippers, different colors of threads, etc.

Thanks to the help that she receives from Manuela Ramos her business has improved, that's why she is happy and thankful with the Communal Bank but above all she is thankful of God.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy fabrics, zippers, threads, etc.

loans.name: Leutu

texts.en: Leutu F., 49, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience in the retail business. She opens her shop to the village people and public 7 days per week. She has 5 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Leutu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Leutu mentioned that she will only use her loans from SPBD on her business but not anything else. With the loan from SPBD, she will buy goods for the shop like canned food, snack food, and a new refrigerator to replace the old one which is getting rusty. Her oldest daughter is helping her in running the shop.

loans.use: To buy goods for the shop like canned foods, snack foods and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Karen Rozana

texts.es:
La señorita Karen pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Éxito”, ubicado en el Jr. 2 de Mayo Nº. 200, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo,  departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 22 años de edad y es soltera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decide invertir en la venta de gaseosas. Tiene un año trabajando con el Banco Comunal.
 
En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de bebidas (gaseosas, frugos, agua mineral, yogurt y otros). En las mañanas estudia en la UNU y por las tardes se dedica a su negocio, el cual le brinda buenas ganancias.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 10 cajas de gaseosas chicas, 5 paquetes de gaseosas descartables, 6 paquetes de frugos, néctar y otros.  

Karen se siente una mujer realizada e independiente gracias a la ayuda que le brinda Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Karen belongs to the "Mujeres de Exito"(Successful Women) Communal Bank, located in Jr. 2 de Mayo # 200, Calleria district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 22 years old and is single. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos (300 soles-Peruvian currency), Karen decided to invest it on selling carbonated beverages (sodas). She has been working with the Coomunal Bank for one year.

Currently, she sells beverages (sodas, fruit juices, mineral water, yogurt and others). In the mornings, she studies at the UNU and in the afternoons she tends to the business which gives her good earnings. With this 1700 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, which will be pay in 5 months, Karen will buy 10 boxes of small sodas, 5 packages of disposable sodas, 6 packets of fruit juices, nectars, and others.

Karen feels fulfilled and independent thanks to the help that Manuela Ramos offers to her.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy carbonated beverages, fruit juices, water, etc.

loans.name: Triunfadoras De Los Andes Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Triunfadoras De Los Andes” pertenece a la familia de  pro-mujer hace ya mas de nueve años aproximadamente,  cumpliendo con 18 ciclos de crédito, esta  se encuentra en la zona de Los Andes, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha  cuenta con 10 socias activas y han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito.
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación como ser; la elaboración y venta de comida, confección y venta de chamarras, pero una de las actividades mas singulares es a  la que se dedican Sandra, Tania y Eufrasia, ellas realizan hermosos peluches de distintas formas y tamaños que luego de elaborarlos los distribuyen en tiendas de regalos, en distintos puntos de la ciudad y también de forma ambulante. 
La asociación Triunfadoras De Los Andes afirma que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de materia prima  de mejor calidad de esta manera sus productos también tendrían mejor calidad y así obtendrían  mayores clientes y por consiguiente mayores ganancias con el único objetivo de mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
The “Triunfadoras De Los Andes” [Victors of the Andes] Association has belonged to the Pro-Mujer family for more than nine years, fulfilling 18 credit cycles. The association is located in the city of El Alto in the Andes, and right now has 10 active members. They have demonstrated themselves to be organized in meeting their loan payments.

There are various businesses within the association such as food production and sales, and sewing and sales of jackets, but one of the most unique activities that the women carry out are the making of beautiful stuffed bears of different shapes and sizes, that are then distributed to gift shops in many areas of the city or sold through street vendors.

The Triunfadoras de Los Andes Association indicate that they need more capital so that they can purchase higher quality raw materials. By doing this, their products will also be of better quality. In this way they will acquire better clients and thus obtain greater earnings, so they can achieve their sole objective of improving their economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: They need increased capital to buy better quality raw materials

loans.name: Laura Senith

texts.es:
La señora Laura pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicado en el Jr. Ucayali Nº 875, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 44 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como profesor de Educación Secundaria. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de ropa. Tiene un año trabajando con el Banco Comunal.
 
En la actualidad Laura es profesora de Educación Primaria. Su negocio es vender productos de belleza (EBEL) y confeccionar toallitas de mano “Lencería”. En las mañanas labora como docente, por las tardes reparte sus productos y en sus tiempos libres trabaja en su lencería. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 15 metros de telas felpa, blondas, cintas, hilos y productos de bellezas.

Gracias a la ayuda del Banco Comunal y a su esfuerzo su negocio ha mejorado y por ende tendrá la oportunidad de seguir apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Laura belongs to the "Vecinas Unidas" Communal Bank, located at Jr. Ucayali # 875, Calleria district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 44 years old, married and the mother of 3 minor children who still depende on her. Her husband works as a Secondary Education professor. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos (300 soles-Peruvian currency), Laura decided to invest it on selling clothes. She has been working with the Communal Bank for one year.

Currently, Laura is a Primary Education professor. Her business sells beauty products (EBEL) and she also makes hand towels. In the mornings, she works as a teacher and in the afternoons, she delivers her products and on her free time Laura works in making the hand towels.

With this 1000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, which will be paid back in 4 months, she will buy 15 meters of terry cloth fabric, flaxen fabric, ribbons, threads, and beauty products. Thanks to the help from the Communal Bank and her effort, Lauras's business has improved and as a result she will have the opportunity to continue supporting her children.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy fabrics, threads, ribbons, beauty products etc.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Éxito”, ubicado en el Jr. 2 de Mayo Nº 200, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 51 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo aún no trabaja por motivo de enfermedad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida.
 
En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa. En las mañanas se va al mercado, mientras sus hijas atienden el negocio y por las tardes se dedica a dar buena atención a sus clientes.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco de azúcar 2 paquetes de fideos, 3 cajas de leche, 1 saco de arroz, detergentes, etc. 

Lidia es una mujer trabajadora y se siente muy exitosa por todo lo que ha logrado y realizado en la vida.
texts.en:
Lidia belongs to the "Mujeres de Exito" (Successful Women) Communal Bank, located on the Jr. 2 de Mayo # 200, Calleria district, Coronel Portill province, Ucayali department. She is 51 years old and is the mother of 5 grown children. She is also married and her husband cannot work due to health and sickness issues. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos (300 soles-Peruvian currency), she decided to invest it on selling food.

Currently, she has a grocery store out of her home. In the mornings, she goes to the market, while her daughters tend to the business and in the afternoons she is dedicated to give good customer service to her clientele. With this loan of 1200 soles (Peruvian currency) which will be paid back in 5 months, Lidia will buy a sack of sugar, 2 packages of noodles, 3 boxes of milk, 1 sack of rice, detergents, etc.

Lidia is a hard workiing woman and feels very successful in all that she has accomplished in life.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy sugar, noodles, milk, rice, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Doncellas”, ubicado en la calle 22 Mz. 22 Lt. 16 AA.HH Primavera Segunda Etapa, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, 1 mayor de edad y 3 que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo de una Motokar. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de belleza. 

En la actualidad se dedica al mismo negocio y también a la venta de lencería “ropa interior”. En las mañanas se dedica a su hogar y por las tardes a repartir sus productos y a confeccionar la ropa interior para vender a sus clientes. 
 
Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprara 10 metros de tela algodón de diferentes colores y productos de belleza.

Gracias a Menuela Ramos su negocio ha mejorado y ahora podrá darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lidia belongs to the "Las Doncellas" Communal Bank, located on the 22nd street Mz. 22 Lt. 16 AA.HH Primavera Second Stage, Calleria district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 39 years old, is the mother of 4 children, 1 grown-up and 3 that still depend on her. She is married and her husband drives a motocar. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos (300 soles-Peruvian currency), Lidia decided to invest in selling beauty products.

Currently, she continues with this business and also sells lingerie and underwear. In the mornings, she is dedicated to her household chores and in the afternoons, she delivers her products and makes the lingerie to sell to her customers. With this loan of 2000 soles (Peruvian currency), which will be paid back in 5 months, Lidia will buy 10 meters of cotton fabrics in different colors and beauty products.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos, her business has improved and now she will be able to provide her children with a better education


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy fabrics and beauty products

loans.name: Linda

texts.es:
La señora Linda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amigas por Siempre”, ubicado en el Jr. José Foqui Mz. Ñ Lt. 29, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como ayudante en un aserradero. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decide invertir en la venta de aguajina y productos regionales (Chancaca, fariña y otros).

En la actualidad se dedica al mismo negocio de “venta de productos naturales”. Linda trabaja de Lunes a Sábado desde la 10 a.m. a 2 p.m, lo cual le permite obtener buenas ganancias para pagar su préstamo con puntualidad. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco de fariña, 4 sacas de aguaje, 50 kilos de chancaca, 50 kilos de noni, etc.
  
Linda está feliz porque su negocio ha crecido y desea tener un puesto más grande para darle una mejor educación a su menor hijo.
texts.en:
Linda belongs to the "Amigas por Siempre" (Forever Friends) Communal Bank, located in the Jr. Jose Foqui Mz. ñ Lt. 29, Yarinacocha District, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 39 years old, is the mother of 3 children, 2 grown-up and one that still depends on her. She is also married and her husband works as an assistant in a woodmill. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos (300 soles-Peruvian currency), Linda decided to invest it on selling agujina, molasses, and coarse mandioc flour as well as other regional products.

Currently, she still works on the same business and also sells "natural products". Linda works from Monday to Saturday from 10 a.m. until 2 p.m. which allows her to obtain good earnings to pay her loan on time. With this loan of 1500 soles (Peruvian currency), which she will pay back in 5 months, Linda will buy a sack of coarse mandioc flour, 4 sacks of aguaje, 50 kilos of molasses, 50 kilos of noni, etc.

Linda is happy because her business has grown and wishes to have a bigger stall to provide her younger son with a better education


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy coarse mandioc flour, molasses, noni, etc.

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.es:
En el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua, el joven Jefferson B. se dedica al negocio de venta de abarrotes el cual comercializa muy esforzadamente con el objetivo de llevar el sustento a su humilde hogar de habitación.

Se dedica con gran esfuerzo al negocio con el propósito de mejorar su condición económica por medio de la venta de abarrotes, granos básicos y productos para el hogar. La razón por la cual una vez más Jefferson solicita el crédito en Ceprodel es para la compra de los abarrotes para comercializarlos en el mercado Israel Lewites. Con los créditos otorgados anteriormente ha logrado mejorar su condición económica y por ende el de su negocio y espera que su crédito sea otorgado satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
In the Israel Lewites market in the city of Managua, the young Jefferson B. sells groceries, which he markets very forcefully with the goal of bringing sustenance to his humble home.

He works hard to improve his economic condition through the sale of groceries, basic grains, and household products. Jefferson is requesting a loan again from Ceprodel so that he can buy groceries to market them in the Israel Lewites market. With the loans he received before, he succeeded in improving his economic condition and that of his business. He hopes that his loan will be granted agreeably.


Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Lizeth Karina

texts.es:
La señora Lizeth pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Siete Estrellas”, ubicado en el Jr. Libertadores Nº 299, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años de edad, es madre de un hijo menor de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al trabajo de transporte terrestre (Manejo de una motokar). Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decide invertir en la venta de gaseosas.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza (EBEL). Compra por campaña para vender a sus clientes a un precio justo.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará variedades de productos de belleza, perfumes, colonias, talcos, etc.

Lizeth agradece a Dios por darle buena salud y a Manuela Ramos por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Señora Lizeth belongs to the communal bank called "The Seven Stars", located in the district of Calleria in the area of Coronel Portillo in the state of Ucayalli. She's 30 years old. She's mother of a young little boy who still depends on her financially. She's married and her husband is in transportation (driving a motorcar). With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it by buying soda/refreshment to sell. She currently sells beauty products/cosmetics (Ebel). She buys in bulk so that she can later sell to her clients at a fair price. With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase a variety of beauty products such as perfumes, colognes, powders, etc. Lizeth gives thanks to God for being healthy and to Manuela Ramos for all the help she has provided.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products such as perfumes, colognes, powders, etc.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
En el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Josefa L. desde 18 años se dedica al negocio de la venta de verduras las cuales las comercializa en su propio tramo donde es visitada por sus clientes para comprar las verduras.

Con gran esfuerzo se ha desarrollado en el negocio y ha logrado salir adelante manteniendo su familia compuesta por sus 5 hijos. Hoy en día como todo negocio en desarrollo ha logrado mejorarlo y es por este motivo que ha acudido a Ceprodel para continuar con el mejoramiento de dicho negocio. Con este crédito se beneficia tanto él como su familia a la que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefa L. has been selling vegetables in the Israel Lewites market for 18 years. She markets the products in her stand, where her clients visit to buy vegetables.

With great effort, she has started her business and has succeeded in going forward, supporting her family, which is made up of her 5 children. Today, she has succeeded in improving her business and, as a result, she has come to Ceprodel to continue improving her business. Both she and the family that she loves will benefit greatly from this loan.


Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Loida Grimaneza

texts.es:
La señora Loida pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicado en el Jr. Padre Biedma Nº 168, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 54 años D. edad, es madre D. 4 hijos mayores D. edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como profesor D. Educación Primaria. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300, deciD. invertir en la venta D. zapatos. Tiene 2 años en Manuela Ramos.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta D. Bocaditos y productos D. belleza (ORIFLAME). Tiene el apoyo D. su hijo. En las mañanas prepara sus bocaditos para venderlos por las tardes a sus clientes.   

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,300, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará una selladora, 8 kilos D. harina, 6 kilos D. azúcar, 6 paquetes D. bolsas, aceite y productos D. belleza. 

Loida está agradecida con el Banco Comunal porque su negocio ha mejorado y desea seguir triunfando en la vida.
texts.en:
Señora Loida belongs to the communal bank called "United Neighbors", located in the district of Calleria in the area of Coronel Portillo in the state of Ucayalli. She's 54 years old. She's the mother of 4 adult children. She's married and her husband is an elementary school teacher. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it in selling shoes.
