She has been a client of Manuela Ramos for 2 years. She currently sells snacks and cosmetic products called Oriflame. She has the support of her children. In the mornings, she prepares the snacks so that she can sell them to her clients later in the afternoon. With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will purchase a vacuum sealer, 8 kilos of flour, 6 kilos of sugar, 6 packets of plastic bags, cooking oil and beauty products. Loida is very thankful to the Communal Bank because her business has improved and she hopes to keep being successful in life.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a vacuum sealer, flour, sugar, plastic bags, cooking oil and beauty products

loans.name: Julia Marina

texts.es:
En el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua la señora Julia S. posee su propio tramo donde vende frutas y verduras ofreciéndolas a los clientes que día a día visitan el mercado en busca de sus productos. Debido a que la competencia de la señora Julia se ha incrementado, hoy en día le urge aumentar sus ventas y ofertar mayores cantidades de frutas y verduras y es por este motivo que una vez más ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de sus productos.

Hoy en día espera que su crédito le sea otorgado para continuar con el negocio y de esta forma continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia S. has her own stand in the Israel Lewites market in the city of Managua where she sells fruits and vegetables to her clients, who visit the market day after day in search of her products. Because of her ability, the business has grown. Today, it is necessary for her to increase her sales and offer more fruits and vegetables. As a result, she has come to Ceprodel again to get a loan, which will allow her to buy products.

She hopes that this loan will be offered to her so that she can continue her business and, in this way, continue bringing sustenance to her house.


Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Flores de los Próceres”, ubicado en al Jr. Los Pinos Mz. 9 Lt. 3 AA.HH Próceres de la Independencia, distrito de Manantay, provincia Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años de edad, es madre de una hija menor de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como empleado en la municipalidad de Coronel Portillo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de pescado. Tiene 6 años trabajando con el Banco de Crédito.  

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio “la venta de pescado”. Se levanta a las 4 a.m. para salir al puerto a comprar y luego vender variedades de pascados. Tiene el apoyo de su cuñada Maruja.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 4 bandejas de pescados diarios.  

Lucia agradece a Dios por darle vida y salud y al Banco de Manuela Ramos por confiar en su persona.
texts.en:
Señora Lucia belongs to the Communal Bank called "The flowers of the Illustrious" located in the district of Manantay in the city of Coronel Portillo in the state of Ucayalli. She's 39 years old. She's the mother of a little girl who still depends on her financially. She's married and her husband works for the city of Coronel Portillo. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it in selling fish. She has been a client for over 6 years. She continues to sell fish. She gets up around 4 in the morning to go to the port to buy the fish which she later sells. She has the support of her sister-in-law named Maruja. With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will purchase 4 trays of daily fish. Lucia thanks God for life and good health and to Manuela Ramos for trusting her.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Mirtalia De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
El negocio de la señora Mirtalia M. es la venta de ropa el cual la comercializa en su tramo en el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua. Con gran esfuerzo se ha dedicado a este negocio y ha logrado mejorarlo ya que ha hecho uso de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel para la obtención de su mercadería.

Una vez más hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un nuevo crédito que le permita la compra de su mercadería. Por esta razón no duda en acudir a Ceprodel y así continuar esforzándose por mejorar su negocio y proyectarse como buen comerciante en el mercado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mirtalia Muño sells clothes, which she markets in her stand in the Israel Lewites market in the city of Managua. She has worked hard at this business and has succeeded in improving it because she has had loans offered to her by Ceprodel so that she can buy her merchandise.

She is again looking for Ceprodel’s support so that she can get a new loan that will allow her to buy merchandise; because of this, she had no doubts in coming to Ceprodel. As a result, she will continue working hard to improve her business and project herself as a good merchant in the market.


Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Luz Izola

texts.es:
La señora Luz pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicado en la Av. Bellavista Nº 1299, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 50 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como mecánico en una tienda de repuestos. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de lencería. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal.

En la actualidad trabaja como profesora en la I.E Comercio y tiene en casa un pequeño taller de costura. En las mañanas labora como docente y por las tardes se dedica a confeccionar sus prendas de vestir para vender a sus clientes.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 9 metros de tela lino, 10 metros de poli ceda, 6 kilos de tela algodón. También hará un viaje a Trujillo para comprar zapatos.  

Luz se siente contenta y agradecida con la vida por tener un trabajo y un negocio propio y por ende agradece al Banco Comunal por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Señora Luz belongs to the Communal Bank called "United Neighbors", located in the district of Calleria in the city of Coronel Portillo in the state of Ucayali. She's 50 years old. She's the mother of 2 sons who are of age. She's married and her husband works as a mechanic in a shop that sells car parts. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it in selling linens. She has been working with the communal bank for 8 years. She currently works as a teacher at the (I.E. Commercio/Commerce). She has a sewing workshop that she runs from home. In the morning, she works as a teacher and in the afternoons she sews her articles of clothing to sell to her clients. With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will purchase 9 meters of canvas fabric, 10 meters of silk, 6 kilos of cotton fabric. She will also go on a trip to Trujillo to buy shoes to sell. Luz is very happy and thankful with her life situation for having her own business and she gives her thanks to the communal bank for providing her with all of this help.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various types of fabric

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es:
Salvadora L. se dedica desde hace 8 años al negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos el cual son preparados por ella misma en su tramo en el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua.

Sus esfuerzos han permitido que su negocio se desarrolle cada vez más porque ahora tiene la oportunidad de ser visitada por más clientes. El motivo por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener el crédito para la compra de la materia prima para preparar los alimentos. Una vez obtenido el crédito logrará acaparar más clientes al ofrecer más variedad en los deliciosos platillos que ella prepara.
texts.en:
For the past 8 years, Salvadora L. has worked selling prepared foods, which she makes herself in her shop in the Israel Lewites market in the city of Managua.

Her efforts have allowed her business to develop more every day. Now she has the opportunity to be visited by more clients. The motivation for which she has come to Ceprodel is to obtain a loan to use for the purchase of raw materials for the preparation of food. Once obtained, the loan will allow her to attract more clients through because she will be able to offer wider varieties of delicious meals that she prepares.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Luz Karminia

texts.es:
La señora Luz pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Siete Estrellas”, ubicado en el Jr. Libertadores Nº 299, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como empleado de Maple Gas. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de néctar. 

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza (EBEL). Se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus pequeños hijos, para luego en las tardes salir a vender sus productos de diferentes aromas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará productos de belleza, actividad que le brinda ganancias para poder pagar su préstamo puntualmente.  
  
Luz demuestra felicidad en su rostro porque ha logrado salir adelante con la ayuda de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Señora Luz belongs to the communal bank called "The Seven Stars", located in the district of Calleria, in the town of Coronel Portillo in Ucayali. She's 30 years old. She has 2 young children. She's married and her husband works for Maple Gas. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it in selling fragrances. She currently sells cosmetics Ebel. She gets up early every morning to take care of her little ones and then in the afternoons she goes out to sell her fragrances. With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase beauty products. This business has turned out to be very profitable because she makes enough money to make her payments on time. Luz's face is full of happiness because she's able to move ahead with the help of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products

loans.name: Mirsa

texts.es:
La señora Mirsa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Éxito”, ubicado en el Jr. Emilio Tipto Nº 115 “San Fernando”, distrito de Manantay, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 45 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja en su taller de tapicería “Tapicero”. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la infraestructura de su taller de tapicería.

En la actualidad cuenta con su taller y con la ayuda de su esposo. Abre su taller a las 8 a.m. y cierra a las 8 p.m. Verifica y administra los movimientos de su negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 5 rollos de marroquín “tolderas” de diferentes colores.

Mirsa se siente feliz trabajando con Manuela Ramos porque ha logrado sobresalir y tiene el deseo de ampliar más su negocio con la ayuda del Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Señora Mirsa belongs to the communal bank called " Successful Women", located in the district of Manantay in the city of Coronel Portillo in Ucayali. She's 45 years old. She's the mother of 3 children who still depend on her financially. She's married and her husband works as a tapestry maker and has his own shop. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it in the renovation of the tapestry shop. She currently works in the shop with the help of her husband. They open the shop at 8 in the morning and they close it at 8 in the evening. She controls and administrates the business. With this loan, which she will repay within 5 months, she will purchase 5 rolls of vinyl of different colors. Mirsa is very happy with Manuela Ramos because she has been able to move ahead and she wishes to grow her business with the help of the Communal Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vinyl of different colors

loans.name: Violeta Auxiliadora

texts.es:
El negocio de la señora Violeta B. es la venta de ropa y calzado el cual es comercializado en el mercado Israel Lewites de Managua. Esta dama ha sido una persona que por varios años atravesó difíciles momentos en su negocio pero desde que comenzó a trabajar con Ceprodel mejoró su situación por lo que ahora ha logrado mejorar el negocio y ha salido adelante en sus ventas.

La razón por la que ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para obtener el crédito y de esta forma salir adelante en el negocio adquiriendo la mercadería de sus proveedores. Con el crédito se beneficia porque mejora las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Violeta B.'s business is in sales of clothing and shoes, which she vends at the Israel Lewites market in Managua. This woman has been someone who for many years as overcome difficult moments in her business, but since starting to work with Ceprodel her situation has improved. Now she has improved her business and has surged ahead in her sales. The reason for which she has requested the help of Ceprodel is to obtain a credit. This loan will allow her to move ahead in the business, acquiring merchandise from her providers. With this loan she will benefit greatly, because she will better the conditions of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Siete Estrellas”, ubicado en el Jr. Raymondi Nº 1031, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 53 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como independiente (comprador de madera). Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertir en la compra de materiales para decorar diferentes eventos.

En la actualidad trabaja en la Municipalidad como jefa de Registro Civil y al mismo tiempo es decoradora de diferentes eventos como matrimonios, 15 años, etc.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 10 metros de telas poli sedas de diferentes colores (azul, rojo, blanco, dorado, amarillo, etc.).

Nancy manifiesta que el Banco Comunal es una ayuda para todas las mujeres trabajadoras y está agradecida con Dios por darle vida y salud.
texts.en:
Nancy belongs to “Las Siete Estrellas” ("The Seven Stars") Communal Bank, located on Jr. Raymondi Nº 1031 in the Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 53 years old, the mother of four, married, and her husband works as a timber purchaser.

With her first loan from Manuela Ramos, she invested materials to decorate different events. Currently, she works in the municipality as the boss of the Civil Registration and at the same time she is decorator for different events like weddings, quincieañeras, etc.

With this loan of $975, which she will repay in six months, she will buy 10 meters of different colored poly silk fabric (blue, red, white, gold, yellow, etc.).

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprará telas.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Siete Estrellas”, ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Barrera Nº 542, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 47 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos, 3 mayores de edad y 2 que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como profesor de Educación Secundaria”. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertir en la venta de comida. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal.

En la actualidad es profesora de Educación Primaria. Tiene en casa un pequeño taller de costura, los domingos vende riquísimas polladas. Estas actividades le brindan buenas ganancias para poder pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.    

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 20 metros de tela de algodón, 6 metros de tela lino español, 5 metros de rip “cuello de polos”, cierres, hilos, etc.  

Nancy manifiesta que todo lo que ha logrado es gracias a su esfuerzo y a la ayuda que le brinda Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Nancy belongs to "The Seven Stars" Communal Bank, located on Jr. Comandante Barrera Nº 542 in the Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 47 years old, the mother of five children (three older children and two who depend on her), married and her husband works as a high school teacher. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to start selling meals. She's been working with the Communal Bank for five years. Currently, she is an elementary school teacher. In her home, she has a small dressmaking workshop; on Sundays, she sells delicious chicken dinners. These activities provide her with a good income to pay her loan on time. With this loan of $650, which she will repay in six months, she will buy 20 meters of cotton fabric, 6 meters of Spanish linen, 5 meters of polo necks, zippers, thread, etc. Nancy says that all that she has achieved is thanks to her effort and the help of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different types of fabric, closures, thread, etc.

loans.name: Nelly De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Nelly pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicado en el Jr. Aguarico Nº 299, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 36 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijas menores de edad que aún dependen de ella y es viuda. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decide invertir en el arreglo de su motokar.

En la actualidad trabaja de enfermera en el Hospital Regional de Pucallpa y cuenta con su motokar que lo trabaja todos los días. Acostumbra a levantarse muy temprano para ir a trabajar y por las tardes dedicarse a sus pequeñas hijas.   

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará Llantas, foco, tapizar los asientos, arreglo de motor, etc. 

Nelly manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es una ayuda para todas las mujeres que saben trabajar y está deseosa de tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Nelly belongs to the "Neighbors United" Communal Bank located at Jr. Aguarico Nº 299 in the Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 36 years old, the mother of two young daughters, and a widow. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in repairing her motocar. Currently, she works as a nurse at the Pucallpa Regional Hospital and relies on her motokar to work every day. She is accustomed to getting up very early to go to work and in the afternoons dedicates herself to her young daughters. With this loan of $400, which she will repay in four months, she will buy tires, lights, upholstered seats, motor repair, etc. Nelly says that Manuela Ramos is a help for all women that know how to work and want a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tires, lights, upholstered seats, motor repairs, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Flores de los Próceres”, ubicado en la calle 20 Mz. 27 Lt. 7 AA.HH Primavera Segunda Etapa, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 34 años de edad, es madre de2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como vendedor de ripio y arena. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de  Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de carbón.

En la actualidad cuenta con una pequeña bodega en casa, para lo cual se levanta temprano para atender a sus hijos y luego ir al mercado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará ½ saco de azúcar y arroz, un paquete de fideos, una caja de leche, golosinas, carbón y verduras.

Rosa se siente feliz y agradecida por la ayuda brindada en Manuela Ramos ya que su estabilidad económica ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to “Las Flores de los Próceres” (The Flowers of the National Heroes) Communal Bank located on 20 Mz. 27 Lt. 4AA. HH Primavera Segunda Etapa, in the Callería district in the Coronel Portillo province in the Ucayali department. She is 34 years old, the mother of two young children, married, and her husband works selling gravel and sand. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in charcoal sales. Currently, she has a grocery store in her home, where she rises early to tend to her children and later go to the market. With this loan of $325, which she will repay in four months, she will buy 1/2 a sack of sugar and rice, a package of noodles, a box of milk, candy, charcoal, and vegetables. Rosa is happy and grateful for the help that Manuela Ramos has provided. Her financial situation has already improved.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, noodles, milk, candy, charcoal, and vegetables

loans.name: Walter Daniel

texts.es:
Walter A. es originario de la ciudad de Managua y se dedica al negocio de pulpería o tienda general ubicada en un tramo del mercado Israel Lewites de la capital.

El desarrollo de su negocio lo debe a Ceprodel por lo que le ha brindado prestamos que los ha utilizado directamente en la compra de su mercadería para comercializarla. Una vez mas hoy acude a Ceprodel con la esperanza de que su crédito sea otorgado para continuar con su negocio y de esta forma llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación que tanto necesita de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Walter A. is originally from the city of Managua and had general store located in a section of the Israel Lewites market in the capitol. He developed his business thanks to Ceprodel, who have provided loans that he has used directly for the purchase of his merchandise to sell. Once again, he comes to Ceprodel with the hope that a loan will be granted to him so that he can continue his business and as such bring vital income home, where his support is very much needed.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
L. señora Rosario pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicado en el Jr. Guillermo Sisley Nº 372, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 32 años D. edad, es madre D. 2 hijos menores D. edad que aún dependen D. elL., es casada y su esposo trabaja en L. atención D. su negocio “Venta D. repuestos”. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. ManueL. Ramos D. S/. 300 decidió invertir en L. venta D. golosinas. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal.

En L. actualidad se dedica a L. venta D. repuestos en casa. Se levanta temprano para atender a sus menores hijos y luego se dedica a L. atención D. su negocio. 

Con este préstamo D. S/1,200 el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará 12 llantas, 20 unidades D. catalinas, 6 cajas D. aceite para motos, 20 cajas D. cadena, etc. 

Rosario manifiesta que ManueL. Ramos es una ayuda para su familia. Se siente feliz porque se relaciona con mujeres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
Rosario belongs to the "Vecinas Unidas" ("Neighbors United") Communal Bank located at Jr. Guillermo Sisley Nº 372, Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 32 years old, the mother of tow young children, married, and her husband works selling spare auto parts. With her first loan from ManueL. Ramos, she invested in selling candy. She has been working with the communal bank for four years. Currently, she sells spare parts from her home. With this loan of $400 dollars, which she will repay in four months, she will buy 12 tires, 20 units of bearings, six boxes of motor oil, 20 boxes of chains, etc. Rosario says that ManueL. Ramos is a help for her family. She is happy because she connects with other working women.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires, bearings, motor oil, chains, etc.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 40 años de edad, estudió tercero de secundaria, es conviviente, progenitora de 03 hijos (02 varones de 21, 18 años y 01 mujer de 10 años de edad), vive en el Jr. Cuzco Nº 104 del Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo – Puno.

Hace 04 años es socia del Banco Comunal “Wiñay Marca”- Yunguyo. A los 18 años de edad tuvo su pareja y empezaron con la venta de: lavadores, tachos, baldes, etc. (plastiquería) a la fecha  que trae de la ciudad de Desaguadero, paralelo a su negocio, aperturó su tienda de abarrotes hace 04 años.

Con el crédito que solicitará de S/.3000.00 nuevos soles, el que pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará: plastiquerias valor de S/.1500.00 y abarrotes con S/.1500.00, para ser comercializados al por mayor y menor.

Su sueño es tener una tienda de plastiquerias y que sus hijos estudien para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Lidia is 40 years old, studied until the third grade, lives with her partner, is the mother of three children (two boys ages 21 and 18, and one 10 year old girl), and lives at Jr. Cuzco Nº 104 in the district and province of Yunguyo – Puno. For the past four years, she has been a member of the “Wiñay Marca”- Yunguyo Communal Bank. At 18, she and her partner began to sell scrubbers, wastebaskets, buckets, etc. (plastic goods) that she brought from the city of Desagadero. While she was selling plastic goods, she opened a grocery store four years ago. With this loan of $975, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy plastic goods and groceries to be sold wholesale and retail. Her dream is to have a plastic goods store and to see her children study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic goods and groceries.

loans.name: Rosita Miksy

texts.es:
La señora Rosita pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Doncellas”, ubicado en la calle 22 Mz. 30 Lt. 5 AA.HH Primavera Segunda Etapa, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 28 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como vigilante de seguridad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decidió invertir en la venta de abarrotes. Viene trabajando 3 años con el Banco Comunal. 

En la actualidad  se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y cuenta con un galpón de crianza de pollos en el Km 60. De Lunes a Viernes se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y a la venta de su negocio, Sábados y Domingos administra la crianza de pollos.   
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 10 cajas de gaseosas y 200 pollitos.  

Rosita y su familia se sienten muy felices por la ayuda que recibe del Banco Comunal de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Rosita belongs to the communal bank "Las Doncellas” located at calle 22 Mz. 30 Lt. 5 AA.HH Primavera Segunda Etapa in Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali. She is 28 years old and has two young children whom she needs to support. Rosita is married, her husband works as a security guard. She decided to invest the first loan of 300 soles she received from Manuela Ramos in the sale of groceries. She has been working with the communal bank for three years.

At the moment Rosita sells soft drinks and has of a chicken shed where she breeds chicken at Km 60. From Monday to Friday she attends her children and her business while she manages the breeding of chicken on Saturdays and Sundays.

She will purchase 10 crates of soft drinks and 200 chicks with the present loan of 2000 soles. This amount will be paid back in 5 months.

Rosita and her family are very happy for the help they receive from the communal bank of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Edit Pecsi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks and chicken

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La señora Sofía pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicado en el Jr. Morona Nº 144, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 44 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como empleado administrativo en el Magisterio. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de refrescos, tamales, empanadas y otros. 
 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio. De Lunes a Viernes en las mañanas vende en la I.E Comercio (empanadas, tamales, refrescos, aguajes y otros antojitos).

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará un saco de azúcar, 5 litros de aceite, un ciento de cocona, 2 sacos de aguajes, etc.

Sofía manifiesta que el Banco Comunal es una ayuda para todas las mujeres que les gusta luchar y trabajar en la vida.
texts.en:
Sofia belongs to the "Vecinas Unidas" [United Neighbours] communal bank located at Jr. Morona Nº 144, Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali. She is 44 years old and has 5 adult children. She is married, her husband works in educational administration. Sofia decided to invest the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, 300 soles in the sale of soft drinks, pies, tamales (Peruvian stuffed corn pastries) and other goods.

At the moment she continues in the same business. She sells pasties, tamales, soft drinks, palm fruit and other snacks at the trade school in the mornings from Monday to Friday.

She will purchase a sack of sugar, 5 litres of oil, a hundred coconas, 2 sacks of palm fruit etc. with this loan of 1000 soles. This amount will be paid back in 4 months.

Sofia demonstrates that the communal bank is a great help for all women who like to fight and work.

Translated from Spanish by Edit Pecsi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will purchase sugar, oil, cocona, palm fruit, etc.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Mujeres de Éxito”, ubicado en el Jr. Requena Nº 122-A, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo la ayuda en su negocio. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decide invertir en la venta de canchita.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de comida, anticuchos, refrescos y canchita, para ello tiene el apoyo de su hija y esposo. Vende en diferentes eventos como ferias o cuando llega cualquier orquesta musical.   

Con este préstamo de S/3,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 10 kilos de corazones de cerdo, 11 paquetes de chorizo, 5 pollos, 4 kilos de maíz morado, 4 kilos de arroz, etc. 
  
Teresa trabaja con mucho entusiasmo para apoyar a sus hijas en sus estudios. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por brindarle su apoyo.
texts.en:
Teresa belongs to the "Las Mujeres de Éxito" [Successful Women] communal bank located at Jr. Requena Nº 122-A in Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali. She is 49 years old and has two children whom she still supports. Teresa is married, her husband helps her with the business. She decided to invest the first loan of 300 soles she received from Manuela Ramos in the sale of popcorn.

At present Teresa sells food, skewered meat, soft drinks and popcorn; her husband and daughter help her with this. She offers her goods at various events like holidays or whenever an orchestra arrives.

She will purchase 10 kg of pork heart, 11 packages of sausage, 5 chickens, 4 kg of purple corn, 4 kg of rice, etc. with the present loan of 3000 soles. This amount will be paid back in 5 months.

Teresa works enthusiastically to support her daughters’ studies. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for offering support to her.

Translated from Spanish by Edit Pecsi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pork heart, sausage, chicken, purple corn, rice, etc.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La señora Vilma pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Siete Estrellas”, ubicado en la Av. Bellavista Nº 801, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 52 años D. edad, es madre D. 4 hijos mayores D. edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como independiente. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 decidió invertir en la venta D. costura. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal.

En la actualidad es profesora D. confección textil y tiene en casa un pequeño taller D. costura. D. Lunes a Viernes trabaja en su especialidad y los fines D. semana confecciona las prendas D. vestir.  

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará una remalladota, 10 kilos D. tela D. licra  y algodón, elástico, cierre, hilos, etc.
 
Gracias a la ayuda brindada del Banco Comunal, su negocio ha crecido y la estabilidad económica D. su familia ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the "Las Siete Estrellas" [Seven Stars] communal bank located at Av. Bellavista Nº 801 in Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali. She is 52 years old and is the mother of four adult children. Vilma is married, her husband has an independent living. She decided to invest the first loan of 300 soles she received from Manuela Ramos in the sale of needlework. She has been working with the communal bank for five years.

At present Vilma is a textiles teacher and has a small dressmaker workshop at home. From Monday to Friday she is active in her profession and on weekends she sews clothes.

She will purchase a sewing machine, 10 kg of lycra and cotton, elastic material, zippers, threads etc. with the present loan of 2000 soles. It will be paid back in 6 months.

Thanks to the support provided by the communal bank Vilma’s business has improved and the economic stability of her family has increased.

Translated from Spanish by Edit Pecsi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine, fabrics, elastic material, zippers, threads, etc.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Siete Estrellas”, ubicado en la Av. San Martín  Nº 785 Interior B, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, 1 mayor de edad y  1 que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como contador en una empresa privada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertir en una pequeña peluquería. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el Banco Comuanal.  

En la actualidad es profesora de Cosmetología y Educación por el Arte y cuenta con una peluquería en casa. Por las mañanas trabaja como docente y en las tardes se dedica a cambiar de look a todos sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 1 juego de sillas para ondular, 1 docena de acido de pelo, 2 docena de tinte de pelo, mandil, etc.  

Virginia es una mujer trabajadora que desea seguir adelante para el bienestar de su menor hija.
texts.en:
Virginia belongs to the "Las Siete Estrellas" [Seven Stars] communal bank located at Av. San Martín Nº 785 Interior B in Callería district, Ucayali. She is 39 years old and has two children, one of them grown up and the other still being raised. Virginia is married, her husband works as an accountant at a private company. She decided to invest the first loan of 300 soles she received from Manuela Ramos in a small hairdresser shop. She has been working with the communal bank for 3 years.

At present Virginia works as a cosmetics and arts teacher and manages a hairdresser shop in her home. She teaches in the mornings and changes the looks of all of her customers in the afternoons.

She will purchase a seat kit for perming, a dozen packages of hair acids, 2 dozen packages of dye, an apron etc.using the present loan of 1000 soles, which will be paid back in 6 months.

Virginia is a hardworking woman who wishes to make headway for the well-being of her younger daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Edit Pecsi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seats, dyes, apron, etc.

loans.name: Yessenia

texts.es:
La señorita Yessenia  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Éxito”, ubicado en el Jr. Emilio Tipto Nº 115 “San Fernando”, distrito de Manantay, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 20 años de edad y es soltera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decide invertir en la venta de productos de belleza “AVON”. Tiene 2 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos.

En la actualidad se está preparando para postular a la Universidad. Cuenta con una motokar como herramienta de trabajo, la cual hace trabajar todos los días para tener otros ingresos económicos.    

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 3 llantas, 5 focos, catalinas, etc., y arreglará el motor.

Yessenia manifiesta que gracias a Manuela Ramos se realizó como mujer y tendrá la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Yessenia belongs to the "Mujeres de Éxito" [Successful Women] communal bank located at Jr. Emilio Tipto Nº 115 “San Fernando”, Manantay district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali. She is 20 years old and single. She decided to invested the first loan of 300 soles she received from Manuela Ramos in the sale of AVON beauty products. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for two years.

At present Yessenia is preparing for university application.She has a motokar (a motorcycle with a cart behind it), which she uses every day to raise more income.

She will purchase 3 tyres, wheels, 5 car lights etc and will get the motor fixed using the present loan of 1000 soles . This amount will be paid back in 5 months.

Yessenia demonstrates how she has established herself as a woman and will have the opportunity of a professional education thanks to Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Edit Pecsi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tyres, lights, wheels and repair the motor of the motokar.

loans.name: Yoni

texts.es:
La señora Yoni pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Flores de los Próceres”, ubicado en la calle 20 Mz. 27 Lt. 4 AA.HH Primavera Segunda Etapa, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como profesor de Educación Secundaria. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertir en la venta de ropa interior. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal.  

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa usada para niños y niñas y cuenta con un pequeño taller de costura. En las mañanas se ocupa de sus hijos y en las tardes a confeccionar prendas de vestir sólo para niños (as) y ropa interior para vender a sus clientes. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 5 kilos de telas de algodón, 5 docenas de polos, 4 docenas de blusas y 5 docenas de vestidos para niñas.  

Yoni agradece al Banco Comunal de Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que siempre le brinda y por la oportunidad de emprender un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yoni belongs to the Communal Bank "Las Flores de los Próceres" (The Flowers of National Heroes). The bank is located on 20 Mz. 27 Lt. 4AA. HH Primavera Segunda Etapa, in the Callería district in the Coronel Portillo province in the Ucayali department. Yoni is 42 years old and the mother of 2 small children. Yoni is married and her husband works as a high school teacher. With her first loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos, Yoni invested in her underclothes business. She's been working with the Communal Bank for four years. Now Yoni sells used children's clothes and she has a small sewing shop. In the morning she tends to her children and in the afternoon she sews children's clothing and underclothes to sell to her clients. With a loan of 1,000 soles Yoni will buy 5 kilos of cotton fabric, 5 dozen polo shirts, 4 dozen blouses, and 5 dozen girls' dresses. Yoni is thankful for the Manuela Ramos Communal Bank for its constant support, and for the opportunity to start her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cotton fabrics, polo shirts, blouses, and girls' dresses

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa María empezó esta actividad para ayudar en la economía de su hogar ya que los gastos eran muchos y con los ingresos de su esposo no era suficiente. Aproximadamente hace 7 años comenzó la venta de calzado primero empezó ofreciéndolos con sus amistades quienes la fueron recomendando y gracias a esto logro incrementar sus clientes y así sus ganancias..

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y poder entregar los pedidos de calzado a tiempo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa María started this activity to help with household finances, since expenses were high and her husband's income was not sufficient. She started selling footwear about 7 years ago, beginning with her friends. Thanks to their recommendations she was able to increase her clientele and her earnings. She needs a loan of US $375, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy merchandise and be able to deliver the footwear orders to her clients in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Erika Jazmin

texts.es:
Erika inicio su negocio para apoyar a su esposo con la economía de la casa y para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, su necesidad en aquel entonces era tener un negocio el cual pudiera manejar desde su casa para no descuidar a sus hijos. Inicio haciendo los dulces y arreglos de fiesta para familiares que le pedían y actualmente las personas de las escuelas cercanas le hacen pedidos, lo que le ha permitido mejorar sus ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar material de trabajo ya que va a realizar algunos arreglos que le encargaron para el día de brujas.
texts.en:
Erika started her business to help her husband with family finances and to give her children a better quality of life. At that time, she needed to have a business that she could handle from her house, so she would not neglect her children. She started making sweets and party arrangements for relatives who asked her, and now people from nearby schools give her orders, which has permitted her to improve her income. She needs a loan of US $300, that she will repay in 5 months, to buy working supplies, since she will be creating some arrangements that have been ordered for Halloween.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy working supplies

loans.name: Maria De Jesus Belem

texts.es:
María de Jesús inicio con este negocio ya que junto a su esposo decidieron trabajar por su cuenta para no depender de nadie y obtener un ingreso que les ayudara con los gastos familiares. Comenzaron hace 7 años vendiendo frutas y verduras en su casa; actualmente también realizan esta actividad en mercados rodantes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 5 meses para surtir mercancía. Con tu apoyo seguira progresando.
texts.en:
María de Jesús started this business when she and her husband decided she should work so that they would not be dependent on anybody else, and to earn income to help with family expenses. They started 7 years ago selling fruits and vegetables from their house; currently they also sell in street markets. She needs a loan of US $300, that she will repay in 5 months, to stock up on merchandise. With your help she will continue to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Martha Anaely

texts.es:
Martha inicio con este negocio ya que necesitaba junta dinero para cuando naciera su hija y para que no le faltara nada, además que en aquel entonces ella no recibía ayuda D. nadie, por lo que con este negocio sostenía los gastos D. la casa y D. su embarazo. Comenzó hace poco mas D. un año con este negocio cuando una amiga le recomendó que iniciara un negocio el indicado para ella era la venta D. ropa para que no batallara tanto ya que estaba embarazada, ella le hizo caso y empezó a dedicarse a esto obteniendo buenas ganancias hasta la actualidad.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 5 meses para invertirlo en comprar mercancía D. temporada y poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha started this business to save money for the birth of her daughter, so that she would lack nothing. At that time she did not receive help from anybody, she met the household expenses and those of her pregnancy with her business income. She started this business a little more than a year ago when a friend recommended it to her. The most suitable for her was to sell clothing, because she would not have to struggle so much, since she was already pregnant. She took her friend's word and started to work at it, and has maD. a good income up to now. She needs a loan of US $300, that she will repay in 5 months, to invest in seasonal merchandise so she can continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha inicio con este negocio ya que su esposo estaba pasando por un momento muy difícil en su trabajo por lo que ella decidió apoyarlo para sacar adelante a su familia. Inicio con este negocio hace 3 años, vendiendo ropa primero en su casa y actualmente vende a todos sus compañeros de trabajo.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancía y surtir unos pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Martha started this business because her husband was passing through a difficult time in his work. She decided to help her family to get ahead. She began the business 3 years ago, selling clothing first from her house, and now she sells to all her coworkers. She needs a loan of US $300, that she will repay in 5 months, to buy merchandise to fill some current orders.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Mrs. Nget H. was born in 1960 and now she lives in Siem Bauy village in Kampong Cham Province. She owns a small piece of land used to cultivate rice, and her husband, Mr. Chhon ChH., is a fish breeder. They have four children, two of whom are fishermen and the other two children are attending the local school. 

Even though they have two different businesses, they face some problems in their living conditions. Thus, Mrs. Nget H. decided to request a loan to buy fish food and fishes to add to her husband’s business. She hopes to increase their income and improve her situation with this loan. Her husband is on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy fish food and fishes to add to her husband’s business.

loans.name: Luz Del Carmen

texts.es:
Luz Inicio el negocio de venta de ropa y joyería para poder darles estudio a sus 3 hijos ya que se quedo viuda y se encuentra enferma de cáncer de seno. Cuando empezó su negocio su principal necesidad era la de pagar las deudas que le dejo la muerte de su esposo, aparte de la preocupación de no tener dinero para darles de comer a sus hijos, pagar la escuela; así como los gastos de su tratamiento para combatir el cáncer de seno ya que esto es muy costoso y no tiene servicio medico y se tiene que tratar con un medico particular, gracias a su esfuerzo a podido salir adelante con las ganancias de su negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y tener más variedad de productos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luz started selling clothing and jewelry to be able to give her 3 children an education, since she was a widow and had breast cancer. When she started her business, her principal need was to pay off the debts from the death of her husband, plus not having money to feed her children and pay for school. The cost of her breast cancer treatment is also very expensive, since she does not have medical coverage and must use a private doctor. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to get ahead with the income from her business. She needs a loan of US $375, that she will repay in 6 months, to buy merchandise so she can have a greater variety of products to meet the needs of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La Señora Gloria tiene un negocio de estética al cual le está haciendo falta un espacio para la sala de espera y así sus clientes estén más cómodos mientras los atiende. Este negocio y el trabajo de su esposo el señor Sergio es la fuente de ingreso de su familia ya que tiene tres hijos que están todavía estudiando.

.

La Señora Gloria y el señor Sergio están solicitando un préstamo de $1,000.00 para comprar el material y poder construir la sala de espera para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria has an aesthetics business which is missing the space for a waiting room and so her clients could be more comfortable while she attends to them. This business and her husband Sergio's job is the means of income for the family now that she has three children who are still studying.

Mrs. Gloria and Sergio are asking for a loan of $1000 to buy the material and be able to build the waiting room to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a waiting room

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Luis inicio el negocio de venta de mercería porque se quedo sin trabajo y uno de sus hijos sufre de crisis epilépticas, y el necesitaba solventar los gastos tratamiento para su enfermedad que es muy caro; además que debía de mantener a los demás hijos, ya su esposa por la enfermedad de su hijo se le complicaba trabajar porque necesitaba estar al pendiente de el.

El necesita un préstamo por US $750 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía para el negocio y así incrementar las ventas y poder darles a los clientes un producto de calidad.
texts.en:
Luis started the business of selling clothes and merchandise because he was without work and one of his children suffers epileptic seizures, and he needs to meet the treatment expenses for his illness, which is very expensie. Also, he should support his other children, now that it is complicated for his wife to work, because of their son's illness she needs to be at his side.

He needs a loan of $750 which he will pay back in six months to buy merchandise for the business and so increase the sales and provide his customers with a quality product.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Kay

texts.en: Mrs. Kay N. is a villager in Ka Sen village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a cake seller. Her husband, Mr. Soung Sopheap, is a motorbike driver. He faces a small problem with his motorbike. Thus, Mrs. Kay N. decided to request a loan to replace her husband’s motorbike. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She is 48 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To request for a loan to change her husband’s motorbike.

loans.name: Douch

texts.en: Mrs. Douch N. lives in the village of Brasoung in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Hem Mean, is a Prohok seller. Even though they have two different businesses they still do not make much money to improve their living conditions. Therefore Mrs. Douch N. decided to request a loan to buy a cow to add to her business. She is 29 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are attending the local school while the other two children are too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to add to her business.

loans.name: Cynthia Janeth

texts.es:
La señora Cynthia es madre soltera tiene dos hijos menores de edad que están bajo su cuidado. El negocio que ella tiene es de reciclaje de metales que obtiene de autos que fueron desechados por estar casi destruidos, en accidentes.

La señora Cynthia informo que por el momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para comprar autos para reciclar los metales y venderlos por eso está solicitando un préstamo de $750.00 dlls. Para que su negocio genere ingresos y poder darles a sus hijos una mejor forma de vivir.

Este negocio aporta varios beneficios ya que al reciclar los metales y venderlos contribuye a mejorar la ecología, además que le aporta ingresos a su familia ya a la familia de por lo menos dos empleados que le ayudan a desmantelar los autos y separar los metales para la venta.
texts.en:
Cynthia is a single mother and she has two children who are still under her care. The business that she runs is recycling of metals that she obtains from cars that have been dismantled from accidents.

Cynthia stated that for the moment she does not have the necessary capital funds to pruchase cars destined for recycling. For this she is requesting a loan in the amount of $750 US. All so that her business will generate earnings significant enough to provide her children with a better way of life.

This business carries with it many benefits. Recycling metals for resale contributes towards a healthier environment, and in adition this provides an income to her family and to at least two employees that help her dismantle and separate the metals for resale.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase old scrap cars and destroyed cars from accidents.

loans.name: Thi Thoa's Group

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị Thoa, sinh năm 1977 ( Ms 05050017), tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư kinh doanh cửa hàng bán quần áo. Chị là người hoạt bát, nhanh nhẹn, thẳng thắn và được cả nhóm vay vốn yêu mến bầu làm nhóm trưởng. Chồng chị là lái xe, hai con chị còn nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học. N.ài việc kinh doanh hàng quần áo, chị còn nhận thêm hàng chổi tre về làm tại nhà tạo thu nhập. thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 4.000.000 vnđ/ tháng. Trong nhóm vay vốn của chị còn có:
Ngô Thị Hương, sinh năm 1982 ( Ms 05050002 ), tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư làm chổi tre, chổi nan. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.000.000 vn đ/ tháng.
Tạ Thị Ly, sinh năm 1958 ( Ms 05050003 ), tham gia vay vốn mức:3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi cá, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.000.000 vn đ/ tháng.
Chử Thị Lý, sinh năm 1966 ( Ms 05050001), tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư làm chổi tre đem bán.
Lê Thị Thi, sinh năm 1973 ( Ms 05050005), tham gia vay vốn mức: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư kinh doanh chổi tre, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng: 2.500.000 vn đ / tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi Thoa (ID Number 05050017), born in 1977, would like to borrow 4,028,000VND to invest in her clothes shop. She is an active and righteous person, so she was voted to be the group leader. Her husband is a driver, whiL. her two children are still going to school. Besides having the clothes shop, she also makes bamboo brooms at home. Her family's average monthly income is about 4,000,000VND (about 250USD). Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. N. Thi Huong (ID Number 05050002 ), born in 1982, borrows 4,028,000VND to invest in making bamboo brooms. Her average monthly income is about 2,000,000VND (about 125USD).
  • Mrs. T. Thi Ly (ID Number 05050003), born in 1958, borrows 3,604,000VND to invest in raising fish. Her average monthly income is about 2,000,000VND (about 125USD).
  • Mrs. C. Thi Ly (ID Number 05050001), born in 1966, borrows 4,028,000VND to make bamboo brooms.
  • Mrs. L. Thi Thi (ID Number 05050005), born in 1973, borrows 3,604,000VND to invest in making and selling bamboo brooms. Her average monthly income is 2,500,000VND (about 156USD).

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in clothes shop

loans.name: Kry

texts.en: Mr. Kry T. lives in Ampil Village in Kandal Province and he cultivates both rice and vegetables. In this business, he now has an obstacle because the soil in his field is infertile and it affects his crop. To solve this problem, Mr. Kry T. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to support his field to make his crop more productive. His wife, Mrs. Phoeurng Soeurn, helps him on the plantation. Mr. Kry T. is 48 years old and the father of three children who are all employed in different businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support his field to make his crop more productive.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Mrs. Yem N. lives in Chek Village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Moeurn Meth, are farmers who own a 1.3 hectare field which they cultivate to earn their living. On their plantation, they now have a problem because the soil is infertile. In order to deal with this situation, Mrs. Yem N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to improve her field and she will use the rest of the loan to buy fuel for her pump to water her crop. Mrs. Yem N. is 44 years old and the mother of two children who are both employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her field and fuel to run her pump to water her crop.

loans.name: Phet

texts.en: Mrs. Phet S. is a farmer in Ampil Village in Kandal Province. She owns a 1.5 hectare field and cultivates rice. On her plantation she now faces an obstacle because her field is infertile and it affects her crop. She decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to improve her soil. Her husband, Mr. Thoeurn S., helps her on the plantation. Mrs. Phet S. is 53 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve her crop

loans.name: Ma

texts.en: Mrs. Ma S. is a villager in Ampil Village in Kandal Province. She owns a 1.2 hectare field where she plants rice to earn her living. On her plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile and this is having a negative affect on her crop. To deal with this issue, Mrs. Ma S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to improve her soil. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fuel to run her pump to water her crop. Mrs. Ma S. is 51 years old and the mother of three children. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory and the youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to improve her soil, and fuel to run her pump to water her crop

loans.name: Mrs. Khen Kunthea Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khen K. is a group leader of six who all live in Preak Roka Village in Kandal Province and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Khen K. owns a piece of land which is infertile so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Mon Bunthoeurn, is a construction worker who can generate a small income to support the family. Mrs. Khen K. is 32 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study because that child is only five years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Mrs. Chea Chanthoen Group

texts.en:
This loan group is located in Kandal Leu Village in Kandal Province and consists of five people. Mrs. Chea C. is the group leader and was selected by the members. 

Mrs Chea C. is a laborer who chops grasses for an income. Her husband, Mr. Net Chamroeun, earns money by transporting goods with his motorbike and cart. In this business he now faces a small problem because his motorbike is too old and he spends a lot of money on petroleum. In order to reduce the family's expenses, Mrs. Chea C. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a new motorbike for her husband's business. Mrs. Chea C. is 39 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a new motorbike for her husband's business.

loans.name: Sombo

texts.en: Mrs. Sombo S. is 59 year old laundry worker at the Phsa Thai Market in the province of Banteay Meanchey and earns around $3 per day. She is widowed with three children, two of whom are married, one stays in family’s home. Her son is motorcycle taxi driver and earns approximately $5 per day. Sombo lives in the Kbal Spean Village, Banteay Meanchey Province. Sambo needs a loan of $400 to purchase a new motorcycle instead existing old for her son’s business. Sambo's son is pictured because she was not available.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle instead existing old for her son’s business

loans.name: Mrs. Pech Thorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan group which is located in Veal Thom Village in Kandal Province consists of fifteen people and they plan to use the loan which they have obtained for different purposes. 

Mrs. Pech T. is the village bank president who has been selected from the members. She is a village chef’s assistant as well as a farmer. She now faces a small problem because her field is infertile and this is having a bad effect on her crop.  Therefore she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to support her field to make her crop more productive.

One member in this village bank has end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. This member is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides to support her field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Thi Chien's Group

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị Chiến, sinh năm 1969 (Ms 23070095 ), tham gia vay vốn mức vay 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi vịt, thả cá. Vợ chồng chị có 3 con còn nhỏ. Gia đình chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp, tăng gia sản xuất. Nhà chị có 1 ao cá, 1000 con vịt đẻ trứng. Trứng vịt được bán lẻ theo ngày cộng thêm các khoản thu khác đem lại thu nhập cho gia đình chị khoảng 100.000 đến 200.000 vnđ/ ngày. Với thu nhập ổn định theo ngày như vậy rất phù hợp và thuận tiện cho những khoản vay trả tuần nên vợ chồng chị rất thích. Với mức vay lần này từ tài chính vi mô Binh Minh, vợ chồng chị tiếp tục đầu tư phát triểm chuồng trại. Cùng vay với chị còn có:
Đào Thị Thắm, sinh năm 1973 (ms 23070074), tham gia mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi vịt.
Đào Thị Thanh, sinh năm 1958 (Ms 23070114), tham gia mức vay: 2.204.000 vnđ để đầu tư trồng cây ăn quả.
Đào Thị Kim, sinh năm 1972 (Ms 23070113), tham gia mức vay: 2.204.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ.
Nguyễn Thị Huê, sinh năm 1971 (Ms 23070070 ), tham gia mức vay: 3.180.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi vịt.
Lê Xuân Hoà, sinh năm 1978 (Ms 23070072 ), tham gia vay mức 4.876.000 vnđ để kinh doanh cửa hàng bán ga.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi Chien (ID Number 23070095), born in 1969, would like to borrow 4,028,000VND to invest in raising ducks and fish. She has three littL. children. Her family mainly relies on agriculture for a living. They have one fish pond and 1000 breeding ducks. Duck eggs retailed every day, together with other sources of income, bring back a total daily income of 100,000 to 200,000VND (about 6USD to 12USD). With this stabL. daily income, it is very convenient for her family to repay the loans on a weekly basis. Thus, her family is very keen on borrowing through the SEDA Fund. With the loans obtained, her family has been investing on renovating the breeding facilities. The group also consists of:
  • Mrs. D. Thi Tham (ID Number 23070074), born in 1973, borrows 4,028,000VND to invest in raising ducks.
  • Mrs. D. Thi Thanh (ID Number 23070114), born in 1958, borrows 2,204,000VND to invest in planting fruit trees.
  • Mrs. D. Thi Kim (ID Number 23070113), born in 1972, borrows 2,204,000VND to do business in the market.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Hue (ID Number 23070070), born in 1971, borrows 3,180,000VND to invest in raising ducks.
  • Mr. L. Xuan Hoa (ID Number 23070072), born in 1978, borrows 4,876,000VND to invest in selling cooking gas.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising ducks and fish

loans.name: Thi Hien's Group

texts.vi:
Vũ Thị Hiến, sinh năm 1971 (Ms 23060006), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Là một giáo viên nhưng chị vẫn tăng ra sản xuất cùng chồng. Ngoài công việc giảng dậy, chị vẫn chịu khó chăn nuôi thêm lợn để tăng thu nhập và nuôi hai con còn nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.500.000 vnđ/ tháng. Cùng vay vốn với chị còn có:
Đào Thị Mai, sinh năm 1966 (Ms 23060007), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Chị là giáo viên thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.500.000 vnđ / tháng.
Lê Thị Liên, sinh năm 1964(Ms 23060009), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn, gà.
Đào Thị Lý, sinh năm 1977(Ms 23060011), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng cơ khí.
Nguyễn Thị Thảo, sinh năm 1980(Ms 23060033), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 2.204.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn.
texts.en:
Mrs. V. Thi Hien (ID Number 23060006), born in 1971, would like to borrow 4,452,000VND to invest in rearing pigs. Even though she is a teacher, she still performs agricultural tasks with her husband. Besides teaching in school, she rears pigs to increase her family's income and raise her two children who are still going to school. He family's average monthly income is about 3,500,000VND (about 219USD). Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. D. Thi Mai (ID Number 23060007), born in 1966, borrows 4,452,000VND to invest in raising livestock. She is also a teacher. Her family's average monthly income is about 2,500,000VND (about 156USD).
  • Mrs. L. Thi Lien (ID Number 23060009), born in 1964, borrows 4,452,000VND to invest in rearing pigs and chickens.
  • Mrs. D. Thi Ly (ID Number 23060011), born in 1977, borrows 4,028,000VND to sell electrical goods.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Thao (ID Number 23060033), born in 1980, borrows 2,204,000VND to invest in rearing pigs.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rearing pigs

loans.name: Mrs. Phann Yoeurn's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group, which consists of twenty-six members, is located in Preak Reang Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Phann Y. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. 

Mrs. Phann Y. is a pig breeder and is raising two pigs. Her husband, Mr. Pheth Mouv, is a fisherman who  gathers small fish, but does not have enough fishnets to catch the fish. Thus, his wife, Mrs. Phann Y., decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets for her husband's business. Mrs. Phann Y. has a child who is employed in a garment factory. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Thirteen members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets for her husband's business.

loans.name: Thi Hien's Group

texts.vi:
Vũ Thị Hiên, sinh năm 1948(Ms 23060014), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.876.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Hàng ngày, cô đi chợ bán hoa quả thu nhập khoảng 50.000 vnđ/ ngày. Các con cô đã lớn và đi làm có thu nhập khoảng 2.500.000 đến 3.000.000 vnđ/ tháng. Cô rất thích cách hoàn trả vốn dần vì nó rất thuận tiện và phù hợp với khả năng gia đình cô và cô mong muốn tham gia vay vốn lâu dài. Trong nhóm vay của cô còn có:
Tạ Thị Minh Tâm, sinh năm 1978 (Ms 23060017), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Hàng ngày chị đi làm thuê thu nhập khoảng 50.000 đến 75.000 vnđ/ ngày.
Năng Thị Mai,.sinh năm 1976 (Ms 23060026), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Chị có thu nhập ổn định theo tháng, trung bình khoảng 1.500.000 vnđ / tháng.
Nguyễn Thị Thành, sinh năm 1979 (Ms 23060029), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ và chăn nuôi.
Hoàng Thị Hòa, sinh năm 1975(Ms 23060018), tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi lợn.
texts.en:
Mrs. V. Thi Hien (ID Number 23060014), born in 1948, would like to borrow 4,876,000VND to rear pigs. Everyday, she also sells fruits at the local market, earning about 50,000VND (around 3.00USD) a day. Her children are all grown up and have stable monthly income of about 2,500,000 to 3,000,000 VND (about 156USD to 187USD). Mrs. Hien is really keen on repaying the loan on an installment basis because it is very suitable and convenient for her family. She would like to continue borrowing for a long period of time. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. T. Thi Minh Tam (ID Number 23060017), born in 1978, borrows 4,028,000VND to rear pigs. Everyday, she also works as a hired worker with the daily income of 50,000VND to 75,000VND (about 3USD to 5USD).
  • Mrs. N. Thi Mai (ID Number 23060026), born in 1976, borrows 4,028,000VND to rear pigs. She has a stable monthly income of 1,500,000VND (about 94USD).
  • Mrs. N. Thi Thanh (ID Number 23060029), born in 1979, borrows 3,604,000VND to raise livestock and do business at the local market.
  • Mrs. H. Thi Hoa (ID Number 23060018), born in 1975, borrows 4,028,000VND to rear pigs.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rearing pigs

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Mrs. Yon S., 46, is widowed and earns around $2.5 as a nurse in the Kbal Spean Village, Banteay Meanchey Province. Yon lives with her two children, one of whom stays home and studying, another one is a motorcycle taxi driver. Her income is not regular depending on customers’ need, S. her son decided to work driving motorcycle taxi to help support family’s expenses. Because of her son's old motorcycle, and income is declined, Yon asks for a loan of $400 for her son business to purchase a new motorcycle to change the old.

loans.use: for her son business to purchase a new motorcycle to change the old

loans.name: Thi Hong Hoang Group

texts.vi:
Hoàng Thị Hồng, sinh năm 1954 (Ms 23060023 ), mức vốn vay: 4.876.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn, gà . Cô hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con. Hai con cô đều có việc làm và có thu nhập theo tháng. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình cô khoảng : 4.000.000 vnđ/ tháng. Hàng ngày, ngoài công việc chăn nuôi và đồng áng, cô còn tìm những việc làm thêm như phu hồ, khuân vác,… để có thêm thu nhập. Kinh tế gia đình cô còn eo hẹp nên vợ chồng cô luôn cố gắng làm việc và mong được vay vốn thường xuyên để phát triển, nâng cao mức sống. Cùng vay vốn với cô còn có:

     Nguyễn Thị Hoa, sinh năm 1972 (Ms 23060020 ), mức vốn vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ.
     Lê Thị Tôn, sinh năm 1950 (Ms 23060021 ), mức vốn vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ.
     Trần Thị Thanh, sinh năm 1982 (Ms 23060022 ), mức vốn vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ.
     Đào Thị Xuyến, sinh năm 1964 (Ms 23060025 ), mức vốn vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn.
     Nguyễ Thị Sáu, sinh năm 1959 (Ms 23060032 ), mức vốn vay: 4.028.0000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn.
     Nguyễn Thị Hạnh, sinh năm 1974 (Ms 23060034), mức vốn vay: 2.204.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng may mặc tại nhà.

loans.use: chăn nuôi

loans.name: Thi Bich Lien Hoang Group

texts.vi:
Hoàng Thị Bích Liên, sinh năm 1965 (Ms 10040047 ), mức vốn vay: 1.972.000 vn đ để đầu tư cửa hàng tạp hoá. Chồng chị là bộ đội, hai con chị còn nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học. Gia đình chị có cửa hàng tạp hoá phục vụ bà con trong làng, cung cấp những mặt hàng như: phân bón, gạo, chè, rượu, bia, bánh, kẹo,….Bên cạnh đó chị còn tăng gia sản xuất, chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 100.000 đến 150.000 vnđ/ ngày. Chính những nguồn thu nhập thường xuyên theo ngày như vậy nên rất phù hợp với cách hoàn trả tuần của tổ  chức tài chính vi mô Bình Minh. Cùng vay vốn với chị còn có: 

Nguyễn Thi Hằng, sinh năm 1969 (Ms 10040048 ), mức vốn vay: 1.972.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng cắt tóc.
Hoàng Thị Bích Dịu, sinh năm 1975 (Ms 10040049 ), mức vốn vay: 1.972.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà.
Đồng Thị Hiệp, sinh năm 1965 (Ms 10040050 ), mức vốn vay: 1.972.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi vịt, gà, ngỗng.
Nguyễn Thị Kim Oanh, sinh năm 1978 (Ms 100400 ), mức vốn vay: 1.972.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ rau.
Nguyễn Thị Cầm, sinh năm 1974 (Ms 10040051 ), mức vốn vay: 1.972.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng may mặc.

loans.use: buôn bán nhỏ

loans.name: Savan

texts.en: Mr. Savan B., age 28, earns about $10 per day making money transfers for Cambodians who work in neighboring Thailand. His wife, Mrs. Channy Nit, is a grocery seller who earns about $5 per day. Together, they live with their two children, who are students. The family lives in the Kbal Spean village in the Banteay Meanchey province. Savan now asks for a loan of $1200 to increase capital for his money transfer business. The loan will help him improve his family’s income and support his children’s school fees in the future. Savan's wife is pictured because he was not available at the time.

loans.use: To increase capital for his money transfer business

loans.name: Gusti Ayu Biang Sumitri

texts.id: Pada periode ke II Gusti Ayu Biang Sumitri masih tetap memelihara ternak babi. Karena hanya itulah dapat dikerjakan sekaligus dapat meenghasilkan pendapatan untuk mencukupi keperluan seharinya. Pada periode I dana pinjaman dipergunakan untuk membeli induk, maka pada periode selanjutkan hanya mengembangkan induknya sehinga dapat menghasilkan bibit babi yang bagus.Walau sudah memiliki induk, dana pinjaman pada periode dipakai untuk membeli 4 ekor bibit babi untuk dipelihara untuk babi guling dan pengggemukan dengan rencana pada saat pelunasan sudah mempunyai dana cadangan.
texts.en:
Gusti Ayu Biang is applying for second loan for her pig farm. her farm has provided ample supplemental income. She used the first loan to purchase a breeding pig. She is going to use the current loan to continue develop this breeder so that it produces better quality piglets. She will also use the loan to purchase 4 piglets to be raised and later slaughtered and sold to local restaurants and use the proceeds to repay the loan.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase piglets

loans.name: Ni Komang Sunistri

texts.id:
Ni Komang Sunistri masih tetap berharap dari usaha ternak  ayam kampung  yang sudah lama ditekuni. Periode   terdahulu Ni Komang Sunistri mengalami kerugian karena pada saat itu terjadi musibah penyakit Flu Burung sehingga penghasilan maupun pemasaran ayam dan telornya kurang maksimal. Segala upaya sudah dicoba untuk menangkal terjangkitnya virus itu, baik penyemprotan maupun penyuntikan. Hasilnya pun masih belum maksimal.
Untuk periode ke II dana Pinjaman dari Yayasan DINARI dipakai untuk memperbaiki usaha beternak ayamnya yang sudah ditekuni. Karena kandang sudah ayam sudah ada dana dipakai untuk menambah  jumlah ayam yang sudah mulai produktif menghasilkan telor dan untuk biaya pakan. Pakan ayam terdiri dedak padi, jagung dan konsetrat. Hasil penjulan telor dalam sehari dapat mencapai Rp. 500.000,- Harga telur per butir Rp. 1.000.- Keuntungan per butir Rp. 100.- Jadi penjualan Rp. 500.000.- Ni Komang Sunistri mendapat keuntungan Rp. 50.000,- Dari keuntungan inilah Ni Komang Sunistri dapat membantu penghasilan suaminya dan dapat membiayai kedua anaknya.
texts.en:
Ni Komang Sunistri is in the business of raising chicken (poultry farming). In the last loan period, she experienced a loss due to the avian flu that impacted her business.

In this 2nd loan period, she wants to use the loan money to rebuild her poultry business. She uses the money to buy more chickens so she can get more eggs. She also spends the money to buy poultry food.

She can earn IDR 500 thousand per day (around USD 52/ day) from selling eggs. From this she can earn a net profit of IDR 50 thousand (USD 5.2/ day). With this she can help to ease her husband's economic burden and also to raise their two children.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken and to fix the cage (Membeli anak ayam dan memperbaiki kandang)

loans.name: Ni Kadek Ariani

texts.id:
Usaha warung Ni Kadek Ariani sudah cukup menjanjikan untuk dapat menopang ekonomi dalam keluarganya selain dari pendapatan suaminya.
Untuk periode kedua dana pinjaman dari Yayasan Dinari dipakai untuk menambah modal usahanya. Seperti biasa Ni Kadek Ariani membuka warung sejak pukul 06.00 pagi dan tutup pada pukul 07.00 sore. Waktu untuk menunggui warungnya kadang dipergunakan untuk menyelesaikan pekerjaan dirumahnya seperti memasak, mencuci dan merawat anaknya yang masih kecil. Walaupun seharian Ni Kadek Ariani menunggui warung namun tidak pernah melupakan segala keperluan suaminya sebelum berangkat bekerja sebagi tukang maupun setelah pulang bekerja. Keuntungan bersih dalam sehari dapat mencapai Rp. 30.000,- s/d Rp.40.000,- cukup  dapat membantu pendapatan suaminya dan keperluan anaknya yang masih balita.Usaha warung ini ditekuninya dengan harapan  kedepannya  warung dapat lebih meningkat dan lebih besar lagi.
texts.en:
Ni Kadek Ariani opens a small stall that sells daily necessities such as snack, cooking ingredients, rice, coffee, etc.

For this 2nd loan period, she wants to use the loan money from Dinari foundation to add her working capital. She opens her small stalls at 6 am until 7 pm. During the day she usually also does house chores such as cooking, does laundry and taking care of her children.

She can earn IDR 30 thousand to IDR 40 thousand/ day (around USD 3-4/ day). This business provides money to ease her family's economic burden.

She is hoping to be able to expand her business.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah modal usaha)

loans.name: Jero Putu Widiantari

texts.id:
Jero Putu Widiantari baru kali ini mendapat keksempatan untuk mendapatkan pinjaman modal yang diberikan oleh yaysan DINARI melalui tempek I Manistutu.
Dana trsebut dupergunakan untuk membeli bibit babi yang nantinya akan dipelihara secara penggemukan.
